eng: 11 feb 2010honorouble speaker.
tso: 11 feb 2010muhlonipheki xipikara.

eng: we welcome in particular those who have travelled from abroad to be here, helene pastoors, michael dingake from botswana, mr andimba toivo ya toivo of swapo in namibia.
tso: tata wa hina, khale ka phuresidente kenneth kaunda wa le zambiakhale ka swandla swa vaphuresidente.

eng: we have also set ambitious targets for skills development, to produce additional engineers and technicians, and to increase the number of qualified mathematics and science teachers.
tso: wana, yi ta languta eka ku teka xiave ka vatumbuluxi va gezi vo tiyimela, na ku sirhelela swisiwana eka ku tlakuka ka tihakelo ta gezi.

eng: we must also increase the number of youth who enter learnerships in the privateand public sectors.
tso: hi ta tumbuluxa mutirhani na tisisteme wo tiyimela, wa le tlhelo ka eskom holdings.

eng: this includes building and upgrading hospitals and clinics, and further improving the working conditions of healthcare workers.
tso: ku ta vekiwa swibumabumelo swo pfuna hi tihakelo to thola vatirhi vantshwa, ku hlohlotela tifeme ku thola vatirhi lava nga riki na ntokoto.

eng: we are also collaborating with the dbsa and the industrial development corporation, in a public-private partnership programme to improve hospitals and provide finance for projects.
tso: leswi swi katsa switirhisiwa swa laha kaya na tiphurojeke ta ku dyondza ku tsala na ku hlaya, vuhlayisi bya le kaya, matshalatshala ya ku hlayisiwa ka swikolo na nhluvukiso wa vana va ha ri vantsongo.

eng: municipalities must improve the provision of housing, water, sanitation, electricity, waste management and roads.
tso: hilaha mi tivaka, hi tibohile eka swikongomiwa swa ntlhanu: dyondzo, rihanyo, nhluvukiso wa matikoxikaya na ku cinca vun?

eng: honourable members,we continue our efforts to eradicate corruption and fraud in procurement and tender processes, and in applications for drivers’ licences, social grants and identity documents, among others.
tso: hi vona ku lwisana na ku tekeriwa timovha (ku hayijeka), vukhamba bya mabindzu na le makaya, xikan?

eng: through the speaker, we have invited a multiparty delegation from parliament to visit the call centre, so that mps can get a first-hand account of the work done.
tso: endzhaku ka rendzo ra le balfour, hi rhumerile xipano xa vaholobye va kaye ku endzela ndzawu leyi ku ya langutisana na mhaka leyi boxiwaka hi vaakatiko.

eng: honourable speaker of the national assembly,chairperson of the national council of provinces.
tso: 13 feb 2014muhlonipheki xipikara xa huvo ya rixaka,mutshamaxitulu wa huvo ya rixaka ya swifundzhankulu.

eng: deputy speaker of the national assembly and deputy chairperson of the ncop.
tso: xandla xa xipikara xa huvo ya rixaka na xandla xa mutshamaxitulu wa ncop.

eng: deputy president of the republic, honourable kgalema motlanthe.
tso: xandla xa phuresidente wa rhiphabuliki, muhlonipheki kgalema motlanthe.

eng: former deputy president baleka mbethe,honourable chief justice of the republic, and all esteemed members of the judiciary.
tso: khale ka xandla xa phuresidente baleka mbethe,muhlonipheki muavanyisinkulu wa rhiphabuliki, na swirho hinkwaswo swo hlonipheka swa vululami.

eng: honourable ministers and deputy ministers,distinguished premiers and speakers of our provinces.
tso: vahlonipheki vaholobye na swandla swa va holobye,tiphirimiya na swipikara swo hlawuleka swa swifundzhankulu swa hina.

eng: chairperson of salga, and all local government leadership.
tso: mutshamaxitulu wa salga, na vurhangeri bya mimfumo hinkwayo ya miganga.

eng: chairperson of the national house of traditional leaders.
tso: mutshamaxitulu wa yindlu ya rixaka ya varhangeri va xintu.

eng: the governor of the reserve bank,leaders from business, sports, traditional, religious and all sectors,members of the diplomatic corps, special and distinguished guests,honourable members,fellow south africans,good evening, sanibonani, molweni, dumelang, riperile, ndimadekwana, goeienaand.
tso: tinhloko ta minhlangano ya xiyenge xa 9. gavhenara wa bangi ya tiko,varhangeri va swa mabindzu, swa mintlangu, swa ndzhavuko, swa vukhongeri na swiyenge hinkwaswo,swirho swa minhlangano ya xidipilomati, vayeni va xiyimo xa le henhla na lavo hlawuleka,swirho swo hlonipheka,vaakatiko kulorhi,good evening, sanibonani, molweni, dumelang, riperile, ndimadekwana, goeienaand.

eng: i wish to thank the presiding officers for this opportunity to speak to the people of south africa, on this occasion of the last state of the nation address, of the fourth democratic administration.
tso: ndzi rhandza ku khensa vafambisi hi nkarhi lowu ku vulavula na vanhu va afrika dzonga, eka ntirho lowu wo hetelela wa mbulavulo hi xiyimo xa rixaka, eka vulawuri bya vumune bya xidemokirasi.

eng: i would like to extend our deepest condolences on the passing of the late honourable mr ben skhosana, one of the longest serving and most senior members of this august house and our former minister of correctional services.
tso: ndzi rhandza ku yisa marungula yo chavelela eka ku hundza emisaveni ka muhlonopheki tatana ben skhosana, wun’we wa swirho leswi nga tirha nkarhi wo leha no va xirho xikulukumba swinene xa yindlu leyi ya mhawuri no va khale ka holobyenkulu wa swa makhotso.

eng: we are truly saddened by his sudden passing.
tso: ku hundza ka yena hi xitshuketana swi hi tsanisile hi ntiyiso.

eng: sidlulisa ukukhala kwethu emndenini wakhe, nakumholi we ifp ushenge, kanye namalunga onke e-ifp.
tso: hi hundzisa minchavelelo leyi sukaka etimbilwini ta hina eka ndyangu wa yena na le ka murhangeri wa ifp, shenge, na le ka swirho hinkwaswo swa ifp.

eng: )honourable speaker,honourable chairperson of the ncop,this is the first state of the nation address to take place in the absence of our founding president, his excellency nelson rolihlahla mandela.
tso: muhlonipheki xipikara,muhlonipheki mutshamaxitulu wa ncop,lowu i mbulavulo hi xiyimo xa rixaka lowu humelelaka musunguri wa hina phuresidente, muhlonipheki nelson rolihlahla mandela a nga ha ri kona.

eng: his passing, on the eve of the 20th year of our freedom and democracy,caused untold pain to our people and beyond our borders.
tso: ku hundza ka yena, hi ri kusuhi na malembe ya 20 ya ntshuxeko na xidemokirasi xa hina, ku endlile gome leri nga vulekiki eka vanhu va hina na ku tlula mindzilekano ya hina.

eng: we find solace in the knowledge that madiba will live forever be in our hearts, and that we have a duty to take his legacy forward.
tso: hi kuma ku chaveleleka hi ku tiva leswaku madiba u ta hanya etimbilwini ta hina hi laha ku nga heriki, na leswaku hi na ntirho wo yisa mfuwo wa yena emahlweni.

eng: honourable members,our country has produced men and women of distinction, who have provided leadership during trying times.
tso: swirho swo hlonipheka,tiko ra hina ri humesile vavasati na vavanuna va xiyimo xa le henhla swinene, lava a va nyika vurhangeri hi minkarhi yo tika.

eng: one such leader was mr moses kotane, former treasurer-general of the anc and former sacp general secretary.
tso: murhangeri wo tani wun’we a ku ri tatana moses kotane, khale ka mukhomi wa nkwana jenerala wa anc na khale ka matsalaninkulu wa sacp.

eng: we are honouredto have his dear wife, mama rebecca kotane, as our special guest this evening.
tso: hi hloniphekile ku va hi ri na nsati wa yena, mama rebecca kotane, tani hi muyeni wo hlawuleka madyambu lawa.

eng: mama kotane turned 102 years old yesterday, and we wish her all the best.
tso: mama kotane wa ha ku khoma 102 wa malembe tolo, naswona hi n’wi navelela hinkwaswo swa kahle.

eng: we also pay tribute to the former anc president mr oliver tambo, who kept the torch of freedom alive both at home and abroad during the most difficult times of our struggle.
tso: hi xixima nakambe khale ka phuresidente wa anc tatana oliver tambo, loyi a nga endla leswaku thoci ra ntshuxeko ri hanya laha kaya na le matikweni mambe hi minkarhi ya hina yo tika swinene ya tinyimpi.

eng: his son, dali and his wife rachel are sharing this occasion with us this evening.
tso: n’wana wa yena wa jaha, dali na nsati wa yena rachel va na hina eka ntirho lowu madyambu lawa.

eng: we salute solomon mahlangu, a brave young man who went defiantly to the gallows in 1979 where he was executed at the age of 23. he said: “my blood will nourish the tree that will bear the fruits of freedom.
tso: hi xixima solomon mahlangu, muntshwa wa xinuna loyi a nga yisiwa exikerweni hi 1979 laha a nga dlawa eka malembe ya 23. u vurile a ku: “ngati ya mina yi ta cheleta nsinya lowu nga ta tswala mihandzu ya ntshuxeko.

eng: tell my people that i love them.
tso: byelani vanhu va mina leswaku ndza va rhandza.

eng: they must continue the fight’’.
tso: va fanele ku ya emahlweni va lwa’’.

eng: we are honoured to host his mother, mama martha mahlangu and her grand-daughter bathabile.
tso: hi xiximekile ku va hi rhurhela manana wa yena, mama martha mahlangu na ntukulu wa yena bathabile.

eng: the year 2014 also marks the 40th anniversary of the cowardly murder through a parcel bomb, of student leader, abram onkgopotse tiro in 1974 in botswana.
tso: lembe ra 2014 ri fungha malembe ya 40 ya ku dlawa hi vuntlunya hi bomo ya phasele, murhangeri wa xichudeni, abram onkgopotse tiro hi 1974 ebotswana.

eng: we welcome his brother, mogomotsi tiro to this occasion.
tso: hi amukela buti wa yena, mogomotsi tiro eka ntirho lowu.

eng: we express the gratitude of the people, for his brother’s selfless sacrifice.
tso: hi kombisa ku khensa eka vanhu, eka ku tinyikelela ka buti wa yena.

eng: we remember those who died in state-sponsored violence of the 1980s and 1990s in our townships and villages.
tso: hi tsundzuka lava nga lova eka madzolonga lawa a ya kondleteriwile hi mfumu hi va 1980 na 1990 emalokhixini na le matikoxikaya ya hina.

eng: ms jabu ndlovu, a former shopsteward of the national union of metalworkers of south africa (numsa), was gunned down in 1988 in pietermaritzburg together with her husband jabulani and their son.
tso: manana jabu ndlovu, khale ka mufambisi wa nhlangano wa rixaka wa vatirhi hi tinsimbhi wa afrika dzonga (numsa), u duvuriwile hi 1988 epietermaritzburg na nuna wa yena jabulani na n’wana wa vona wa mufana.

eng: we welcome her daughter luhle and son, sanele, and pay tribute to all families who lost their loved ones, across the political spectrum.
tso: hi amukela n’wana wa yena wa nhwanyana luhle na wa mufana, sanele, hi yisa ku xixima eka mindyangu leyi nga lahlekeriwa hi varhandziwa va vona, exivandleni xa tipolitiki.

eng: honourable speaker,honourable chairperson of the ncop,we were able to overcome all that pain of the past and build a new society.
tso: muhlonipheki xipikara,muhlonipheki mutshamaxitulu wa ncop,hi ta kota ku hlula ku twa ku vava hinkwako ka khale no aka vaakatiko hi vuntshwa.

eng: we have built strong institutions of democracy.
tso: hi akile mihlangano ya matimba ya xidemokirasi.

eng: we buried the undemocratic, unrepresentative, oppressive and corrupt state that was serving a minority.
tso: hi lahlile mfumu wo kala xidemokirasi, wo ka wu nga yimeleki, wo tshikelela no va na vukungundwana lowu a wu tirhela vanhu vantsongo.

eng: we formed a unitary, non-racial, non-sexist democratic state, answerable to and representative of all south africans.
tso: hi vumbile nhlangano, wo pfumala xihlawula mbala, xo pfumala xihlawuhlawu xa rimbewu eka mfumu wa xidemokirasi, lowu tihlamulelaka eka vaaki hinkwavo va afrika dzonga.

eng: we created a thriving constitutional democracy, with well-functioning arms of the state –the legislature, the executive and the judiciary.
tso: hi tumbuluxile xidemokirasi xa vumbiwa lexi kulaka swinene, hi mavoko lawa ya tirhaka kahle ya mfumu – palamende ya xifundzhankulu, varhangerinkulu na va swa milawu.

eng: we have chapter 9 institutions which support democracy and protect the rights of citizens.¬liberation and democracy have also created space for an active civil society and a free media.
tso: hi na minhlangano ya xiyenge xa 9 leyi seketelaka xidemokirasi no sirhelela timfanelo ta vaaki.­ntshuxeko na xidemokirasi swi tumbuluxile ndzhawu ya vaakatiko na vuhangalasi bya mahungu lebyi nga ntshuxeka.

eng: liberation also brought for the first time, the promise of gender equality.
tso: ntshuxeko wo sungula wu tisile, xitshembhiso xa ndzingano wa rimbewu.

eng: the representation of women in public institutions has increased considerably since the dawn of freedom, and the extension of basic services also benefits women.
tso: ku yimeriwa ka vavasati eka minhlangano yo ka yi nga ri ya mfumu ku engetelekile swinene hi mpfhuka ku sungurile ntshuxeko, ku engeteleka ka vukorhokeri bya masungulo ku vuyerisa vavasati.

eng: all these attributes have made south africa a much better place to live in now than it has ever been.
tso: leswi hinkwaswo swi endlile leswaku afrika dzonga ri va ndzhawu yo antswa ku tlula leswi a ri ri xiswona.

eng: however, our country still faces the triple challenge of poverty, inequality and unemployment, which we continue to grapple with.
tso: hambiswiritano, tiko ra hina ra ha langutane na swiphiqo swinharhu swa vusweti, mpfumaleko wa ndzingano no pfumaleka ka mintirho, leswi hi ya ka emahlweni hi hlangana na swona.

eng: dealing with these challenges has become a central focus of all democratic administrations.
tso: ku tirhana na swiphiqo leswi swi hundzukile xikongomiso xikarhi xa vulawuri hinkwabyo bya xidemokirasi.

eng: we elected to focus on five priorities, education, health, the fight against crime and corruption, rural development and land reform as well as creating decent work.
tso: hi hlawurile ku kongomisa eka swirhangana swa ntlhanu, dyondzo, rihanyu, ku lwa na vugevenga na vukungundwana, nhluvukiso wa matikoxikaya na ku aka misava hi vuntshwa na ku tumbuluxa mintirho yo khomeka.

eng: we also reorganised the state to improve performance.
tso: hi lulamisile nakambe mfumu ku antswisa matirhele.

eng: we created two key functions, long term planning as well as monitoring and evaluation.
tso: hi tumbuluxile mintirho mimbirhi ya nkoka, ku pulana ka nkarhi wo leha ku katsa na nandzeleriso na nhlahluvo.

eng: we established the national planning commission which produced the landmark national development plan, the country’s socio-economic blueprint and one of the major achievements of this fourth administration.
tso: hi tumbuluxile khomixini ya rixaka yo pulana leyi nga humesa pakani ya pulani ya nhluvukiso wa rixaka, xifaniso xa ikhonomi ya vanhu va tiko na ku humelela kun’we ku kulu ka vulawuri lebyi bya vumune.

eng: the plan outlines what we should do to eradicate poverty, increase employment and reduce inequality by 2030. our monitoring and evaluation indicates that many services continue to improve.
tso: pulani yi hlamusela leswi hi fanaleke ku swi endla ku va hi hunguta vusiwana, ku engetela mintirho no hunguta ku pfumaleka ka ndzingano hi 2030. nandzeleriso na nhlahluvo wa hina swi komba leswaku vukorhokeri bya hina byi ya emahlweni byi antswa.

eng: for example, social grants and identity documents now take a shorter time to be processed.
tso: xikombiso, mali ya mpfuneto wa vanhu na mapasi sweswi swi teka nkarhi wuntsongo ku endliwa.

eng: but many others still require further work.
tso: kambe swin’wana swa ha lava ntirho ku ya emahlweni.

eng: i will report back on the five priorities, starting with the economy.
tso: ndzi ta vika eka swirhangana swa ntlhanu, ku sungula hi ikhonomi.

eng: on average, the economy has grown at 3,2 percent a year from 1994 to 2012 despite the global recession which claimed a million jobs.
tso: hi nhlayo xikarhi, ikhonomi yi kurile hi 3.2 wa tiphesente hi lembe ku sukela hi 1994 ku fikela hi 2012 handle ka ku tikeriwa ka misava loku nga herisa mintirho ya mamiliyoni.

eng: working together as government, business, labour and the community sector, we nursed the economy to a recovery.
tso: ku tirha swin’we tani hi mfumu, mabindzu, mintirho na mabindzu ya vaaki, hi ongorile ikhonomi leswaku yi pfuka.

eng: the national wealth, measured in terms of gdp, has grown to more than 3.5 trillion rand.
tso: rifuwo ra rixaka, leri pimiwaka hi gdp, ri kurile ku tlula 3,5 wa tithiriliyoni ya tirhandi.

eng: jobs are now being created again.
tso: sweswi mintirho yi le ku tumbuluxiweni nakambe.

eng: there are now 15 million people with jobs in the country, the highest ever in our history, and over 650 thousand jobs were created last year, according to stats sa.
tso: sweswi ku na vanhu va mamiliyoni ya 15 lava nga na mintirho laha tikweni, leswi ku nga nhlayo ya le henhla loko hi langute eka matimu ya hina, naswona ku tlula mintirho ya 650 000 yi tumbuluxiwile lembe leri nga hundza, hi ku ya hi va tinhlayo ta afrika dzonga.

eng: this is still not good enough.
tso: leswi a swi tsakisi ngopfu.

eng: the unemployment rate still remains high.
tso: nhlayo ya vanhu lava nga pfumalaka mintirho ya ha ri ehenhla.

eng: youth unemployment in south africa continues to be of concern, as it is throughout the world.
tso: ku pfumaleka ka mintirho eka vantshwa eafrika dzonga swi ya emahlweni swi va xiphiqo, tani hi leswi swi nga xiswona emisaveni hinkwayo.

eng: we are taking a number of measures, including the employment tax incentive act which encourages employers to hire younger workers.
tso: hi le ku tekeni ka magoza yo hlaya, ku katsa nawu wa timali to pfuneta ta xibalo leti hlohlotelaka vathori ku thola vatirhi lavantsongo.

eng: regulations will be passed to ensure that this does not affect unsubsidized or older workers adversely.
tso: milawu yi ta pasisiwa ku tiyisisa leswaku leswi a swi khumbhi lava pfumalaku sabusidi kumbe vatirhi lavakulu.

eng: further measures are contained in the national youth accord that was signed in soweto last april.
tso: matshalatshala yan’wana ya tsariwile eka ntwanano wa rixaka wa vantshwa lowu nga sayiniwa hi dzivamisoko esoweto.

eng: the expanded public works programme and the community work programme continue to be an effective cushion for the poor and the youth.
tso: phurogireme yo engeteleriwa ya mintirho ya vanhu na phurogireme ya mintirho ya vaaki ti ya emahlweni ti va xiseketelo xa lava nga swela na vantshwa.

eng: we have created 3,7 million work opportunities over the past five years.
tso: hi tumbuluxile 3,7 wa mamiliyoni ya mintirho eka malembe ya ntlhanu lawa ya nga hundza.

eng: our people obtain an income and skills from the public works programme, which they use to seek formal employment.
tso: vanhu va hina va kuma miholo na vuswikoti ku suka eka phurogireme ya mintirho ya vanhu, leyi va yi tirhisaka ku kuma mintirho ya ximfumu.

eng: cabinet has set a target of 6 million work opportunities from this year to 2019, targeting the youth.
tso: khabinete yi vekile xikongomiso xa mamiliyoni ya ntsevu ya mintirho ku sukela lembe leri ku fikela hi 2019, yi kongomise eka vantshwa.

eng: our social assistance programme which now reaches about 16 million people, provides a safety for millions, especially vulnerable children.
tso: phurogireme ya hina ya mpfuneto wa vanhu leyi sweswi yi fikelelaka vanhu va mamiliyoni ya 16, yi nyika vuhlayiseki eka vanhu va mamiliyoni, ngopfu ngopfu eka vana lava khumbhekaka.

eng: (many households are benefiting from government grants which are child support grants, pension as well as disability grants.
tso: miminti yo hlaya ya vuyerisa ku suka eka timali ta mpfuneto to suka eka mfumu leswi ku nga mali ya nhlayiso wa vana, phenceni na timali ta vatsoniwa.

eng: (government will continue paying out these grants because many households highly depend on them since job opportunities are scarce during these trying times of an economic downturn.
tso: mfumu wu ta ya emahlweni wu hakela timali leti hikuva miminti yo hlaya yi pfuneka ku suka eka tona hi ku va mintirho ya kala swinene eka minkarhi leyi yo tika laha ikhonomi yi nga wa.

eng: (these opportunities, which are made available by government, are enabling us to proudly say that we are currently living in a country that is far better compared to the one we lived in before 1994.
tso: minkarhi leyi yi nyikiwile hi mfumu, naswona yi hi kotisa ku vula hi ku tinyungubyisa leswaku hi hanya eka tiko leri antswaka loko hi fananisa na leri a hi hanya eka rona ku nga si fika 1994. vanghana,ha ha ri eka nkahi wo tika.

eng: developments in the united states economy have led to a rapid depreciation in the emerging market currencies, including the rand.
tso: leswi humelelaka eka ikhonomi ya united states swi yisile ehansi hi xitshuketana timali leti ta ha kulaka etimakete, ku katsa na rhandi.

eng: during the course of 2013, the rand depreciated by 17.6 per cent against the us dollar.
tso: hi nkarhi wa 2013, rhandi yi yi le ehansi hi tiphesente ta 17.6 loko ku fananisiwa na dolara ya us.

eng: the weaker exchange rate poses a significant risk to inflation and will also make our infrastructure programme more expensive.
tso: nhlayo ya cincano lowo vevuka wu xungeta minxavo no endla leswaku phurogireme ya hina ya switirhisiwa swa hina yi durha ngopfu.

eng: however, export companies, particularly in the manufacturing sector, should take advantage of the weaker rand and the stronger global recovery.
tso: hambiswiritano, tikhamphani leti yisaka nhundzu ehandle, ngopfu ngopfu eka bindzu ra vumaki, ti fanele ku teka nkarhi ti tirhisa rhandi leyi nga vevuka na ku vuyelelana ka matimba eka misava hinkwayo.

eng: while we have these difficulties, we know that we can cope with this period of turbulence.
tso: loko ha ha ri na ku tikeriwa loku, ha swi tiva leswaku hi nga tiyisela eka nkarhi lowu wa nhlupheko.

eng: we have done so before in the past five years.
tso: hi endlile tano eka malembe ya ntlhanu lawa ya nga hundza.

eng: we will, in fact, emerge stronger if we do the right things.
tso: hi ta swi kota, hi ntiyiso, hi ta huma hi tiyile loko hi endla swilo swo lulama.

eng: we have to work together as government, business and labour to grow our economy at rates that are above 5 per cent to be able to create the jobs we need.
tso: hi fanele ku tirha swin’we tani hi mfumu, bindzu na vatirhi swi fanele swi kurisa ikhonomi ya hina hi nhlayo leyi nga henhla ka tiphesente ta ntlhanu loko hi fanele ku va hi tumbuluxa mintirho leyi hi yi lavaka.

eng: fortunately this collaboration is already taking place.
tso: hi nkateko ntirhisano lowu wu sungurile ku tirha.

eng: it is taking place at nedlac which is one of the key institutions of cooperation in our democracy, between government, business, labour and the community sector.
tso: wu sungurile ku tirha enedlac lowu ku nga nhlangano wa ntirhisano eka xidemokirasi xa hina, exikarhi ka mfumu, mabindzu, vatirhi na mabindzu ya vaaki.

eng: it has taken place as well in engagements that we have been having with the business community.
tso: wu sungurie ku tirha eka migingiriko leyi a hi ri na yona na mabindzu ya vaaki.

eng: last year i started engaging business on specific steps that government can take to make it easier to do business in our country.
tso: lembe leri nga hundza ndzi sungurile ku nghenisa bindzu eka magoza yo karhi lawa mfumu wu nga ma tekaka ku endla leswaku swi olova ku endla bindzu laha tikweni ra hina.

eng: arising out of that process, we have now streamlined regulatory and licensing approvals for environmental impact assessments, water licenses and mining licenses.
tso: ku huma eka maendlele lawa, hi longoloxile milawu na mpfumelelo wa tilayisense ta swikambelwana swa mbango, tilayisense ta mati na tilayisense ta migodi.

eng: parliament is finalizing amendments to the law to give effect to this very positive development, which will cut to under 300 days, the time it takes to start a mine, from application to final approvals.
tso: palamende yi hetisile mindzhundzhuluko eka nawu ku nyika mpfumelelo eka nhluvukiso lowu wa kahle, lowu nga ta hunguta masiku leswaku ya va ehansi ka 300, nkarhi lowu lavekaka ku sungula mugodi, ku sukela eka xikombelo ku fikela eka ku pfumeleriwa.

eng: the deputy president of the republic continues to facilitate discussions between government, mining companies and labour.
tso: xandla xa phuresidente wa rhiphabuliki u ya emahlweni a rhangela mimbhurisano exikarhi ka mfumu, tikhamphani ta migodi na vatirhi.

eng: the purpose is to stabilise industrial relations in this very important sector of our economy.
tso: xikongomelo i ku tshamisekisa vuxaka bya vumaki eka bindzu leri ra nkoka ra ikhonomi ya hina.

eng: the process is yielding results.
tso: maendlele ya le ku humeseni ka mbuyelo.

eng: strikes in the sector were fewer and shorter last year.
tso: switereka eka bindzu a swi ri swintsongo no koma lembe leri nga hundza.

eng: and more importantly, industrial relations processes are taking place in a manner consistent with the law.
tso: xa nkoka swinene, maendlele ya vuxaka bya vumaki lawa ya le ku humeleleni hi mikhuva lowu fambisanaka na nawu.

eng: we have intervened in mining because it is one of our key job drivers.
tso: hi nghenelerile emigodini hikuva hi yona xin’we xa xifambisi xa hina xa mintirho.

eng: we need a mining sector that works.
tso: hi lava bindzu ra migodi leri tirhaka.

eng: mining employs over half a million people.
tso: migodi yi thorile vanhu vo tlula hafu ya miliyoni.

eng: it is the biggest earner of foreign exchange in our country.
tso: hi yona mukumi lonkulu wa mali ya matiko mambe laha tikweni ra hina.

eng: it also contributes about 20 billion rand directly to the tax revenue.
tso: yi nyikerile kwalomuya ka mabliliyoni ya 20 ya tirhandi eka vukorhokeri bya xibalo.

eng: mining also makes a far larger contribution as a buyer of goods and services, and a supplier of inputs to other sectors of our economy and other economies around the globe.
tso: migodi yi hoxa xandla hi la ku kulu tani hi muxavi wa tinhundzu na vukorhokeri, no va munyiki wa mavonelo eka mabindzu yan’wana eka ikhonomi ya hina na tiikhonomi tin’wana la misaveni.

eng: we are exploring partnerships with stakeholders to address the issue of housing in mining towns.
tso: hi le ku valangeni ka vuxaka na swirho ku ololoxa mhaka ya tindlu emigodini ya le malokhixini.

eng: let me also remind mining companies that 2014 is the deadline for them to improve housing and living conditions of mineworkers and to achieve a number of targets.
tso: mi nge ndzi tsundzuxa tikhamphani ta migodi leswaku 2014 i nkarhi wa vona wo hetelela wo antswisa tindlu na swiyimo swo hanya swa vatirhi va le migodini no fikelela swikongomiso swo hlaya.

eng: government continues to monitor and enforce compliance on both the company’s social and labour plans and mining charter targets.
tso: mfumu wu ya emahlweni wu landzelerisa no tiyisisa swileriso eka tipulani ta vanhu na mintirho na swikongomiso swa chata ya migodi swa tikhamphani.

eng: fellow south africans,honourable members,other than mining, we had identified five other job drivers in 2009. these are tourism, agriculture, the green economy, infrastructure development and manufacturing.
tso: vaakatiko kulorhiswirho swo hlonipheka,ku tlula migodi, hi boxile swifambisi swa ntlhanu swa mintirho hi 2009. leswi i vupfhumba, vurimi, ikhonomi ya rihlaza, nhluvukiso wa switirhisiwa na vumaki.

eng: the tourism industry has grown dramatically.
tso: bindzu ra vupfhumba ri kurile hi xihatla swinene.

eng: in 1993, south africa received a mere 3 million foreign visitors.
tso: hi 1993, afrika dzonga ri kumile vaendzi va matiko mambe va mamiliyoni ya nharhu.

eng: by 2012, the figure had grown to 13 million visitors.
tso: hi 2012, nomboro yi tlakukile yi fika eka mamiliyoni ya 13 ya vaendzi.

eng: we will continue to grow this industry, given its potential for job creation.
tso: hi ta ya emahlweni no kurisa bindzu leri, hi ku tiva leswaku ri tumbuluxa mintirho.

eng: in 2012 we unveiled the national infrastructure plan, led by the president through the presidential infrastructure coordinating commission.
tso: hi 2012 hi humserile ehandle pulani ya switirhisiwa swa rixaka, leyi a yi rhangeriwile hi khomixini ya phuresidente ya ntirhisano wa switirhisiwa.

eng: we have subsequently invested one trillion rand in public infrastructure over the past five years.
tso: hi vekisile thiriliyoni yin’we ya tirhandi eka switirhisiwa swa vanhu eka malembe ya ntlhanu lawa ya nga hundza.

eng: many of the projects are completed or are nearing completion.
tso: tiphurojeke to tala ti herile kumbe ti le kusuhi no hela.

eng: i will mention just a few.
tso: ndzi ta boxa tintsongo.

eng: the rea vaya system in joburg is now used by more than 100 000 gauteng residents.
tso: xifambo xa rea vaya ejoni sweswi xi tirhisiwa hi vatshami va gauteng vo tlula 100 000. swifambo swo fana na xona swi le ku akiweni ekapa, tshwane, nelson mandela bay, buffalo city, ethekwini na le rustenburg.

eng: the country’s harbours and ports have been improved.
tso: minhlaluko na switici swa swikepe swi antswisiwile.

eng: we have built a 700 kilometre fuel pipeline from durban to gauteng to transport 4 billion cubic litres of petrol, diesel and jet fuel a year.
tso: hi akile phayiphi yo fambisa petirolo yo ringana tikhilomitara ta 700 ku suka edurdan ku ya egauteng leswaku yi fambisa tilitara ta mune wa mabiliyoni ta petirolo na dizele na petirolo ya swihahampfhuka hi lembe.

eng: close to 1 500 kilometres of new roads or lanes have been built.
tso: ku fika kwalomuya ka tikhilomitara ta 1500 ta mapatu yantshwa kumbe mapatu yo engetelela ya akiwile.

eng: this progress in respect of roads reminds us of those who have served in this government before who wanted the best for the country, such as our former transport minister mr dullar omar.
tso: ku humelela loku hi tlhelo ra mapatu ku hi tsundzuxa lava va nga tirha eka mfumo lowu khale lava a va lava swo antswa eka tiko ra hina, ku fana na khale ka holobyenkulu wa swifambo tatana dullar omar.

eng: his dear wife farieda is one of our guests this evening.
tso: nsati wa yena farieda i wun’we wa vaendzi va hina madyambu lawa.

eng: the construction of new rail lines has started in mpumalanga, to ease the pressure off the roads.
tso: ku akiwa ka xiporo xintshwa swi sungurile empumalanga, ku hunguta ntshikelelo emapatwini.

eng: the gautrain project is now fully functional and carries over 1,2 million passengers a month.
tso: phurojeke ya gautrain yi le ku tirheni naswona yi rhwala vakhandziyi vo tlula 1,2 wa mamiliyoni hi nhweti.

eng: the passenger rail agency of south africa will spend over 120 billion rand over the next 10 years to buy new trains.
tso: ejensi ya vakhandziyi va switimela yi ta tirhisa ku tlula 120 wa mabiliyoni ya tirhandi eka malembe lawa ya taka ya 10 ku xava switimela swintshwa.

eng: transnet is implementing its massive 300 billion rand market demand strategy, building much needed transport infrastructure.
tso: transnet yi le ku tirhiseni ka kungu ra yona ra laveko ra 300 wa mabiliyoni ya tirhandi, ku aka switirhisiwa swa swifambo leswi lavekaka swinene.

eng: to realise the economic potential of the western cape and the west coast, we launched the saldanha industrial development zone and opened two new factories in atlantis.
tso: ku fikelela ku nkotiso wa ikhonomi ekapa vupeladyambu na west coast, hi simekile zoni ya nhluvukiso wa vumaki esaldanha no pfula tindzhawu timbirhi ta vumaki eatlantis.

eng: to improve the water supply, two large new dams were completed, de hoop in limpopo and spring grove in kwazulu-natal, while phase 2 of the lesotho highlands water project is to be launched soon.
tso: ku antswisa mphakelo wa mati, madamu mambirhi lamakulu ya akiwile, de hoop elimpopo na spring grove ekwazulu-natal, loko xiphemu xa vumbirhi xa phurojeke ya mati ya lesotho highlands xi nga ta simekiwa ku nga ri khale.

eng: construction is continuing at the new power stations, medupi in limpopo, kusile in mpumalanga and ingula near ladysmith, employing more than 30 000 workers.
tso: ku aka ku ya emahlweni eswiticini leswintshwa swa gezi, medupi elimpopo, kusile empumalanga na ingula ekusuhi na ladysmith, laha ku nga thoriwa vatirhi vo tlula 30 000. hi ta ya emahlweni no valanga tindzhawu tin’wana to kuma gezi eka tona, leti fambisanaka na pulani ya nkatsakanyo wa switirhisiwa eka gezi.

eng: we continue to explore other sources of energy, in line with the integrated resource plan for energy.
tso: nhluvukiso wa mafurha, ngopfu ngopfu gasi yo huma emaribyeni ku tava xincico eka tindzhawu ta le mananga na le ka ikhonomi ya afrika dzonga.

eng: having evaluated the risks and opportunities, the final regulations will be released soon and will be followed by the processing and granting of licenses.
tso: hikuva ku langutiwile nxungeto na minkarhi, milawu yo hetelela yi ta humesiwa ku nga ri khale naswona yi ta landzeriwa hi ku hleriwa no nyikiwa ka tilayisense.

eng: we expect to conclude the procurement of nine thousand six hundred megawatts of nuclear energy.
tso: hi langutele ku hetisela maxavele ya gezi ra nyutliliya ra timegawatsi ta magidinkaye na madzana manharhu.

eng: biofuels manufacturers have been selected and have started work.
tso: vumaki bya switshivelwa byi langhiwile naswona byi sungurile ku tirhah.

eng: honourable membersours is indeed a country at work and is a much better place to live in.
tso: swirho swo hloniphekatiko ra hina i tiko leri tirhaka hi ntiyiso naswona i ndzhawu yo antswa swinene ku hanya eka rona.

eng: we must keep the momentum.
tso: hi fanele hi tshamisa xisweswi.

eng: honourable members,more of our wealth is created through the internet or telecommunication.
tso: swirho swo hlonipheka,rifuwo ra hina ro tala ri tumbuluxiwile hi inthanete kumbe vuhlanganisi bya tiqingho.

eng: a 37 000 kilometres of fibre-optic cable has been laid by the private and public sectors in the past five years.
tso: khebulu ya tikhilomitara 37 000 yi andlariwile eka mabindzu ya mfumu na lawa ya nga ri ki ya mfumu eka malembe ya ntlhanu lawa ya nga hundza.

eng: this will be significantly expanded in the years ahead.
tso: leswi swi ta ndlandlamuxiwa eka malembe lawa ya taka.

eng: we are proud of our successes in science and technology.
tso: ha tinyungubyisa hi ku humelela ka hina eka sayense na thekinoloji.

eng: the construction of the first telescope of the 64-dish forerunner to the square kilometre array, the meerkat, will be completed in the first quarter of 2014. honourable members,our incentives to boost manufacturing have yielded returns.
tso: ku akiwa ka thelesikopu yo sungula ya rivilo ra 64 wa xikwere hi khilomitara eka mepe, ya meerkat, yi ta hetisiwa eka kotara yo sungula hi 2014. swirho swo hlonipheka,timali ta hina to pfuneta to kurisa vumaki ti vuyisile mbuyelo.

eng: the automotive investment scheme that was launched in 2009 has approved a total 3.8 billion rand worth of incentives for about 160 investment projects.
tso: xikimi xa vuvekisi eka swa mimovha xi simekiwile hi 2009 naswona xi pfumelerile ntsengo wo ringana 3,8 wa mabiliyoni ya tirhandi ya timali to pfuneta ku pfuneta tiphurojeke ta vuvekisi ta 160. leswi swi hlayisa mintirho yo tlula 50 000. tikhamphani ti ta tumbuluxa mimovha ya ti sedani, swibazani swa tithekisi na mabazi.

eng: we have stabilised the clothing, textile, leather and footwear sector, which had been shedding jobs.
tso: hi tshamisekisile bindzu ra swiambalo, malapi, dzovo na tintangu, leri a ri hunguta vatirhi.

eng: several industries have been designated for local content.
tso: vumaki byo hlaya byi endliwile hi ndlela ya laha kaya.

eng: these include buses, canned vegetables, clothing, textiles, leather and footwear and other goods.
tso: leswi swi katsa mabazi, matsavu yo cheriwa eswithinanini, swiambalo, malapi, dzovo na tintanghu na nhundzu yin’wana.

eng: we have concrete examples of the success of the localisation programme.
tso: hi na swikombiso swo tala swa ku humelela ka phurogireme yo endla swilo hi ndlela ya laha kaya.

eng: in the past two years alone, more than 20 000 minibus taxis and 330 buses were assembled locally, drawing investment and development to our cities.
tso: eka malembe lawa ya nga hundza ntsena, ku tlula swibazana swa 20 000 na tithekisi na mabazi ya 330 swi hlengeletiwile kwala tikweni, ku endla vuvekisi na nhluvukiso eka madoroba ya hina.

eng: in the next five years, the state will procure at least 75% of its goods and services from south african producers.
tso: eka malembe ya ntlhanu lawa ya taka, mfumu wu ta xava 75 wa tiphesente ta nhundzu ya wona na vukorhokeri ku suka eka vatumbuluxi va afrika dzonga.

eng: fellow south africans,we have to work more intensively to develop emerging or black industrialists.
tso: vaakatiko kulorhi,hi fanele ku tirha hi matimba swinene ku tumbuluxa vamaki lava ha tumbulukaka kumbe vamaki va vantima.

eng: many of the aspirant black industrialists complain about the difficulties they experience in obtaining industrial finance, supplier and retail markets, and technical production support.
tso: vamaki va vantima lava ha tumbulukaka va vilela hi swiphiqo leswi va hlanganaka na swona eku kumeni ka timali ta vumaki, vaphakeri na timakete to xavisela ka tona, na nseketelo wa vuhumelerisi bya xithekiniki.

eng: the national empowerment fund, the industrial development corporation and the small enterprise finance agency will continue to provide finance to viable black-owned businesses to promote industrialisation.
tso: timali na ntlakuso wa rixaka, nhlangano wa nhluvukiso wa vumaki na ejensi ya mabindzu lamantsongo va ta ya emahlweni va nyika timali eka mabindzu lawa ya lawuriwaka hi vanhu va ntima ku kurisa vumaki.

eng: in addition, we encourage established businesses to support the development of black industrial businesses.
tso: ku engetelela, hi hlohlotela mabindzu ku seketela nhluvukiso wa mabindzu ya vumaki eka vantima.

eng: agriculture is a key job driver and a provider of opportunities for entrepreneurship.
tso: vurimi i xifambisi xa nkoka xa mintirho no nyika minkarhi yo endla mabindzu.

eng: our agricultural support programme, fetsa tlala, is producing brand new exporters.
tso: phurogireme ya hina yo seketela vurimi ya, fetsatlala, yi tumbuluxa vanhu vantshwa lava yisaka swilo ematikweni ya le handle.

eng: the first 88 smallholder farmers in this programme supplied the united nations world food programme with 268 tons of maize and beans to send to lesotho last month.
tso: varimi lavantsono vo sungula va 88 eka phurogireme leyi va phakerile phurogireme ya swakudya swa misava ya nhlangano wa tinxaka hi 268 wa tithani ta mavele na tinyawa leswaku swi rhumeriwa elesotho nhweti leyi nga hela.

eng: we expect this number to increase.
tso: hi langutele leswaku nomboro leyi yi engeteleka.

eng: we will continue to promote our fisheries sector as well, which contributes an estimated 6billion rand to the economy and provides 27 000 jobs.
tso: hi ta ya emahlweni hi kurisa bindzu ra hina ra tinhlampfi, leri hoxaka xandla hi mabiliyoni ya ntsevu ya tirhandi eka ikhonomo no nyika mintirho ya 27 000. swirho swo hlonipheka,hi vile na ku humelela eka phurogireme yo aka misava hi vuntshwa.

eng: since 1994, nearly 5,000 farms, comprising 4.2 million hectares, have been transferred to black people, benefiting over 200,000 families.
tso: ku sukela hi 1994, kwalomuya ka mapurasi ya 5,000, lawa ya nga na tihekitara ta 4.2 wa mamiliyoni, ya nyikiwile nakambe eka vanhu va ntima, leswi vuyerisaka miminti ya 200, 00. kwalomuya ka swikoxo swa misava swo ringana 80,000, leswi ntsengo ku nga tihekitara ta 3.4 wa mamiliyoni, swi lulamisiwile naswona vanhu va n’we xa nhungu wa mamiliyoni va vuyeriwini.

eng: the next administration will need to take forward a number of policy, legislative and practical interventions, to further redress the dispossession of our people of their land.
tso: vulawuri lebyi taka byi ta fanela ku yisa emahlweni tipholisi to hlaya, milawu na minghenelelo, ku lawula ntshamiseko wa vanhu va hina emisaveni ya vona.

eng: these include matters relating to the establishment of the office of the valuer-general and thereby opening of the lodgement of claims.
tso: leswi swi katsa timhaka leti yelanaka na ku tumbuluxiwa ka hofisi ya mukamberi-jenerala no pfula ku yisiwa ka swikoxo.

eng: honourable memberssouth africa is indeed a much better place to live in.
tso: swirho swo hloniphekaafrika dzonga i ndzhawu yo antswa yo hanya eka yona.

eng: let me now report on our social transformation programme.
tso: mi nge sweswi ni vika hi phurogireme ya ku cinca ka vanhu.

eng: education is a ladder out of poverty for millions of our people.
tso: dyondzo i xitepisi xo suka evuswetini eka mamiliyoni ya vanhu va hina.

eng: we are happy therefore that there is a huge increase in the enrolment of children in school, from pre-primary to tertiary level.
tso: h i tsakile hikuva ku na ku engeteleleka ka vana lava dyondzaka xikolo, ku sukela ehansi ka le purayimari ku fika ethexiyari.

eng: the number of children attending grade r has more than doubled, moving from about 300 thousand to more than 700 thousand between 2003 and 2011. a draft policy framework towards universal access to grade r has been gazetted for public comment, with a view to making grade r compulsory.
tso: nhlayo ya vana lava nghenaka eka gireyidi r yi tlula nhlayo hi kambirhi, ku suka kwalomuya ka 300 000 ku fikelela eka ku tlula 700 000 ku sukela hi 2003 na 2011. vuako bya mpfampfarhuto wa pholisi eka mfikelelo wa misava wu tsariwile eka gazete leswaku vanhu va ta tihlamulela, hi miehleketo yo endla leswaku gireyidi r yi boha.

eng: bakwethu,izingane ezingu 8 million azikhokhiesikoleni, kantiezingu 9 million ithola ukudla okunempilo ezikoleni okuphuma kuhulumeni, ukuze zifunde kahle zingabulawa indlala.
tso: vanghana,nhungu wa mamiliyoni ya vadyondzi va ya eswikolweni leswi ku nga hakeriwiki timali ta swikolo, laha mamiliyoni ya nkaye wa vadyondzi va kumaka swakudya swa nantswo exikolweni, leswi swi tisiwaka hi mfumu ku tiyisisa leswaku va nga dlawi hi ndlala no va pfuneta ku tirha kahle exikolweni.

eng: )the matric pass rate has gone up from around 61 percent in 2009 to 78 percent last year and the bachelor passes improve each year.
tso: nhlayo ya mapasele ya ka metiriki yi yile ehenhla ku sukela eka tiphesente ta 61 hi 2009 ku fikela eka tiphesente ta 78 eka lembe leri nga hundza naswona ku pasa hi bachula ku antswa lembe na lembe.

eng: through the annual national assessments, we keep track of improvements and interventions needed, especially, in maths and science.
tso: hi ku ya hi swikambelwana swa rixaka swa lembe na lembe, hi hlayisa antswiso na nghenelelo lowu lavekaka, ngopfu ngopfu eka tinhlayo na sayense.

eng: to promote inclusivity and diversity, the south african sign language curriculum will be offered in schools from next year, 2015. we have increased our numbers of literate adults through the kha ri gude programme from 2,2 million in 2008 to 3 million people.
tso: ku tlakusa nkatso na nkulo, kharikhulamu ya ririmi ra swikoweto yi ta nyikiwa eswikolweni ku sukela lembe leri ta ka, hi 2015. hi engeterile nambara ya hina ya vanhu lavakulu lava kotaka ku hlaya no tsala hi phurogireme ya kha ri gude ku sukela eka 2.2 wa mamiliyoni hi 2008 ku fikela eka nharhu wa mamiliyoni ya vanhu.

eng: we have also been investing in teacher training and are re-opening teacher training colleges to meet the demand.
tso: hi vekisile nakambe eka vuleteri bya vudyondzisi naswona hi ta pfula nakambe tikholeji ta vuleteri bya vudyondzisi ku fikelela xilaveko.

eng: to produce a decent learning environment, we have delivered 370 new schools replacing mud schools and other unsuitable structures around the country.
tso: ku humelerisa ndzhawu yo dyondzela yo xiximeka, hi akile swikolo swintshwa swa 370 hi siva swikolo swo akiwa hi misava na vuako byo ka byi nga ringanelangi etikweni.

eng: the programme continues.
tso: phurogireme ya ha ya emahlweni.

eng: compatriotswe have a good story to tell in higher education as well.
tso: vanghanahi na xitori xa kahle xo xi vula na le ka dyondzo ya le henhla.

eng: student enrolments at universities increased by 12% while further education and training college enrolments have increased by 90%.
tso: ntsariso wa swichudeni etiyunivhesiti wu yile ehenhla hi tiphesente ta 12 loko tikholeji to yisa emahlweni ta dyondzo na vuleteri wu yile ehenhla hi tiphesente ta 90. hi engeterile mimpimanyeto ya xikimi xa rixaka xa mpfuneto wa swa timali ku fikela eka nkaye wa mabiliyoni ya tirhandi ku fikelela laveko.

eng: another major achievement of this term has been the establishment of two brand new universities, sol plaatje in the northern cape and the university of mpumalanga.
tso: ku humelela kun’wana ku kulu ka nkarhi lowu ku vile ku tumbuluxiwa xa tiyunivhesiti tintshwa, sol plaatje ekapa n’walungu na yunivhesiti ya mpumalanga.

eng: we will also build 12 new fet colleges in limpopo, mpumalanga, kwazulu-natal and eastern cape.
tso: hi ta aka tikholeji ta 12 tintshwa ta ti fet elimpopo, mpumalanga, kwazulu-natal na kapa vuxa.

eng: compatriots,the launch of the national education collaboration framework last year was an important development for the country.
tso: vanghana,ku simekiwa ka vuako bya ntirhisano eka dyondzo ya rixaka lembe leri nga hundza a ku ri nhluvukiso wa nkoka eka tiko.

eng: we wish the team well in their national duty.
tso: hi navelela xipano mikateko eka ntirho wa vona wa rixaka.

eng: compatriots,we have a good story to tell in the improvement of health care too.
tso: vanghana,hi na xitori xa kahle xo xi vula eku antswiseni ka swa rihanyu.

eng: over the past five years, 300 new health facilities have been built, including 160 new clinics.
tso: eka malembe ya ntlhanu lawa ya nga hundza, switirhisiwa swa rihanyu swa 300 swi akiwile, swi katsa na titliliniki ta 160 tintshwa.

eng: ten new hospitals have been builtor refurbished in ladybrand, germiston, mamelodi, natalspruit, ethekwini, zola, bojanala, vryburg district, swartruggens, khayelitsha and mitchell’s plain.
tso: swibedlhele swa khume swintshwa swi akiwile kumbe ku pfuxetiwa eladybrand, germiston, mamelodi, natalspruit, ethekwini, zola, bojanala, xifundzha xa vryburg, swartruggens, khayelitsha na mitchell’s plain.

eng: honourable speakerhonourable chairperson of the ncopthe hiv and aids turnaround is one of the biggest achievements of this administration and we are used as a model country by the united nations aids programmes, (unaids).
tso: muhlonipheki xipikaramuhlonipheki mutshamaxitulu wa ncopku cinca loku nga languteriwangiki ka hiv na aids i xin’we xa ku humelela lokukulu eka vulawuri lebyi naswona hi tirhisiwa tani hi tiko ra xikombiso hi phurogireme ya nhlangano wa tinxaka wa aids, (unaids).

eng: mother to child transmission of hiv has declined sharply and we have doubled the number of people who are receiving anti-retroviral treatment, from one million to 2.4 million people in 2013. more than 20 million south africans have taken the hiv test since the launch of the campaign in 2011 which indicates confidence in the health system.
tso: ntluleto wa hiv wo suka eka manana wu ya eka n’wana wu aleriwile swinene naswona nhlayo ya vanhu lava kumaka ntshungulo wa antirhetirovhayirali wu hi kambirhi, ku suka eka miliyoni yin’we ku fikela eka 2.4 wa mamiliyoni ya vanhu hi 2013. ku tlula 20 wa mamiliyoni ya vaaki va afrika dzonga va endlile xikambelwana xa hiv mpfhuka ku simekiwile pfhumba hi 2011 leswi kombaka ku titshembha eka maendlele ya rihanyu.

eng: life expectancy is now firmly on an upward trend.
tso: malembe lawa munhu a nga languteriwa leswaku a hanya wona ya tlakukile.

eng: south africans are now living longer.
tso: vaaki va afrika dzonga va hanya nkarhi wo leha sweswi.

eng: the target for the next administration is to ensure that at least 4.6 million people are enrolled in the anti-retroviral programme.
tso: xikongomiso xa vulawuri lebyi taka i ku tiyisisa leswaku kwalomuya ka 4.6 wa mamiliyoni ya vanhu va titsariserile eka phurogireme ya antirhetirovhayirali.

eng: we acknowledge the contribution of the south african national aids council for the hard work.
tso: hi tsundzuka ku hoxa xandla ka huvo ya rixaka ya aids ya afrika dzonga eka ntirho wa matimba.

eng: while celebrating our success, we must not be complacent.
tso: loko hi ri ku tlangeleni ka ku humelela ka hina, hi fanele hi nga rhuteli.

eng: the prevention work must still continue so that we can reach that goal of zero hiv infections sooner.
tso: ntirho wo sivela wu fanele ku ya emahlweni leswaku hi ta fikelela xikongomelo xa noto loko swi ta eka mintlulelo wa hiv ku nga ri khale.

eng: at a broader level, we will enter a new phase in the implementation of the national health insurance programme which will extend quality healthcare to the poor.
tso: eka xiyimo xo anama, hi ta nghena eka xiphemu xintshwa eku tirhiseni ka phurogireme ya ndzindzakhombo ya rixaka eka rihanyu leyi nga ta engetelela nkoka eka vukheta bya rihanyu eka lava nga swela.

eng: honourable chairperson of the ncop,honourable speakerthe overall crime rate has decreased by 21 percent since 2002 and work is ongoing to make communities safer.
tso: muhlonipheki mutshamaxitulu wa ncop,muchaviseki xipikaranhlayo hinkwayo ya vugevenga yi yile ehanshi hi tiphesente ta 21 ku sukela hi 2002 naswona ntirho wu ya emahlweni ku endla leswaku vaaki va hlayiseka.

eng: one of the key focus areas is to eradicate violence against women and children.
tso: yin’wana ya tindzhawu ta nkoka i ku hunguta madzolonga ehenhla ka vavasati na vana.

eng: we have introduced a number of measures to respond to this challenge.
tso: hi tivisile nhlayo ya matshalatshala yo lunghisa xiphiqo lexi.

eng: these include the reopening of the family violence, child protection and sexual offences units as well as the sexual offences courts.
tso: leswi swi katsa ku pfuriwa nakambe ka tiyuniti ta madzolonga ya le mindyangwini, nsirhelelo wa vana na milandzu ya swa masangu ku katsa na tikhoto ta milandzu ya swa masangu.

eng: we thank the many ngos that promote the rights of women and children who contribute positively to this important work.
tso: hi khensa ti ngo leti tlakusaka timfanelo ta vavasti na vana leti hoxaka xandla hi ndlela ya kahle eka ntirho lowu wa nkoka.

eng: our country continues to be the target of rhino poachers.
tso: tiko ra hina ri ya emahlweni ri va na xikongomiso xa vahloti va timhelembe.

eng: our law enforcement agencies are working hard to arrest this scourge.
tso: tiejensi ta hina ta vuhlayisi bya nawu ti le ku tirheni hi matimba ku khoma swirha leswi.

eng: we have also reached agreements with china, vietnam, kenya, mozambique and other sadc countries to work together to stop this crime.
tso: hi fikelerile mintwanano na china, vietnam, kenya, mozambique na yan’wana matiko ya sadc ku tirha swin’we ku yimisa vugevenga lebyi.

eng: we thank the business community and all south africans who participate in the campaign to save the rhino.
tso: hi khensa vaaki va van’wamabindzu na vaaki va afrika dzonga lava nga nghenelela eka pfhumba ro ponisa timhelembe.

eng: compatriotsthe independence of the judiciary has been further enhanced by the establishment of the office of the chief justice as a separate institution from the department of justice and constitutional development.
tso: vanghanantshuxeko wa swa vululami wu kurisiwile hi ku tumbuluxiwa ka hofisi ya muavanyisinkulu tani hi nhlangano lowu nga hambanyisiwa ku suka eka ndzawulo ya vululami na nhluvukiso wa vumbiwa.

eng: we have passed several pieces of legislation to support this new role of the office of the chief justice.
tso: hi pasisile swiphemu swo hlayanyana swa milawu ku seketela ntirho lowuntshwa wa hofisi ya muavanyisinkulu.

eng: progress is being made in the transformation of the judiciary to reflect the race and gender demographics of the country.
tso: ku humelela ku le ku endliweni eku cinceni ka swa vululami ku kombisa rixaka na rimbewu ra vanhu va tiko.

eng: the chief justice of the republic continues to champion and lead this transformation.
tso: muavanyisinkulu wa rhiphabuliki u ya emahlweni a va nghwazi no rhangela ku cinca loku.

eng: black judges (african, indian and coloured) now constitute 61% of all judges.
tso: vaavanyisi va vantima (maafrika, maindiyana mabosimani) sweswi va fika eka tiphesente ta 61 eka vaavanyisi hinkwavo.

eng: of the judicial establishment of 239 judges, only 76 are women.
tso: eka ku tumbuluxiwa ka swa maendelele ya khoto laha ku nga na vaavanyisi va 239, 76 ntsena i vavasati.

eng: the challenge is to transform the legal profession broadly in order to nourish the pool from which female judges can be appointed.
tso: xiphiqo i ku cinca ntirho wa nawu ku endlela ku kurisa nhlangano wa vaavanyisi va xisati laha va nga ta thoriwa.

eng: the finalisation of the legal practice bill will assist to broaden the pool from which potential judicial officers could be selected.
tso: ku hetisisiwa ka nawumbisi wa ntolovetiso wa nawu ku ta pfuna ku anamisa nhlangano laha vatirhi va vaavanyisi va nga ta langhiwa.

eng: honourable speaker and chairperson,south africans are united in wanting a corruption free society.
tso: muhlonipheki xipikara na mutshamaxitulu,vaaki va afrika dzonga va tsombanile eku laveni ka ndzhawu ya vaaki leyi pfumalaka vukungundwana.

eng: fighting corruption within the public service is yielding results.
tso: ku lwa na vukungundwana exikarhi ka vukorhokeri bya vanhu ku le ku tswaleni ka mihandzu.

eng: since the launch of the national anti-corruption hotline by the public service commission, over 13 000 cases of corruption and maladministration have been referred to government departments for further handling and investigation.
tso: mpfhuka ku simekiwile nomboro ya riqingho ya rixaka yo lwa na vukungundwana hi khomixini ya vukorhokeri bya vanhu, ku tlula 13 000 ya milandzu ya vukungundwana na mafambisele yo biha swi yisiwile eka tindzawulo ta mfumu leswaka yi khomiwa no lavisisiwa.

eng: government has recovered more than 320-million rand from perpetrators through the national anti-corruption hotline.
tso: mfumu wu kumile ku tlula mamiliyoni ya 320 ya tirhandi ku suka eka vaendli va timhaka hi nomboro ya riqingho ya rixaka yo lwa na vukungundwana.

eng: some of the successes of the national anti-corruption hotline include the following:to prevent corruption in the supply chain system, government has decided to establish a central tender board to adjudicate tenders in all spheres of government.
tso: ku humelela kun’wana ka nomboro ya riqingho ya rixaka yo lwa na vukungundwana ku katsa leswi landzelaka:ku sivela vukungundwana eka maendlele ya vufambisi bya swo xava na tithendara, mfumo wu bohile ku tumbuluxa bodo ya le xikarhi ya tithendara ku hlela tithendara eka swiphemu hinkwaswo swa mfumu.

eng: this body will work with the chief procurement officer whose main function will be to check on pricing and adherence to procedures as well as fairness.
tso: nhlangano lowu wu ta tirha na mutirhinkulu wa swa minxavo loyi ntirho wa yena ku nga ku languta eka minxavo no fambisana na maendlele tani hi ku hleketelela.

eng: the special investigating unit is investigating maladministration or alleged corruption in a number of government departments and state entities, through 40 proclamations signed by the president during this administration.
tso: yuniti yo hlawuleka ya ndzavisiso yi le ku lavisiseni ka vulawuri byo ka byi nga ri kahle kumbe ku hleketeleriwa ka vukungundwana eka tindzawulo to hlaya ta mfumu na tiejensi ta mfumu, hi switiviso swa 40 leswi nga sayiniwa hi phuresidente hi nkarhi wa vulawuri lebyi.

eng: we will keep the public informed of the outcome of the investigations.
tso: hi ta tivisa vanhu hi mbuyelo wa mindzavisiso.

eng: in the first six months of last year, the asset forfeiture unit paid a total of 149 million rand into the criminal assets recovery account and to the victims of crime.
tso: eka tinhweti ta ntsevu to sungula lembe leri nga hundza, yuniti ya lahlekelo wa nhundzu yi hakerile ntsengo wa mamiliyoni ya 149 ya tirhandi eka nkota yo vuyisela nhundzu leyi nga kumiwa hi vugevenga na vanhu lava nga khumbhiwa hi vugevenga.

eng: this is 170% above its target of 55 million rand and is higher than it has ever achieved in a full year.
tso: leti i tiphesente ta 170 to tlula xikongomiso xa yona xa mamiliyoni ya 55 ya tirhandi naswona yi le henhla ku tlula leswi yi nga tshama yi swi fikelela hi lembe ntalo rin’we.

eng: last year, the competition authorities investigated large-scale price fixing in the construction industry and fined guilty companies 1.4 billion rand.
tso: lembe leri nga hela, valawuri va mimphikizano va lavisisile vuxisi bya minxavo byo hlaya eka bindzu ra swo aka no rihisa tikhamphani leti nga na milandzu ya 1.4 wa mabiliyoni.

eng: further steps against those involved are now underway.
tso: magoza yan’wana ya le ku teni eka lava khumbhekaka.

eng: compatriots,i would now like to touch briefly on the provision of basic services to our people.
tso: vanghana,ndzi rhandza ku khumbha swintsongo eka ku nyikiwa ka vukorhokeri bya masungulo eka vanhu va hina.

eng: over the past 20 years, remarkable achievements have been made in increasing access to services such as water, sanitation and electricity.
tso: eka malembe ya 20 lawa ya nga hundza, ku humelela ko hlamarisa ku endliwile hi ku kurisa mfikelelo wa vukorhokeri byo fana na mati, nkululu na gezi.

eng: government has begun an intensive programme to eliminate the bucket system as part of restoring the dignity of our people.
tso: mfumu wu sungurile phurogireme ya matimba yo hunguta maendlele ya bakiti tani hi xiphemu xo vuyisela ndzhuti wa vanhu va hina.

eng: phase one of the programme will eradicate buckets in formalized townships of the free state, eastern cape and northern cape.
tso: xiphemu xo sungula xi ta hunguta mabakiti emalokhixini ya ximfumu efree state, kapa vuxa na kapa n’walungu.

eng: phase two will eradicate buckets in informal settlements in all provinces.
tso: xiphemu xa vumbirhi xi ta hunguta mabakiti eswidakanini eka swifundzhankulu hinkwaswo.

eng: in housing, about 3 million housing units and more than 855 thousand serviced sites were delivered since 1994. nearly 500 informal settlements have been replaced with quality housing and basic services over the past five years.
tso: eka tindlu, kwalomuya ka mamiliyoni ya nharhu ya tiyuniti ta tindlu na tindzhawu to tlula magidi ya 855 ti phakeriwile ku sukela hi 1994. swidakana swo fikelela ekusuhi na 500 swi siviwile hi tindlu ta nkoka na vukorhokeri bya masungulo eka ku tlula malembe ya ntlhanu lawa ya nga hundza.

eng: the next administration will promote better located mixed income housing projects.
tso: vulawuri lebyi taka byi ta kurisa tiphurojeke ta tindlu ta miholo leyi nga hlanganana naswona ti ri endzhawini yo antswa.

eng: compatriots,some communities still do not have these services especially in informal settlements and rural areas.
tso: vanghana,vaaki van’wana a va na byona na sweswi vukorhokeri lebyi ngopfu ngopfu lava tshamaka eswidakanini na le matikoxikaya.

eng: we are therefore working with all spheres of government to ensure the provision of these services, especially in the 23 municipalities with the greatest number of backlogs.
tso: hi le ku tirheni na swiphemu hinkwaswo swa mfumu ku tiyisisa no nyika vukorhokeri lebyi, ngopfu ngopfu eka timasipala ta 23 leti nga salela endzhaku hi swilo swo hlaya.

eng: compatriotsin last year’s state of the nation address, i raised my concern with the manifestation of violence in some of the protests taking place in our country.
tso: vanghanaeka mbulavulo hi xiyimo xa rixaka wa lembe leri nga hela, ndzi humesile ku vilela ka mina hi ku humelela ka madzolonga eku kombeni ka ku vilela kun’wana loku humelelaka laha tikweni ra hina.

eng: violent protests have taken place again around the country in the past few weeks.
tso: ku kombisa ku vilela ka madzolonga ku humelerile nakambe laha tikweni eka mavhiki lawa ya nga hundza.

eng: also worrying is what appears to be premeditated violence, as is the case with the use of petrol bombs and other weapons during protests.
tso: lexi vilerisaka nakambe hi leswi swi tikombaka tani hi madzolonga lawa ya nga lo pulaniwa, tani hi ku tirhisiwa ka tibomo ta petirolo na switlhavana swin’wana hi nkarhi wo kombisa ku vilela.

eng: the democratic government supports the right of citizens to express themselves.
tso: mfumo wa xidemokirasi wu seketela mfanelo ya vaaki yo kombisa vutitwi bya vona.

eng: the right to protest, peacefully and unarmed, is enshrined in the constitution.
tso: mfanelo yo kombisa ku vilela, hi ku rhula no pfumala switlhavani, yi tsariwile eka vumbiwa.

eng: however, when protests threaten lives and property and destroy valuable infrastructure intended to serve the community, they undermine the very democracy that upholds the right to protest.
tso: hambiswiritano, loko ku kombisa ku vilela ku chavisela vutomi na nhundzu no onha switirhisiwa swa nkoka leswi nga kongomana no pfuna vaaki, swi komba ku tekela ehansi xidemokirasi xexo xi nga khoma mfanelo yo kombisa ku vilela.

eng: the dominant narrative in the case of the protests in south africa has been to attribute them to alleged failures of government.
tso: xitori xa matimba eka xiyimo xa minkombiso yo vilela eafrika dzonga xi vi le xivangelo xa ku ehleketeleriwa ko tsandzeka ka mfumu.

eng: however the protests are not simply the result of “failures” of government but also of the success in delivering basic services.
tso: hambiswiritano minkombiso ya ku vilela a hi mbuyelo wo “tsandzeka” ka mfumu kambe nakambe i ku humelela eku phakeleni ka vukorhokeri.

eng: when 95% of households have access to water, the 5% who still need to be provided for, feel they cannot wait a moment longer.
tso: loko makaya ya tiphesente ta 95 ya ri na mfikelelo wa mati, lava va tiphesente ta ntlhanu lava ha faneleke ku nyikiwa, va twa onge va nge swi koti ku yima nkarhi wo lehanyana.

eng: success is also the breeding ground of rising expectations.
tso: ku humelela i ndzhawu yo tisa milangutelo.

eng: let me also add honourable members, that any loss of life at the hands of the police in the course of dealing with the protests cannot be overlooked or condoned.
tso: swirho swo hlonipheka mi nge ndzi katsa, leswaku ku lahleka ka vutomi emavokweni ya maphorisa eku tirhaneni na ku kombisa ku vilela a ku nge tekeriwi ehansi kumbe ku amukeriwa.

eng: loss of life is not a small matter.
tso: ku lahlekeriwa hi vutomi a hi mhaka yintsongo.

eng: we need to know what happened, why it happened.
tso: hi fanele hi tiva leswaku ku humelele yini, hikokwalaho ka yini swi humelerini.

eng: any wrongdoing must be dealt with and corrective action must be taken.
tso: xiendlo xin’wana na xin’wana xo biha ku fanele ku tirhaniwa na xona na xiendlo xo lulamisa xi fanele ku tekiwa.

eng: police must act within the ambit of the law at all times.
tso: maphorisa ya fanele ku tirha hi ku landzelela nawu minkarhi hinkwayo.

eng: having said this, we should also as a society be concerned that between 2005 and 2013, close to 800 police officerswere killed.
tso: hi ku vula leswi, tani hi vaaki hi fanele ku vaviseka hikuva exikarhi ka 2005 na 2013 maphorisa yo lava ku fika 800 ya dlawile.

eng: the police are protectors and are the buffer between a democratic society based on the rule of law, and anarchy.
tso: maphorisa i vahlayisi naswona i vasiveri exikarhi ka vaaki lava nga ntshuxeka loko hi langute mfumo wa nawu, na mpfilumpfilu.

eng: as we hold the police to account, we should be careful not to end up delegitimising them and glorify anarchy in our society.
tso: tani hi leswi hi hehlaka maphorisa, hi fanele ku va na vukheta bya leswaku hi nga heteleli hi susa nawu eka vona no dzunisa mpfilimpfilu etindzhawini ta hina.

eng: the culture of violence originated from the apartheid past.
tso: ndzhavuko wa madzolonga wu tumbulukile hi nkarhi wa khale wa xihlawuhlawu.

eng: we need to conduct anintrospectionin our efforts to get rid of this scourge.
tso: hi fanele ku endla vutikambisisi eka mintirho ya susa xirha lexi.

eng: as leaders from all walks of life, we must reflect on what we did or did not do, to systematically root out the violence that surfaced in protests during the early days of our democracy.
tso: tani hi varhangeri ku suka eka swiyimo hinkwaswo swa vutomi, hi fanele ku langutisisa eka leswi hi nga swi endla na leswi hi nga swi endlangiki, ku susa madzolonga lawa ya nga kona eka ku kombisa ku vilela emasungulweni ya xidemokirasi xa hina.

eng: we have a collective responsibility to build a society that respects the rule of law, respects one another and which respects life and property.
tso: hi na vutihlamuleri byo katsa na ku aka vaaki lava hloniphaka mfumo wa nawu, lava hloniphanaka naswona va hloniphaka vutomi na nhundzu.

eng: we should work together to rebuild ubuntu and a culture of responsibility in our society.
tso: hi fanele ku tirha swin’we ku aka nakambe vumunhu na ndzhavuko wa vutihlamuleri eka tindzhawu ta hina.

eng: honourable speaker,honourable chairperson of the ncop,a decision has been taken to improve functioning of local government.
tso: muhlonipheki xipikara,muhlonipheki mutshamaxitulu wa ncop,xiboho xi tekiwini ku antswisa matirhele ya mfumo wa muganga.

eng: the amendment of the municipal systems act is intended to improve the capacity of municipalities to deliver services.
tso: ku hundzuluxiwa ka nawu wa maendlele ya masipala ku languteriwile ku antswisa tshaku ra timasipala ku phakela vukorhokeri.

eng: qualified and experienced personnel must be deployed in municipalities.
tso: vatirhi lava nga dyondzeka no va na vutivi va ta yisiwa eka timasipala.

eng: we also need to strengthen existing forums of people’s participation and enable our people to play a greater role in development.
tso: hi fanele ku tiyisa tiforamu leti nga kona ta ku nghenelela ka vanhu no kotisa vanhu va hina ku teka xiave lexikulu eka nhluvukiso.

eng: the fight against corruption must be intensified as well, especially given reports that some services are interrupted or stopped, so that certain people could provide those services at cost to the state.
tso: nyimpi yo lwa na vukungundwana yi fanele ku tiyisiwa, ngopfu ngopfu eka swiviko swa leswaku vukorhokeri byin’wana bya kavanyetiwa kumbe ku yimisiwa, leswaku vanhu van’wana va nyika vukorhokeri byebyo va hakeriwa hi mfumo.

eng: these matters are being prioritised for the next administration.
tso: timhaka leti ti ta va ta xirhangana eka vulawuri lebyi taka.

eng: honourable speaker and chairpersondemocratic south africa’s foreign policy was shaped many decades ago during the fierce international campaign to isolate the apartheid state.
tso: muhlonipheki xipikara na mutshamaxitulupholisi ya matiko mambe ya afrika dzonga ra xidemokirasi yi vumbiwile eka malembe yo tala lawa ya nga hundza hi nkarhi wa pfhumba ro veka etlhelo mfumu wa xihlawuhlawu.

eng: anc president oliver tambo played a key role in that regard, assisted by among others, the late johnny makatini, former head of international affairs.
tso: phuresidente wa anc oliver tambo u vi le na xiave xa nkoka eka xiyimo xexo, hi ku pfuniwa exikarhi ka van’wana, hi mufi johnny makatini, khale ka murhangeri wa timhaka ta misava.

eng: his wife, mrs valerie makatini is one of our honoured guests this evening.
tso: nsati wa yena, manana valerie makatini i wun’wana wa vayeni va hina vo hlonipheka madayambu lawa.

eng: africa has remained at the centre of our foreign policy.
tso: afrika ya ha ri exikarhi ka pholisi ya hina ya matiko mambe.

eng: we have worked hard to strengthen support for the african union, sadc and all continental bodies whose purpose is to achieve peace and security.
tso: hi tirhile hi matimba ku tiyisa nseketelo eka nhlangano wa afrika, sadc na minhlangano hinkwayo leyi ntirho wa yona ku nga ku tisa ku rhula na vuhlayiseki.

eng: we have also prioritised the promotion of regional economic integration, infrastructure development, intra-african trade and sustainable development in the continent.
tso: hi endlile leswaku nkuriso wa nghenelelo wa ikhonomi ya swifundzha ku va xirhangani, nhluvukiso wa switirhisiwa, bindzu leri humelelaka kwala afrika ntsena na nhluvukiso wa nkarhi wo leha ekhonthineteni.

eng: this year we also submitted our third country report to the au african peer review mechanism which was well received.
tso: lembe leri hi yisile xiviko xa hina xa tiko eka maendlele yo kambisisa ya afrika ya au lexi nga amukeriwa kahle.

eng: we continue to support peacemaking and conflict resolution.
tso: hi ta ya emahlweni no seketela ku endla leswaku ku va na ku rhula na swintshuxo swo ololoxa ntlimbo.

eng: progress is being made in negotiations between sudan and south sudan on outstanding issues following the secession.
tso: ku humelela ku le ku endliweni hi njhekanjhekisano exikarhi ka sudan na sudan dzonga eka timhaka leti a ti nga ololoxiwangi endzhaku ka ku va ya tshikile ku ololoxa.

eng: following requests from sri lanka and south sudan for assistance in bringing about peace and reconciliation, mr cyril ramaphosa, has been appointed as south africa’s special envoy to the two countries.
tso: hi ku landzelela swikombelo swo suka esri lanka na sudan dzonga swo lava ku pfuniwa ku tisa ku rhula na ndzivalelano, tatana cyril ramaphosa, u thoriwile tani hi murhumiwa wo hlawuleka wa afrika dzonga ku ya ematikweni lawa ya mbirhi.

eng: his expertise in conflict resolution and negotiations as well as our country’s experience in this regard, will greatly assist the two countries to resolve their problems.
tso: vutivi bya yena byo ololoxa mintlimbo na minjhekanjhekisano na vutivi bya tiko ra hina eka timhaka leti, swi ta pfuna matiko lawa ya mbirhi ku ololoxa swiphiqo swa wona.

eng: we will continue to strengthen relations with europe, north america, latin america, asia and countries in the south.
tso: hi ta ya emhlweni no tiyisa vuxaka na yuropo, amerika n’walungu, latin amerika, asia na matiko ya le dzongeni.

eng: participation in international multilateral forums such as the g20 have been beneficial for the country.
tso: ku nghenelela eka tiforamu to hlaya ta misava to fana na g20 ti vuyerisile tiko swinene.

eng: and joining the brazil, russia, india and china (bric) group in december 2010 counts as among the key achievements of the fourth administration.
tso: ku hlangana na ntlawa wa (bric) ku nga brazil, russia, india na china hi n’wendzamhala 2010 ku hlayiwa tani hi ku vuyeriwa ka nkoka eka vulawuri bya vumune.

eng: it was also a great honour to host the fifth brics summit on 27 march 2013 in durban, which saw the participation of african leaders to discuss developmental cooperation with brics.
tso: ku vile ku xiximiwa loku kulu ku va hi rhurherile samiti ya vuntlhanu ya brics hi ti 27 nyenyankulu 2013 edurban, laha a ku hlanganile varhangeri va afrika ku burisana hi ntirhisano wo hluvukisa na brics.

eng: we will continue to serve diligently in the united nations in promotion of strong international governance.
tso: hi ta ya emahlweni no tirha hi ku tshembheka eka nhlangano wa tinxaka eku kuriseni ka vurhangeri bya matimba bya misava hinkwayo.

eng: we will also continue promoting the reform of the un security council and global financial institutions.
tso: hi ta ya emahlweni no kurisa ku aka hi vuntshwa huvo ya vuhlayiseki ya un na minhlangano ya swa timali ya misava hinkwayo.

eng: honourable membersas president of the cop17/cmp7 united nations climate change conference which was hosted in durban in 2011, south africa successfully placed the world on an unassailable course, through the adoption of the durban platform for enhanced action.
tso: swirho swo hloniphekatani hi phuresidente wa cop17/cmp7 eka nhlengeletano ya nhlangano wa tinxaka wa ku cinca ka maxelo leyi a yi khomiwile edurban hi 2011, afrika dzonga ri vekile misava eka maendlele yo ka ya nga hluriwi, hi ku tekiwa ka pulatifomo ya le durban eka xiendlo lexi nga kurisiswa.

eng: compatriots,over the past 20 years we have hosted a number of international sporting and cultural visits, which has helped to boost social cohesion and unity.
tso: vanghana,eka malembe ya 20 lawa ya nga hundza hi rhurherile mintlangu ya misava yo hlaya na vuendzi bya ndzhavuko, leswi nga pfuna ku kurisa ku hlangana ka vanhu na ntwanano.

eng: in the past five years, south africa hosted the highly successful 2010 fifa soccer world cup and other key soccer, rugby and cricket tournament, which left a tangible feeling of pride and unity among all south africans.
tso: eka malembe ya ntlhanu lawa ya nga hundza, afrika dzonga ri rhurherile khapu ya bolo ya misava ya fifa leyi nga humelela swinene hi 2010 na thonamente ya nkoka ya bolo ya milenge, rhabi na khirikhete, leswi nga siya ku titwa ka ku tidzunisa na ntwanano exikarhi ka vaaki va afrika dzonga.

eng: as we celebrate 20 years of freedom, we will do so having done well in building a new heritage landscape for our country.
tso: tani hi leswi hi tlangelaka malembe ya 20 ya ntshuxeko, hi ta endla tano hi ku va hi humelerile eku akeni ka mfuwo wuntshwa etikweni ra hina.

eng: a number of new museums and monuments were established, including the statue of former president mandela which has become a landmark in the union buildings.
tso: nhlayo ya timuziyamu tintshwana swifaniso swa ntsopfu swi tumbuluxiwile, ku katsa na xifaniso xa ntsopfu xa khale ka phuresidente mandela lexi nga hundzuka pakani eunion buildings.

eng: more than 2000 geographical names have been changed in order to correct the ill-naming of places, as well as to give communities the right to determine the names of their areas.
tso: mavito ya tindzhawu yo tlula 2000 ya cinciwile leswaku ku lulamisiwa ku thyiwa ko biha ka tindzhawu, no nyika vaaki mfanelo yo langha mavito ta tindzhawu ta vona.

eng: honourable membersallow me to acknowledge some of our compatriots who are making their mark in the world.
tso: swirho swo hloniphekandzi pfumeleleni ku tsundzuka van’wana va vanghana va hina lava nga eku endleni ka mfungho wa vona emisaveni.

eng: we congratulate ladysmith black mambazo on winning their fourth grammy award last month.
tso: hi khensisa ladysmith black mambazo eka ka ku wina ka vona nyiko ya vona ya vumune ya grammy nhweti leyi nga hundza.

eng: we welcome the group leader, mr joseph shabalala, one of our guests this evening.
tso: hi amukela murhangeri wa ntlawa, tatana joseph shabalala, wun’wana wa vayeni va hina madyambu lawa.

eng: we also acknowledge ms yvonne chaka chaka who is one of our guests this evening.
tso: hi tsundzuka manana yvonne chaka chaka loyi a nga wun’wana wa vayeni va hina madyambu lawa.

eng: she is doing a lot of good work as the united nations children’s fund goodwill ambassador for malaria in africa and also the united nations millennium development goals special envoy for africa.
tso: u endla ntirho wa kahle wo tala tani hi murhangeri eka nkwama wa nhlangano wa tinxaka wa vana eka swa malariya eafrika naswona i murhumiwa wo hlawuleka wa nhluvukiso wa swikongomelo swa miliniyamu eka nhlangano wa tinxaka eafrika.

eng: ms chaka chaka was also honoured with the crystal award by the world economic forum in davos for her humanitarian work.
tso: manana chaka chaka u xiximiwile nakambe hi nyiko ya crystal hi foramu ya ikhonomi ya misava edavos hi kwalaho ka ntirho wa yena wo pfuna vanhu.

eng: we also recognise, in her absence, our oscar award-winning hollywood star, ms charlize theron.
tso: hi tsundzuka nakambe, hambi leswi a nga ri ki kona, muwini wa hina wa nyiko ya oscar wa le hollywood, manana charlizetheron.

eng: ms theron is also the un messenger for peace.
tso: manana theron nakambe i murhumiwa wa un wa ntwanano.

eng: she also champions the fight against aids especially amongst the youth and young women.
tso: i nghwazi eka nyimpi yo lwa na aids exikarhi ka vantshwa na vantshwa va xisati.

eng: she was also honoured by the world economic forum with a crystal award.
tso: u xiximiwile nakambe hi foramu ya ikhonomi ya misava hi nyiko ya crystal.

eng: compatriotsyou would have noticed that in this sona we have given a report of the past five yearsin particular and over the past 20 years in general.
tso: mi ta swi vona leswaku leswaku eka sona leyi hi nyikile xiviko xa malembe ya ntlhanu lawa ya nga hundza na le ka malembe ya 20 lawa ya nga hundza hi ku angarhela.

eng: this is not an occasion to present the programme of action for this financial year.
tso: lowu a hi ntirho wo nyika phurogireme ya maendlele eka lembe ximali leri.

eng: that programme will be presented by the new government after the elections.
tso: phurogireme yaleyo yi ta nyiketiwa eka mfumo lowuntshwa endzhaku ka minhlawulo.

eng: to prepare for that first state of the nation address by the incoming administration later in the year, we have over the past year, been working on a medium term strategic framework.
tso: ku lunghisela mbulavulo hi xiyimo xa rixaka wo sungula eka vulawuri lebyi taka loko lembe ri ya eku heleni, eka lembe leri nga hundza, a hi tirhana na vuako bya kungu eka nkarhi wa le xikarhi.

eng: the framework has been designed as the first five year building block of the national development plan, from 2014 to 2019. it also incorporates key targets of the industrial policy action plan, the new growth path and infrastructure plan.
tso: vuako byi tumbuluxiwile tani hi masungulo yo aka ya ntlhanu yo sungula ya pulani ya nhluvukiso wa rixaka, ku sukela hi 2014 ku fikela hi 2019. byi katsa swikongomelo swa nkoka swa pulani ya swiendlo swa pholisi ya vumaki, ndlela yintshwa ya nkulo na pulani ya switirhisiwa.

eng: the intention is to table the draft framework to the first cabinet lekgotla after the elections.
tso: xikongomelo i ku andlala mpfampfarhuto wa vuako eka khabinete ya lekgotla yo sungula endzhaku ka minhlawulo.

eng: it will be refined by the new administration in line with its electoral mandate, so that work can start as soon as possible after the formation of a new government.
tso: swi ta pfuxeleriwa hi vulawuri byi ntshwa lebyi fambisanaka na xikongomelo xa byona xa nhlawulo, leswaku ntirho wu ta sungula hi nkarhi lowu nga hetiki mbilu endzhaku ka ku vumbiwa ka mfumo wuntshwa.

eng: it has been an honour for my administration and i to build on the foundation laid by the first three democratic administrations, to serve the people of south africa.
tso: ku vi le ku xiximiwa eka vulawuri bya mina na mina ku aka tshaku leri nga sunguriwa hi valawuri vanharhu va xidemokirasi vo sungula, ku tirhela vanhu va afrika dzonga.

eng: as a country we have scored many successes.
tso: tani hi tiko hi vile na ku humelela ko tala.

eng: deputy speaker of the national assembly and deputy chairperson of the ncop,deputy president of the republic, honourable cyril ramaphosa,former deputy president kgalema motlanthe,honourable chief justice of the republic, and all esteemed members of the judiciary,honourable ministers and deputy ministers,premiers and speakers of provincial legislatures,chairperson of salga, and all local government leadership,chairperson of the national house of traditional leaders,the heads of chapter 9 institutions,leaders from all sectors,members of the diplomatic corps,honourable members,distinguished guestsfellow south africans,good evening, sanibonani, molweni, riperile, dumelang, ndi madekwana.
