tso: ntirho wo tumbuluxa tiyunivhesithi tinharhu tintshwa wu ya emahlweni, ku nga sol plaatjie ekapa n’walungu, yunivhesithi ya mpumalanga, na yunivhesithi ya tisayense ta rihanyo na nhlanganelo ya sefako makgatho.

eng: compatriots and friends,over the past five years, government has scored significant gains in health care.
tso: muhlonipheki xipikara na muhlonipheki mutshamaxitulu,enkarhini lowu hundzeke hi tivisile tiphurogireme tintshwa to humelerisa pulani ya nhluvukiso wa rixaka.

eng: this year, we are going to launch a massive programme to turn the tide against tuberculosis (tb), with a special focus on three communities, offenders at correctional services facilities, mineworkers and communities in mining towns.
tso: n’waxemu hi simekile operation phakisa, tani hi maendlelo ya laboratara leyi fambisiwaka hi mbuyelo eka vupulani ni vuhumelerisi bya tiphurogireme.

eng: in fighting the scourge of hiv and aids, the state-owned pharmaceutical company, ketlaphela, has been established and will participate in the supply of anti-retrovirals to the department of health.
tso: mayelana ni ikhononi ya le lwandle xikongomelo xa operation phakisa i ku pfula tinyangwa ta swiyenge swa swikepe, vurhiyi bya tihlampfi, vubyari bya swimilani ematini, emigodini, oyili na gasi, bayithekinoloji na vupfhumba.

eng: we have launched the 'back to basics' programme to promote good governance and effective administration through cutting wastage, spending public funds prudently, hiring competent staff, and ensure transparency and accountability in municipalities.
tso: swinghenelo leswi swi katsa ntirhisano ni matikoakelani, vuhlori byo antswa ku katsa na vuhlayiseki etiphakini na le tindhawini ta vuhlayiseki bya swiharhi laha timhelembe ti kumekaka kona.

eng: madam speaker and chairperson,countries of the developed north remain important strategic partners for south africa through which the country is able to advance its national and foreign policy.
tso: maafrika-dzonga kulorhi,ku hoxa xandla eku akeni ka afrika yo antswa, afrika-dzonga ri yile emahlweni ri seketela ku rhula, vuhlayiseki na ikhonomi ya rhigini leyi nga nyandza yin’we etikweninkulu.

eng: the renewal of the african growth and opportunity act beyond september 2015 and a pledge to support african-led peace initiatives in the continent are among the significant outcomes of the united states (us)-africa leaders' summit held in the us last year.
tso: nhlangano wa vuswikoti bya afrika bya nhlamulo ya swiphiqo wa xihatla (acirc), lowu afrika-dzonga ri nga ni xandla ni ku va rin’wana ra vatumbuxi wu simekiwile.

eng: compatriotsat a multilateral level, 2015 marks the 70th anniversary of the un which brings into sharp focus the need to transform the un security council and other international institutions.
tso: vutho ra rixaka ra vusirheleli ra afrika-dzonga na maphorisa ya afrika-dzonga swi yile emahlweni swi nghenelela hi matimba ku sivela nkwetlembetano ni ku tisa ku rhula etikweninkulu leri.

eng: compatriots,national liberation heroes, moses kotane and jb marks will be reburied in south africa in march.
tso: afrika-dzonga ri tlhele ri ya emahlweni ku seketela mapfhumba yo aloloxa ntlimbo elesotho, sri lanka na dzonga ka sudan, ri karhi ri rhangeriwa hi xandla xa phuresidente.

eng: we thank the government and people of the russian federation for looking after the remains of our heroes with dignity for so many decades.
tso: ntirhisano wa swa ikhonomi ni vanakulorhi va brics wu tiyisiwile loko mintwanano yimbirhi yo sungula yi gimetiwa hi nkarhi wa samiti ya vutsevu ya brics.

eng: in sports, team south africa will participate in the all africa games in congo brazzaville in 2015. the springboks will participate in the international rugby board (irb) world cup that takes place in england in september 2015. the proteas are in australia and new zealand to participate in the international cricket council cricket world cup.
tso: muhlonipheki xipikara na muhlonipheki mutshamaxitulu,matiko lama nga hluvuka en’walungu ya ta tshama ya ri ni xinakulorhi xa nkoka eka afrika-dzonga laha tiko leri ri kotaka ku yisa emahlweni pholisi ya rixaka na ya matiko mambe.

eng: all south africans must as usual, rally behind the national teams.
tso: hi na xinakulorhi xa nkoka na nhlangano wa yuropo, eka timhaka to fana ni, exikarhi ka tin’wana na tin’wana, phurogireme ya vuvekisi bya switirhisiwa ya afrika-dzonga leyi nga ni nxavo wa mali yo ringana r1, 5 biliyoni.

eng: the speaker of the national assembly (na),the chairperson of the national council of provinces (ncop),deputy speaker of the national assembly and deputy chairperson of the ncop,deputy president cyril ramaphosa,former president thabo mbeki,chief justice mogoeng mogoeng and all esteemed members of the judiciary,the president of the pan african parliament, mr roger nkodo dang,ministers and deputy ministers,premiers and speakers of provincial legislatures,chairperson of the south african local government association and all executive mayors present,the heads of chapter 9 institutions,chairperson of the national house of traditional leaders,leaders of faith-based organisations,the former speaker of the na, dr frene ginwala,invited guests,veterans of the struggle for liberation,members of the diplomatic corps,fellow south africans,good evening, sanibonani, molweni, dumelang, goeienaand, lotjhani, ri perile, ndi madekwana.
tso: xipikara xa huvo ya rixaka (na),mutshamaxitulu wa huvo ya rixaka ya swifundzhankulu (ncop),xandla xa xipikara xa huvo ya rixaka na xandla xa mutshamaxitulu wa ncop.

eng: today marks the 26th anniversary of the release of president nelson mandela from prison, which was one of the most remarkable episodes in the history of our country.
tso: namuntlha swi fungha anivhesari ya vu 26 ya ku ntshuxiwa ka phuresidente nelson mandela ekhotsweni, leswi a ku ri xiphemu xin’wana xa nkoka eka matimu ya tiko ra hina.

eng: it is also the 50th anniversary of the declaration by the national party regime that district six would be a whites only area, leading to the forced removals of more than 60 000 residents.
tso: yi tlhela yi va anivhesari ya vu 50 ya xiboho xa mfumo wa national party xa leswaku district six yi ta hundzuka ndhawu ya lava nhlonghe yo basa ntsena, leswi tiseke ku susiwa hi nkanu ka vatshami va ndhawu liya va nhlayo yo tlula 60 000. lembe ra 2016 ri tlhela ri fungha anivhesari ya vu 20 ya ku sayiniwa ka nawu hi madiba, wa vumbiwa ra rhiphabuliki.

eng: the signing took place in sharpeville on 10 december 1996. we are proud of our democracy and what we have achieved in a short space of time.
tso: ku sayiniwa loku ku endliwile esharpeville hi ti 10 n’wendzamhala 1996. ha tinyungubyisa hi xidemokirasi xa hina na leswi hi swi fikeleleke hi nkarhi lowuntsongo swonghasi.

eng: our democracy is functional, solid and stable.
tso: xidemokirasi xa hina xa tirha, xi tiyile ni ku tshamiseka.

eng: compatriots, the constitution, which has its foundation in the freedom charter, proclaims that south africa belongs to all who live in it.
tso: vaakatiko kulorhi,vumbiwa, leri timitsu ta rona ku nga tsalwa ra ntshuxeko, ri boxa leswaku afrika-dzonga i ra hinkwavo lava tshamaka eka rona.

eng: a lot has been done to promote inclusion and a non-racial society.
tso: swo tala swi endliwile ku tlakusa vun’we na vaakatiko lava pfumalaka xihlawulambala.

eng: however, the journey to a non-racial society has not yet been completed.
tso: hambiswiritano, rendzo ro ya eka vaakatiko lava pfumalaka xihlawulambala a ri se fika emakumu.

eng: the nation was shaken last month when racism reared its ugly head on social and electronic media, causing untold pain and anger.
tso: rixaka ri tshukisiwile ngopfu nhweti leyi hundzeke loko xihlawulambala xi tlhele xi vuya hi matimba eka swihangalasa-mahungu swa vanhu na swa xitironiki, leswi vangeke ku vaviseka na nhlundzuko lowu nga ri ki na mpimo.

eng: there is a need to confront the demon of racism.
tso: ku na xilaveko xo lwisana na dimoni ra xihlawulambala.

eng: human rights day, 21 march, will be commemorated as the national day against racism this year.
tso: siku ra timfanelo ta ximunhu, 21 nyenyankulu, ri ta tlangeriwa tanihi siku ra rixaka ro lwa ni xihlawulambala.

eng: it will be used to lay the foundation for a long-term programme of building a non-racial society.
tso: ri ta tirhisiwa ku va masungulo ya phurogireme ya nkarhi wo leha yo aka tiko leri pfumalaka xihlawulambala.

eng: compatriots, i would like to remind you of a few other important anniversaries.
tso: vaakatiko kulorhi,ndzi rhandza ku mi tsundzuxa hi tianivhesari ta nkoka.

eng: the year 2016 marks 60 years since the women’s march to the union buildings to demand an end to pass laws.
tso: lembe ra 2016 ri fungha lembe ra vu 60 endzhaku ka loko ka machi wa vavasati lava a va kongomile eunion buildings ku ya koxa ku herisiwa ka milawu ya mapasi.

eng: we are happy to have in our midst ms sophie de bruyn, who was among the heroic leaders of that historic march.
tso: hi tsakile ngopfu namuntlha hikuva exikarhi ka hina ku na manana sophie de bruyn, loyi a ri un’wana wa tinhenhakazi ta varhangeri va machi lowuya wa matimu.

eng: we also acknowledge the former president of the black sash, ms mary burton.
tso: hi tlhela hi lemuka vukona bya khale ka phuresidente ya black sash, manana mary burton.

eng: we acknowledge the organisation’s track record in fighting for human rights, justice and equality.
tso: hi lemuka matirhelo ya xiyimo xa le henhla ya nhlangano lowu wo lwela timfanelo ta ximunhu, vululami na ndzingano.

eng: this year also marks 40 years since the landmark 16 june student uprising in soweto.
tso: lembe leri ri fungha 40 wa malembe endzhaku ka pakani yo komba ku vilela hi swichudeni ya ti 16 khotavuxika esoweto.

eng: we welcome the photographer who shot the famous photograph of hector pieterson carried by mbuyisa makhubu with his sister antoinette, mr sam nzima.
tso: hi amukela n’waswifaniso loyi a tekeke xifaniso xo tiveka xa hector peterson a rhwariwile hi mbuyisa makhubu na makwenu wa yena wa xisati antoinette, tatana sam nzima.

eng: we also salute the class of 1976 for their bravery in standing up against the brutal apartheid regime.
tso: hi tlhela hi losa ntlawa wa 1976 hikokwalaho ka vurhena bya wona byo yima hi milenge wu lwa na mfumo wa tihanyi wa xihlawuhlawu.

eng: we acknowledge one of the activists of that era, the deputy secretary of parliament, ms baby tyawa, who is in our midst.
tso: hi lemuka wun’wana wa valwi va nkarhi walowo, xandla xa matsalani wa palamende, manana baby tyawa, loyi a nga kona exikarhi ka hina.

eng: this year we also mark 30 years since the ambush and brutal killing of the gugulethu seven by the apartheid police in march 1986. the university of fort hare celebrates its centenary, which is a critical milestone in the liberation history of not only our country but the continent.
tso: lembe leri hi tlhela hi fungha 30 wa malembe endzhaku ka ku hlaseriwa ni ku dlawa hi tihanyi ka gugulethu seven hi maphorisa ya xihlawuhlawu hi nyenyankulu 1986. yunivhesithi ya fort hare yi tlangela 100 wa malembe, leswi ku nga goza ra nkoka eka matimu ya ntshuxeko wa hina ku nga ri etikweni rerhu ntsena kambe etikweninkulu hinkwaro.

eng: the national celebrations will take place on 20 may.
tso: mintlangelo ya rixaka yi ta va kona hi ti 20 mudyaxihi.

eng: let me recognise umntwana wakwaphindangene, the leader of the inkatha freedom party who is a former student of the university.
tso: mi nge ndzi lemuka hosi mangosuthu buthelezi, murhangeri wa ifp loyi a nga khale ka xichudeni xa yunivhesithi.

eng: the year 2016 also marks the centenary of the battle of delville wood in france, which took place during the first world war.
tso: lembe ra 2016 ri tlhela ri fungha malembe ya 100 ya nyimpi ya deville wood efrance, leyi ve ke kona hi nkarhi wa nyimpi ya misava yo sungula.

eng: scores of black soldiers fought in the war but were treated badly due to the colour of their skin.
tso: nhlayo ya masocha ya vantima ya lwile enyimpini leyi kambe a va khomiwa hi voko ra nsimbhi hikokwalaho ka muhlovo wa nhlonghe ya vona.

eng: a memorial that will restore their dignity and humanity is scheduled to be unveiled in july this year in france.
tso: ntirho wo va tsundzuka ni ku vuyetela xindzhuti na vumunhu bya vona wu ta tivisiwa hi mawuwani nan’waka efrance.

eng: compatriots, allow me as well to recognise three special guests who are also with us today:madam speaker and madam chairperson,a resilient and fast growing economy is at the heart of our radical economic transformation agenda and our national development plan (ndp).
tso: vanakulorhi, ndzi pfumeleleni ndzi lemuka vayeni vo hlawuleka vanharhu lava nga na hina namuntlha, manana xipikara na manana mutshamaxikulu,ikhonomi yo tsindziyela naswona leyi kulaka hi xihatla, yi le mbilwini ya ajenda ya hina yo hundzuluxa ikhonomi ya hina na kungu ra nhluvukiso wa rixaka (ndp) ra hina.

eng: when the economy grows fast it delivers jobs.
tso: loko tshaku ra ikhonomi ri ndlandlamuka ri tumbuluxa mintirho.

eng: workers earn wages and businesses make profits.
tso: vatirhi va hola muholo na van’wamabindzu va endla tswalo.

eng: the tax base expands and allows government to increase the social wage and provide education, health, social grants, housing and free basic services ¬– faster and in a more sustainable manner.
tso: tshaku ra xibalo ra ndlandlamuka naswona ri pfumelela mfumo ku andzisa miholo ya vanhu nyika dyondzo, rihanyo, midende, vutshamo na vukorhokerhi bya masungulo bya mahala – leswi hinkwaswo swi humelela hi ndlela leyi ya ka emahlweni.

eng: our economy has been facing difficulties since the financial crisis in 2008. we embarked on an aggressive infrastructure development programme to stimulate growth.
tso: ikhonomi ya hina yi hlanganile na ku tikeriwa ku suka hi nkarhi wa mikitsikitsi ya timali hi 2008. ku nyanyula nkulo wa ikhonomi hi tekile magoza ya matimba ya phurogireme yo hluvukisa switirhisiwa.

eng: our reality right now is that global growth still remains muted.
tso: ntiyiso wa mfanelo ya hina sweswi hi leswaku nkulo wa ikhonomi ya misava wa ha yimile.

eng: currencies of emerging markets have become weak and they fluctuate widely.
tso: timali ta timakete leta ha hluvukaka ti tsanile naswona ta tsekatseka emisaveni hinkwayo.

eng: the prices of gold, platinum, coal and other minerals that we sell to the rest of the world have dropped significantly and continue to be low.
tso: minxavo ya nsuku, pulatinamu, malahla na swicelwa swin’wana leswi hi swi xaviselaka matikomambe swi yi le ehansi swinene naswona swi ya emahlweni swi tshama eka xiyimo xa le hansi.

eng: the economies of two of our partners in brics, brazil and russia, are expected to contract this year.
tso: tiikhonomi ta vanakulorhi vambirhi eka brics: brazil na russia, ti languteriwile ku ya ehansi nan’waka.

eng: the third, china, will not register the kind of robust growth that it is known for.
tso: lera vunharhu, ku nga china, a ri nge swi koti ku tlakuka hi matimba lawa ri tivekaka hi wona.

eng: because our economy is relatively small and open, it is affected by all of these developments.
tso: tanihileswi ikhonomi ya hina yi nga yintsongo no pfuleka, ya khumbhiwa hi swivangelo hinkwaswo leswi.

eng: our economy is also affected by domestic factors such as the electricity constraints and industrial relations which are sometimes unstable.
tso: ikhonomi ya hina yi tlhela yi khumbhiwa hi swivangelo swa laha kaya swo fana na ku pfumaleka ka gezi na vuxaka bya swa vumaki lebyi tsekatsekaka swinene.

eng: the international monetary fund and the world bank predict that the south african economy will grow by less than 1% this year.
tso: nkwama wa timali ta misava na bangi ya misava swi vhumbha leswaku ikhonomi ya afrika-dzonga yi ta tlakuka hi phesente leyi nga tluleki yin’we nan’waka.

eng: the lower economic growth outcomes and outlook suggest that revenue collection will be lower than previously expected.
tso: vuntsanana bya mimbuyelo ya nkulo wa ikhonomi na xiyimo xa yona swi pima leswaku nhlengeleto wa xibalo wu ta va ehansi eka leswi a wu languterisiwile xiswona enkarhini lowu hundzuke.

eng: importantly, our country seems to be at risk of losing its investment grade status from ratings agencies.
tso: mhaka ya nkoka hi leswaku tiko ra hina ri vonaka ri ri eka nxungeto wo lahlekeriwa hi xiyimo xa rona xa vuvekisi ku suka eka tiejensi ta vuhlahluvi.

eng: if that happens, it will become more expensive for us to borrow money from abroad to finance our programmes of building a better life for all, especially the poor.
tso: loko sweswo swo humelela, swi ta hi durhela swinene ku lomba mali yo fambisa tiphurogireme ta hina eka matikomambe to aka vutomi byo antswa bya hinkwavo, ngopfungopfu swisiwana.

eng: the situation requires an effective turnaround plan from us.
tso: xiyimo lexi xi lava kungu ro cinca ro hetiseka ku suka eka hina.

eng: it is about doing things differently and also acting on what may not have been acted upon quickly before.
tso: mhaka leyi lavekaka i ku endla swilo hi tindlela tin’wana ni ku teka magoza laha a ya nga tekiwanga hi xihatla.

eng: i will share a few points that we believe would make a difference.
tso: ndzi ta mi avela tindlela to hlaya leti hi kholwaka leswaku ti ta tisa ku cinca ka swilo.

eng: first, our country remains an attractive investment destination.
tso: xo sungula, tiko ra hina ri tshama ri ri ndhawu leyi navetisaka vavekisi.

eng: it may face challenges, but its positive attributes far outweigh those challenges.
tso: ri nga va ni mintlhotlho, kambe leswinene swi nga kona swi pfala mintlhotlho leyi.

eng: we must continue to market the country as a preferred destination for investments.
tso: hi fanele ku ya emahlweni hi maketa tiko tanihi hi ndhawu leyi tsakisaka vavekisi.

eng: this requires a common narrative from all of us as business, labour and government.
tso: leswi swi lava hungu rin’we ku suka eka hinkwerhu ka hina tanihi mabindzu, vatirhi na mfumo.

eng: if there are any disagreements or problems between us, we should solve them before they escalate.
tso: loko ku ri na ku hambana hi miehleketo kumbe swiphiqo exikarhi ka hina, hi fanele ku swi lulamisa swi nga se hangalaka na misava hinkwayo.

eng: this is necessary for the common good of our country.
tso: ku endla tano i mhaka ya nkoka leyi vuyerisaka hinkwerhu etikweni ra hina.

eng: we have had fruitful meetings with business, including the high level meeting with chief executive officers on tuesday (9 february) this week.
tso: hi vi le ni tinhlengeletano leti tswaleke mihandzu na mabindzu, ku katsa na nhlengeletano ya xiyimo xa le henhla na vaofisirinkulu hi ravumbirhi (9 nyenyenyana) vhiki reri.

eng: we have heard the suggestions from the business community on how we can turn the situation around and put the economy back on a growth path.
tso: hi twile swiringanyeto ku suka eka vaaki va swa mabindzu hilaha hi nga cincaka xiyimo xi vuya ematshan’wini leswaku hi vuyisela ikhonomi eka ndlela ya yona ya nkulo.

eng: we have heard the points about the need to create the correct investment support infrastructure.
tso: hi twile miehleketo mayelana ni xiilaveko xo tumbuluxa switirhisiwa leswi faneleke swa nseketelo wa vuvekisi.

eng: government is developing a one stop shop/invest sa initiative to signal that south africa is truly open for business.
tso: mfumo wu le ku tumbuluxeni ka pfhumba ra one stop shop/invest sa ku koweta leswaku afrika-dzonga i tiko leri pfulekeke hakunene eka mabindzu.

eng: we will fast-track the implementation of this service, in partnership with the private sector.
tso: hi ta hatlisisa vuhumelerisi bya vukorhokeri lebyi hi ku tirhisa xinakulobye na mabindzu yo ka ya nga ri ya mfumo.

eng: such an initiative requires that government removes the red tape and reviews any legislative and regulatory blockages.
tso: pfhumba ro fana ni leri ri lava leswaku mfumo wu susa mafambiselo yo nonoko ni ku tlhela wu languta hi vuntshwa swirhalanganyi swa milawu na vulawuri.

eng: we have established an inter-ministerial committee on investment promotion which will ensure the success of investment promotion initiatives.
tso: hi tumbuluxile komiti ya vaholobye yo ndlandlamuuxa vuvekisi leyi nga ta tiyisisa ku humelela ka mapfhumba ya vuvekisi.

eng: compatriots, we have heard the concerns raised about the performance of state owned enterprises and companies.
tso: vanakulorhi, hi twile swivilelo leswi nga boxiwa hi matirhelo ya mabindzu na tikhamphani leti fambisiwaka hi mfumo.

eng: many of our state-owned companies (socs) are performing well.
tso: mabindzu ya hina yo hlaya lawa ya fambisiwaka hi mfumo (socs)ya tirha kahle.

eng: the south african national roads agency limited has built some of the best roads in gauteng and in many parts of the country.
tso: ejensi ya rixaka ya magondzo ya afrika-dzonga yi akile yan’wana ya magondzo ya xiyimo xa le henhla egauteng na le tindhawini to tala ta tiko.

eng: these make us the envy of many parts around the globe.
tso: magondzo lawa ya hi vangela mavondzo eka swiyenge swo hlaya swa misava.

eng: the trans caledon tunnel authority has constructed dams of varied capacities, thus making it possible for our people to have access to safe drinking water.
tso: nhlangano wa tithanele wa ntsemakanyo wa caledon wu akile madamu ya matshaku yo hambanahambana, leswi endlaka leswaku vanhu va hina va kota ku fikelela mati yo n’wa lama nga hlayiseka.

eng: transnet has built rail infrastructure which has enabled our country’s mines to move massive bulk of commodities through our ports to markets around the globe.
tso: transnet yi akile switirhisiwa swa swiporo leswi nga endla leswaku migodi ya tiko ra hina yi kota ku tleketla swimakiwa hi nhlayo ya le henhla hi ku tirhisa tiphoto ta hina, leswaku swi yisiwa eka timakete ta misava.

eng: eskom, in spite of the challenges, still manages to keep the economy going, against all odds.
tso: eskom, handle ka mintlhotlho leyi nga kona, ya ha kota ku endla leswaku ikhonomi yi ya emahlweni, ehenhla ka swiphiqo swo tala swinene.

eng: our development finance institutions such as the industrial development corporation or development bank of southern africa and others have provided finance for infrastructure, various industries and agricultural businesses without fail, even in the aftermath of the global financial crisis.
tso: minhlangano ya hina ya swa timali ta nhluvukiso yo fana na khoporexeni ya nhluvukiso wa swa vumaki (idc) kumbe bangi ya nhluvukiso ya le dzongeni wa afrika na yin’wana yi nyikile timali ta switirhisiwa, vumaku byo hambanahambana na mabindzu ya swa vurimi handle ka ku tsandzeka, yi endlile tano endzhaku ka nxaniseko wa mpfilupfilu wa swa timali emisaveni.

eng: for the socs to contribute to the successful implementation of the ndp, they must be financially sound.
tso: ku va tisoc ti hoxa xandla eku humelerisiweni ka ndp, ti fanele ti va na nkwama wa timali lowu langutekaka.

eng: they must be properly governed and managed.
tso: ti fanele ti fambisiwa ni ku lawuriwa hi tindlela letinene.

eng: we will ensure the implementation of the recommendations of the presidential review commission on state-owned enterprises, which outlines how the institutions should be managed.
tso: hi ta tiyisisa ku humelerisiwa ka swibumabumelo swa khomixini ya vulangutisisi ya phuresidente eka mabindzu ya mfumo, leyi vulavulaka hilaha minhlangano leyi yi faneleke ku lawuriwa hakona.

eng: the deputy president chairs the inter-ministerial committee which is tasked with ensuring the implementation of these recommendations.
tso: xandla xa phuresidente u fambisa komiti ya vaholobye leyi ntirho wa yona ku nga ku tiyisisa vuhumelerisi bya swibumabumelo leswi.

eng: we have to streamline and sharpen the mandates of the companies and ensure that where there are overlaps in the mandates, there is immediate rationalisation.
tso: hi fanele ku lulamisa ni ku lota mintirho ya tikhamphani leti ni ku tiyisisa leswaku laha ku nga na nkwetlembetano wa matirhelo, ku lulamisiwa ka swiphiqo xikanwekan’we.

eng: those companies that are no longer relevant to our development agenda will be phased out.
tso: tikhamphani leti mintirho ya tona yi nga ha yelaniki na ajenda ya hina ya nhluvukiso ti fanele ku herisiwa.

eng: government departments to which they report, will set the agenda and identify key projects for the socs to implement, over a defined period.
tso: tindzawulo ta mfumo leti tikhamphani leti ti vikaka eka tona ti ta pfapfarhuta ajenda ni ku humesa tiphurojekenkulu leswaku socs yi ti humelerisa, enkarhini lowu pimiweke.

eng: proper monitoring and evaluation will be done.
tso: vukambisisi bya matirhelo no hlela lebyi faneleke byi ta endliwa.

eng: these interventions are essential for growth and also for the reduction of national debt levels.
tso: minghenelelo leyi yi ni nkoka eka nkulo wa ikhonomi ni ku hunguta swiyimo swa swikweleti swa rixaka.

eng: compatriots, we must take advantage of the exchange rate as well as the recent changes of visa regulations, to boost inbound tourism.
tso: vaakatiko kulorhi,hi fanele ku tirhisa nkarhi wa cincano wa timali na ku cinca loku nga kona ka milawu ya vhisa, leswaku hi nyanyula vupfhumba laha ndzeni ka tiko.

eng: sa tourism will invest r100 million a year to promote domestic tourism, encouraging south africans to tour their country.
tso: vupfhumba sa wu ta vekisa r100 miliyoni hi lembe ku tlakusa vupfhumba bya laha kaya, ku khutaza maafrika-dzonga ku endla vupfhumba etikweni ra vona.

eng: we have heard concerns from companies about delays in obtaining visas for skilled personnel from abroad.
tso: hi twile swivilelo ku suka etikhamphanini mayelana ni ku hlwela ka ku humesiwa ka tivhisa ta vanhu lava nga ni vuswikoti ku suka eka matikomambe.

eng: while we prefer that employers prioritise local workers, our migration policy must also make it possible to import scarce skills.
tso: loko ha ha navela leswaku vathori va teka vatirhi va laha kaya tanihi xirhangana, pholisi ya hina ya vupfhumba yi fanele yi tlhela yi endla leswaku swi endleka ku xava vuswikoti byo kala ku suka eka matikomambe.

eng: the draft migration policy will be presented to cabinet during the course of 2016. we have heard the appeals for policy certainty in the mining sector, especially with regards to the mineral and petroleum resources development bill.
tso: mpfapfarhuto wa pholisi yo rhurha wu ta andlariwa eka khabinete eku fambeni ka 2016. hi twile tiaphili ta pholisi leyi tiyeke eka xiyenge xa migodi, ngopfungopfu mayelana na nawumbisi wa nhluvukiso wa switirhisiwa swa swicelwa na mafurha.

eng: the bill was referred back to parliament last year.
tso: nawumbisi lowu wu tlherisiwile epalamende n’waxemu.

eng: we await parliament to conclude the processing, which we trust will be done expeditiously.
tso: hi yimerile palamende leswaku yi hetisisa nawumbisi lowu, hi kholwa leswaku swi ta endliwa hi nkarhi lowu nga hetiki mbilu.

eng: compatriots, we need to empower small, medium and micro enterprises (smmes) to accelerate their growth.
tso: vaakatiko kulorhihi fanele ku nyika matimba eka mabindzu lamantsongo, ma le xikarhi na lamakulu (smmes) ku hatlisisa nkulo wa wona.

eng: access to high-quality, innovative business support can dramatically improve the success rate of new ventures.
tso: mfikelelo wa nseketelo wa mabindzu wa xiyimo xa le henhla swi nga antswisa ku humelela ka mabindzu lamantshwa hi ndlela leyi nga languteriwangiki.

eng: the department of small business development was established to provide such targeted support to small business.
tso: ndzawulo ya nhluvukiso wa mabindzu lamantsongo yi tumbuluxiwile ku nyika nseketelo wo fana na walowo eka mabindzu lamantsongo lama kongomiweke.

eng: economic transformation and black empowerment remain a key part of all economic programmes of government.
tso: ku hundzuluxiwa ka ikhonomi na ku nyika matimba eka vantima swi tshama swi ri xiphemunkulu xa tiphurogireme hinkwato ta ikhonomi ya tiko.

eng: one of our new interventions is the black industrialists scheme, which has been launched to promote the participation of black entrepreneurs in manufacturing.
tso: yin’we ya minghenelelo ya hina yintshwa i xikimi xa vamaki va vantima, lexi simekiweke ku tlakusa ku tinghenisa ka van’wamabindzu va vantima eka swa vumaki.

eng: we urge big business to partner with new manufacturers including businesses owned by women and the youth, as part of broadening the ownership and control of the economy.
tso: hi khutaza mabindzu lamakulu ku endla xinakulobye na vamaki lavantshwa ku katsa mabindzu lama vinyi va wona ku nga vavasati na vantshwa, tanihi xiphemu xo ndlandlamuxa vun’wini na vulawuri bya ikhonomi.

eng: compatriots, we are proud of our top 10 ranking in the world economic forum competitiveness report with respect to financial services.
tso: vaakatiko kulorhi,ha tinyungubyisa hi xiyimo xa vukhume eka xiviko xa vuphikizani eka foramu ya ikhonomi ya misava mayelana na vukorhokerhi bya swa timali.

eng: maintaining and indeed improving our ranking is important to our competitiveness as a country.
tso: ku tshamisisa ni ku antswisa xiyimo xa hina i swa nkoka eka vuphikizani bya hina tanihi tiko.

eng: it is also fundamental to our ambition to become a financial centre for africa.
tso: nakambe i swa nkoka eka ku navel aka hina ko hundzuka senthara ya timali ya afrika.

eng: the banks, through the banking association of south africa, are to launch a project aimed at establishing a centre of excellence for financial services and leadership training.
tso: tibangi, hi ku tirhisa nhlangano wa tibangi wa afrika-dzonga, ti ta simeka phurojeke leyi kongomisiweke eka ku tumbuluxa senthara ya vuswikoti bya vukorhokerhi bya timali na vuleteri bya vurhangeri.

eng: this will ensure that as a country we can attract, nurture, develop and retain the best talent in financial services in our country and across our continent.
tso: leswi swi ta tiyisisa leswaku tanihi tiko hi nga koka rinoko, ku hlayisa, ku hluvukisa ni ku tshama na nyiko ya xiyimo xa le henhla evukorhokerini bya timali etikweni ra hina ni le ka tikonkulu hinkwaro.

eng: they will work with the minister of finance and national treasury to get this done.
tso: va ta tirha na holobye wa timali na timali ta rixaka ku endla leswaku leswi swi humelela.

eng: we believe that this will over time ensure that we can expand the pool of financial skills and broaden the job opportunities for many young people.
tso: hi kholwa leswaku hi ku famba ka nkarhi swi ta tiyisisa leswaku hi kota ku ndlandlamuxa xihlovo xa vuswikoti bya hina bya swa timali ni ku ndlandlamuxa swivandla swa mintirho eka vantshwa vo hlaya.

eng: this strategic project from the banking sector is a positive and encouraging outcome of our engagement with business this week.
tso: phurojeke leyi ya kungu ku suka eka sekithara ya bangi i mbuyelo lowunene ni ku khutaza mbuyelo wa ntirhisano wa hina na mabindzu vhiki leri.

eng: together we move south africa forward!
tso: swin’we hi yisa afrika-dzonga emahlweni!

eng: compatriots, we have made an undertaking to spend public funds wisely and to cut wasteful expenditure, but without compromising on the core business of government and the provision of services to our people.
tso: vaakatiko kulorhi, hi tekile xiboho xo tirhisa timali ta tiko hi vutlharhi ni ku hunguta ku tirhisa mali hi vusompfa, kambe handle ko yisa ehansi ntirho wa mfumo na vukorhokeri bya mphakelo wa vukorhokeri evanhwini.

eng: in 2013, the minister of finance announced a number of cost-containment measures.
tso: hi 2013, holobye wa timali u tivisile tindlela to hunguta ku tirhisa mali hi vusompfa.

eng: excessive and wasteful expenditure has been reduced, but there is still more to be done to cut wastage.
tso: ku tirhisa timali ku tlula mpimo ni ku yi tirhisa hi vusompfa swi hungutanile, kambe ka ha ri ni swo tala leswi faneleke ku endliwa ku tsema matirhiselo ya timali hi ndlela ya vusompfa.

eng: i would like to announce some measures this evening.
tso: ndzi rhandza ku andlala tin’wana ta tindlela leti madyambu lawa.

eng: overseas trips will be curtailed and those requesting permission will have to motivate strongly and prove the benefit to the country.
tso: marendzo ya le tsungeni wa malwandle ya ta hungutiwa naswona lava kombelaka pfumelelo wo endla tano va fanele ku bumabumela hi matimba ni ku humesa vumbhoni bya leswaku tiko ri ta vuyeriwa njhani.

eng: the sizes of delegations will be greatly reduced and standardised.
tso: vukulu bya ntlawa wa vurhumiwa byi ta hungutiwa swinene ni ku ringanisiwa.

eng: further restrictions on conferences, catering, entertainment and social functions will be instituted.
tso: swipimelo swin’wana swa tikhomferense, swakudya, ku titsakisa na mintlangu swi ta endliwa.

eng: the budget vote dinners for stakeholders hosted by government departments in parliament, after the delivery of budget speeches will no longer take place.
tso: swakudya swa swirho eka vhoti ya mpimanyeto leyi rhurheriwaka hi tindzawulo ta mfumo epalamende, endzhaku ka mimbulavulo ya mpimanyeto a swi nga ha vi kona.

eng: the minister of finance will announce more measures and further details in the budget vote speech on 24 february.
tso: holobye wa timali u ta tivisa tindlela tin’wana na vuxokoxoko byin’wana eka mbulavulo wa vhoti ya mpimanyeto hi ti 24 ta nyenyankulu.

eng: the executive management and boards of public agencies and socs must undertake similar measures.
tso: vafambisinkulu na tibodo ya tiejensi ta tikhamphani ta mfumo na tisoc ti fanele ku teka tindlela to yelana.

eng: i also invite premiers of all nine provinces as well as mayors to join us as we begin eliminating wasteful expenditure within government.
tso: ndzi tlhela ndzi rhamba vaphirimiya va swifundzhankulu swa nkaye ku katsa na vameyara ku endla tanihilaha hi anakanyaka hakona loko hi sungula ku lwa ni ku tirhisa mali hi vusompfa eka mfumo.

eng: i trust that parliament and the judiciary will also be persuaded to consider the implementation of similar measures.
tso: ndzi kholwa leswaku palamende na xiyenge xa vululami swi ta khutazeka ku landzelela vuhumelerisi bya tindlela leti fanaka.

eng: compatriots, a big expenditure item, that we would like to persuade parliament to consider, is the maintenance of two capitals, pretoria as the administrative one and cape town as the legislative capital.
tso: vaakatiko kulorhi,xilo xikulu xo durha, lexi hi rhandzaka ku khutaza palamende leswaku yi xi langutisisa, i ku ya emahlweni hi va na mintsindza yimbirhi, pitori tanihi ntsindza wa vufambisi bya mfumo, na doroba ra kapa tanihi ntsindza wa huvo ya milawu.

eng: we believe that the matter requires the attention of parliament soon.
tso: hi kholwa leswaku mhaka leyi yi fanele ku hoxiwa tihlo hi palamende ku nga ri khale.

eng: compatriots, we all have a lot to do to turn the economy around and to cut wastage.
tso: vaakatiko kulorhi,hinkwerhu hi na swo tala leswi faneleke ku endliwa ku cinca xiyimo xa ikhonomi na ku hunguta ku tirhisa mali hi vusompfa.

eng: we will go through a difficult period for a while, but when the economy recovers, we will be proud of ourselves for having done the right thing.
tso: hi ta famba eku tikeriweni nkarhi wo leha, kambe loko ikhonomi yi vuyelela, hi ta tinyungubyisa hikuva hi endlile leswi a swi fanele ku endliwa.

eng: compatriots, i would now like to report back on the undertakings made last year.
tso: vaakatiko kulorhi,ndzi rhandza ku mi vikela hi mintirho leyi endliweke n’waxemu.

eng: during the state of the nation address in february 2015, i announced the nine-point plan to respond to sluggish growth.
tso: eka mbulavulo hi xiyimo xa rixaka hi nyenyenyani 2015, ndzi tivisile kungu ra swilo swa nkaye ro hlamula ku nonoka ka nkulo wa ikhonomi.

eng: we introduced the agri-parks programme, aimed at increasing the participation of small holder farmers in agricultural activities.
tso: mfumo wu ta ya emahlweni wo pfuna van’wamapurasi ni ku tlhela wu yisa vukorhokerhi bya mati hi mathangi emigangeni.

eng: allow me to introduce the winner of the female entrepreneur of the year 2015, ms julia shungube, from nkomazi local municipality in mpumalanga.
tso: xiphemu xo sungula xa phurojeke ya ndlandlamuxo ya mati ya crocodile na mokolo endhawini ya lephalale elimpopo xi le ku tirheni hi ku hetiseka.

eng: the speaker of the national assembly,the chairperson of the national council of provinces (ncop),deputy speaker of the national assembly and deputy chairperson of the ncop, deputy president cyril ramaphosa,former president thabo mbeki, chief justice mogoeng mogoeng and all esteemed members of the judiciary,ministers and deputy ministers,premiers and speakers of provincial legislatures, chairperson of the south african local government association, the heads of chapter 9 institutions, chairperson of the national house of traditional leaders,the president of the muslim judicial council and all leaders of faith-based organisations,the former speaker of the national assembly, dr frene ginwala,veterans of the struggle for liberation,members of the diplomatic corps,fellow south africans,good evening, sanibonani, molweni, dumelang, goeie naand, lotjhani, riperile, ndimadekwana,thank you madam speaker and madam chairperson for this opportunity to address the joint sitting of parliament.
tso: xipikara xa huvo ya rixaka,mutshamaxitulu wa huvo ya rixaka ya swifundzankulu (ncop),xandla xa xipikara xa huvo ya rixaka na xandla xa mutshamaxitulu wa ncop, xandla xa phuresidente cyril ramaphosa,khale ka phuresidente thabo mbeki, muavanyisinkulu mogoeng mogoeng na swirho hinkwaswo swo hlonipheka swa vululami,vaholobye na swandla swa vaholobye,vaholobyenkulu na swipikara swa tihuvo ta milawu ta swifundzankulu,mutshamaxitulu wa nhlangano wa mfumo wa muganga wa afrika-dzonga,tinhloko ta mihlangano ya xiyenge xa 9,mutshamaxitulu wa yindlu ya rixaka ya varhangeri va xintu,phuresidente wa huvo ya swa vuavanyisi ya mamuslim na varhangeri hinkwavo va mihlangano ya vupfumeri,khale ka xipikara xa huvo ya rixaka, dok.

eng: an illustrious son of our country, president oliver reginald tambo, would have turned 100 years old this year, had he lived.
tso: frene ginwala,tinhenha ta valwelantshuxekoswirho swa mihlangano ya xidipilomati,maafrika-dzonga kulorhi,riperile, good evening, sanibonani, molweni, dumelang, goeie naand, lotjhani, ndimadekwana,ndza khensa manana xipikarana na manana mutshamaxitulu nkarhi lowu ndzi nyikiweke wona wo vulavula na ntshamo wa nhlanganelo wa palamende.

eng: this selfless patriot dedicated.
tso: murhandza tiko loyi wo ka a nga tilaveli swa yena ntsena u nyiketele.

eng: his adult life to a tireless pursuit of the liberation of our country and its people.
tso: vutomi bya vuntswatsi bya yena eka ku lava ntshuxeko wa tiko ra hina na vanhu va rona a nga karhali.

eng: he left a lasting legacy for all south africans, and not only for his organisation, the anc.
tso: u siyile ndzhaka leyi nga heriki eka maafrika-dzonga hinkwawo, naswona ku nga ri ntsena eka nhlangano wa yena, anc.

eng: in his honour, we have declared the year 2017, the year of oliver reginald tambo.
tso: hi ku n'wi xixima, hi hlambanyile lembe ra 2017 ku va, lembe ra oliver reginald tambo.

eng: it is the year of unity in action by all south africans as we move south africa forward, together.
tso: i lembe ra vun'we eka nghingiriko hi maafrika-dzonga hinkwawo loko hi karhi hi yisa swin'we afrika-dzonga emahlweni.

eng: we have the pleasure to host members of the tambo family this evening, mr dali tambo and his wife rachel, and their son, oliver tambo junior.
tso: hi ni ntsako ku rhurhela swirho swa ndyangu wa ka tambo madyambu lawa, tat.

eng: we also fondly remember mama africa, miriam makeba, who made history when she addressed the united nations in 1963, appealing for action against the apartheid regime.
tso: dali tambo na nsati wa yena rachel, na jaha ra vona, oliver tambo junior.

eng: we extend a warm welcome to her granddaughter, zenzile makeba lee, and great-grandson, lindelani.
tso: hi tlhela hi tsundzuka hi rirhandzu ra mama africa, miriam makeba, loyi a endleke matimu loko a vulavula na nhlangano wa matiko ya misava hi 1963, a kombela nghingiriko wo lwa na mfumo wa xihlawuhlawu.

eng: compatriots, in this 23rd year of our freedom, our mission remains the quest for a united, democratic, non-sexist, non-racial and prosperous south africa.
tso: hi amukela hi ntsako ntukulu wa yena wa nhwanyana, zenzile makeba lee, na ntukulu-xinghuwenghuwe wa mufana, lindelani.

eng: guided by the national development plan (ndp), we are building a south africa that must be free from poverty, inequality and unemployment.
tso: vaakatikokulorhi,eka lembe leri ra vu 23 ra ntshuxeko wa hina, xikongomelo xa hina xi tshama ku ri mbalango wa afrika-dzonga ra vun'we, xidemokirasi, nkaxihlawularimbewu, nkaxihlawulambalo na ra ku humelela.

eng: while the global economic environment remains uncertain, indications are that we have entered a period of recovery.
tso: loko swivangelo swa ikhonomi ya matiko hinkwawo swi tshama swi nga tshembisi, swikombiso i swa leswaku hi nghenile eka nkarhi wo antswisa.

eng: we anticipate an economic growth rate of 1.3% in 2017 following an estimated 0.5% in 2016. however, the economy is still not growing fast enough to create the jobs that we need.
tso: hi langutela mpimo wa ku kula ka ikhonomi ka 1.3% hi 2017 ku landza nkumbetelo wa 0.5% hi 2016. hambiswiritano, ikhonomi a yi le ku kuleni hi ku hatlisa loku ringaneke ku tumbuluxa mitirho leyi hi yi lavaka.

eng: there are some of our people, including youth, who have not worked for years.
tso: ku na vanhu va hina van'wana, ku katsa na vantshwa, lava va nga riki ku tirheni malembe yo tala.

eng: it is for this reason that we decided to focus on a few key areas packaged as the nine-point plan to reignite growth so that the economy can create the much-needed jobs.
tso: hi mhaka ya xivangelo lexi hi bohile ku kongomisa eka tindhawu ta nkoka ti nga ri tingani leti hlanganisiweke tanihi kungu ra timhaka ta kaye ku hlohlotela ku kula leswaku ikhonomi yi ta tumbuluxa mitirho leyi laveka swinene.

eng: the focus areas include industrialisation, mining and beneficiation, agriculture and agro-processing, energy, small, medium and micro enterprises (smmes), managing workplace conflict, attracting investments, growing the oceans economy and tourism.
tso: tindhawu leti kongomisiweke ti katsa vutumbuluxivumaki, magodi na ku hungutiwa ka ore, vurimi na ku phurosesiwa ka swikumiwa swa vurimi, eneji, mabindzunyingi lamatsongo, ya le xikarhi na lamatsongo swinene (tismme), ku fambisa nkwetlembetano wa le ntirhweni, ku koka mahlo ya vuvekisi, ku kurisa ikhonomi ya le lwandle na vupfhumba.

eng: we also added cross-cutting areas such as science and technology, water and sanitation infrastructure, transport infrastructure and broadband roll-out.
tso: hi tlhele hi engetela tindhawu leti nghenelelanaka to fana na sayense na thekinoloji, mati na switirhisiwa swa mbhasiso, switirhisiwa swa vutlaketli na ku sunguriwa ka tindlela ta vuhlanganisi.

eng: i would like to provide a report back on the work done in some of these areas in the past year.
tso: ndzi ta tsakela ku nyika xiviko eka ntirho lowu endliweke eka tin'wana ta tindhawu leti eka lembe leri hundzeke.

eng: the interaction that we started last year between government, business and labour, known as the ceo initiative, has been most helpful.
tso: ku tirhelana loku hi ku sunguleke lembe leri hundzeke exikarhi ka mfumo, bindzu na vatirhi, loku tivekaka tanihi matshalatshala ya ceo, ku vile ku pfuna swinene.

eng: we were able to address some domestic challenges, together.
tso: hi kotile ku lulamisa yin'wana ya mitlhontlho ya le makaya, swin'we.

eng: we successfully avoided credit ratings downgrades, which would have had a significant impact on our economy.
tso: hi papalatile hi vuswikoti ku yisiwa ehansi ka mipimo ya swikweleti, leswi a swi ta va na khumbho wukulu eka ikhonomi ya hina.

eng: our labour-market environment is also showing signs of stability, due to cooperation by social partners.
tso: mbangu wa vanhu va hina lava ringaneleke ku tirha wu le ku kombeni ka swikombiso swa ntshamiseko, hikokwalaho ka ntirhisano wa mitlawa ya vanhu.

eng: the manner in which parties conducted and carried themselves during the wage negotiations in the platinum sector in particular, must be applauded.
tso: ndlela leyi mihlangano yi tikhomeke na ku tirha hakona hi nkarhi wa mikanerisano ya miholo eka xiyenge xa pulatinamu ngopfungopfu, yi fanele ku beriwa mandla.

eng: unity in action was also demonstrated again this week with the conclusion of the agreement on the national minimum wage and on measures to stabilise labour relations.
tso: ku langutisa eka mhaka yin'we swi tlhele swi kombisiwa vhiki leri loko ku fikeleriwa ntwanano eka muholo wa mpimohasi wa rixaka na le ka tindlela to tshamisekisa vuxaka bya vathori na vathoriwa.

eng: this follows a call i made in the state of the nation address on 14 june 2014. we congratulate the deputy president and the team at the national economic development and labour council for this milestone and wish them well for work that still needs to be done.
tso: leswi swi landzela xikombelelo lexi ndzi xi endleke eka mbulavulo phuresidente na rixaka hi ti 14 khotavuxika 2014. hi khensisa xandla xa phuresidente na ntlawa wa huvo ya vatirhi na nhluvukiso wa ikhonomi wa rixaka eka ntirho lowu na ku va navelela swa kahle eka ntirho lowu wa ha lavaka ku endliwa.

eng: compatriots,the extension of basic services to the people continued in the past year as we pursued a better life for all.
tso: vaakatikokulorhi,ku engeteriwa ka vukorhokeri bya masungulo eka vanhu ku yile emahlweni eka lembe leri hundzeke hilaha hi landzeleriseke hakona vutomi byo antswa eka hinkwavo.

eng: to date, nearly seven million households have been connected to the grid and now have electricity.
tso: ku fikela sweswi, kwalomu ka mindyangu ya nkombo wa timiliyoni va hoxeriwile gexi ku suka eka xitichi xa gezi naswona sweswi se va na gezi.

eng: the successful execution of the eskom’s build and maintenance programmes helped to ensure stability and an end to load shedding.
tso: ku humelela ka ntirho wa minongonoko ya ku aka na mahlayiselo ya eskom ku pfunile ku tiyisisa ntshamiseko na ku herisa ku tima gezi hi ku siyerisana.

eng: work is continuing to ensure energy security.
tso: ntirho wu le ku yeni emahlweni ku tiyisisa vusirheleri bya eneji.

eng: renewable energy forms an important part of our energy mix, which also includes electricity generation from gas, nuclear, solar, wind, hydro and coal.
tso: eneji leyi pfuxetiwaka yi vumba xiphemu xa nkoka xa nhlanganelo wa eneji, leyi tlhelaka yi katsa na ku tumbuluxiwa ka gezi ku suka eka gasi, nyutliliya, dyambu, moya, mati na malahla.

eng: government is committed to the overall independent power producer programme and we are expanding the programme to other sources of energy including coal and gas, in addition to renewable energy.
tso: mfumo wu tiyimiserile eka nongonoko wa vuhumelerisi bya gezi ro tiyimela wo angarhela naswona hi le ku ndlandlamuxeni ka nongonoko ku ya eka swihlovo swin'wana swa eneji ku katsa na malahla na gasi, ku engetela eka eneji leyi vuyelerisiwaka.

eng: eskom will sign the outstanding power purchase agreements for renewable energy in line with the procured rounds.
tso: eskom yi ta sayina mitwanano yo xava gezi leyi saleleke endzhaku ya eneji leyi pfuxetiwaka hi ku fambisana na tindlela ta nkumo.

eng: government is working hard to ensure reliable bulk water supply in the various areas of the country to support economic growth while increasing access to vulnerable and rural municipalities.
tso: mfumo wu le ku tirheni swinene ku tiyisisa mphakelo wa mati yo tala lowu tshembekaka eka tindhawu to hambanahambana ta tiko ku seketela ku kula ka ikhonomi loko wu karhi wu tlakusa mfikelelo eka timasipala ta le makaya na leti nga sirhelelekangiki.

eng: in an effort to curb high water losses, which in some municipalities far exceed the national average, which is currently at 37%.
tso: eka matshalatshala yo hunguta ku lahlekeriwa hi mati, laha eka timasipala tin'wana ti hundzuka kule nhlayo-xikarhi ya rixaka, leyi sweswi yi nga eka 37%.

eng: about 10 000 unemployed youth are being trained as plumbers, artisans and water agents.
tso: kwalomu ka vantshwa va vupfumalantirho va 10 000 va le ku leteriweni tanihi vapulambara, athizene na vayimeri va mati.

eng: more will be recruited this year to reach the total of 15 000. we call upon municipalities to support the war on leaks programme.
tso: vo tala va ta thoriwa lembe leri ku fikelela ntsengo wa 15 000. hi rhamba timasipala ku seketela nongonoko wa ku lwa na ku pfuta.

eng: we continue to build modern schools, replacing mud structures and other inappropriate buildings through the accelerated schools infrastructure delivery initiative.
tso: hi ya emahlweni hi aka swikolo swa ximanguva lawa, hi siva swivumbeko swa ridaka na miako yin'wana yo ka yi nga fanelangi hi ku tirhisa pfhumba ro hatlisisa mphakelo wa switirhisiwa swa swikolo.

eng: this gives our children dignity.
tso: leswi swi nyika vana va hina xindzhuti.

eng: a total of 173 inappropriate structures have been eradicated since 2011. in total, 895 new schools now provide a conducive learning environment for our children.
tso: ntsengo wa swivumbeko swo ka swi nga fanelangi swa 173 se swi herisiwile ku sukela hi 2011. ntsengo hinkwawo, wa 895 wa swikolo swintshwa sweswi wu nyika ndhawu yo dzondzela ya kahle eka vana va hina.

eng: on investment promotion, government has established investsa, an investment one-stop shop nationally and will open provincial centres in kwazulu-natal, gauteng and the western cape.
tso: ntlakuso wa vuvekisi, mfumo wu tumbuluxile investsa, vhengele ro tirhela swilo swo tala swa vuvekisi etikweni hinkwaro naswona wu ta pfula tisenthara ta swifundzankulu ekwazulu-natal, gauteng na le kapa-vupeladyambu.

eng: the message is clear to the affected government departments.
tso: mahungu ya le rivaleni eka tindzawulo ta mfumo leti khumbekeke.

eng: there must be no undue delays and no unnecessary red tape.
tso: a ku fanelangi ku va na ku hlwela loku nga fanelangiki naswona a ku fanelangi ku va na milawu yo tikisa yo ka yi nga fanelangi.

eng: from issuing licences to visas, we should make it easy to do business in south africa.
tso: kusuka eku nyikeni tilayisense ku ya eku nyikeni tivhisa, hi fanele hi endla leswaku swi olova ku endla bindzu eafrika-dzonga.

eng: compatriots,president oliver reginald tambo was a maths and science teacher.
tso: vaakatiko kulorhi,phuresidente oliver reginald tambo a ri mudyondzisi wa metse na sayense.

eng: government will thus prioritise maths and science more than ever before this year, in his memory.
tso: hi mukhuva wolowo mfumo wu ta rhangisa metse na sayense ku tlula emasungulweni lembe leri, hi ku n'wi tsundzuka.

eng: we are encouraged by recent international test results.
tso: ha khutaziwa hi mivuyelo ya swikambelo swa misava hinkwayo swa sweswi.

eng: the results in the trends in international mathematics and science study and the southern and east african consortium for monitoring educational quality show that the performance of south african learners is improving.
tso: mivuyelo eka mitolovelo ya dyondzo ya metse na sayense ya misava hinkwayo na ntlawa wa le dzongeni na vuxa bya afrika ya nandzeleriso na nkoka wa swa dyondzo yi kombisa leswaku matirhele ya vadyondzi va afrika dzonga ya le ku tlakukeni.

eng: among the participating countries, south africa has shown the largest improvement of 87 points in mathematics and 90 points in science.
tso: exikarhi ka matiko lawa ya nghenaka, afrika-dzonga ri kombisile ku antswa ku kulu ka mikutlunya ya 87 eka metse na mikutlunya ya 90 eka sayense.

eng: this is very encouraging, as we do not want our children to be left behind.
tso: leswi swa khutaza swinene, tanihileswi hi nga laviki vana va hina ku va va salela endzhaku.

eng: our investment in science and technology is yielding results.
tso: vuvekisi bya hina eka sayense na thekinoloji byi le ku tswaleni mihandzu.

eng: since south africa, supported by its eight african partners, won the bid to host the square kilometre array (ska) telescope, significant progress has been made in building this mega science project and reaping its benefits.
tso: tanihileswi afrika-dzonga, hi ku seketeriwa hi vatirhisani va rona va nhungu va afrika, ri humeleleke eka bidi yo rhurhela thelesikopu ya square kilometre array (ska), nhluvuko wa nkoka se wu endliwile eku akeni ka phurojeke ya sayense leyikulu swinene na ku dya mihandzu ya yona.

eng: together with its precursor, the meerkat telescope, the ska project continues to make important contributions to socio-economic development in south africa.
tso: swin'we na mulandzeri wa yona, thelesikopu ya meerkat, phurojeke ya ska yi ya emahlweni yi endla minyikelo ya nkoka eka nhluvukiso wa ikhonomi ya vanhu eafrika-dzonga.

eng: working closely with the industry, the department of science and technology is implementing a technology localisation strategy.
tso: hi ku tirhisana swin'we na vumaki, ndzawulo ya sayense na thekinoloji yi le ku simekeni qhinga ra thekiniloji ro lulamela ndhawu yo karhi ra thekinoloji.

eng: this has ensured that the r2 billion meerkat telescope is constructed with 75% local content.
tso: leswi swi tiyisisile leswaku thelesikopu ya meerkat ya r2 biliyoni yi akiwile hi 75% ya swilo swa laha kaya.

eng: this has led to job creation in the northern cape and diversification of the economy through the creation of artisan and maintenance jobs, and the promotion of science as a career of choice.
tso: leswi swi endlile ku tumbuluxiwa ka mitirho ekapa-n’walungu na ku cinca ka ikhonomi hi ku tumbuluxiwa ka mitirho ya athizeni na mahlayiselo, na ntlakuso wa sayense tanihi ku hlawula ka ntirhovutomi.

eng: on road infrastructure, sanral has started with the planning phase of the r4.5 billion project to upgrade the current moloto road.
tso: eka switirhisiwa swa magondzo, sanral yi sungurile xiphemu xa makungu xa phurojeke ya r4.5 biliyoni ku antswisa gondzo moloto ra sweswi.

eng: (the moloto road and a railway line are currently under construction with the purpose of ensuring the safety of road users and also bring to an end, the accidents that claim many lives.
tso: gondzo ra moloto na xiporo swi le ku akiweni hi xikongomelo xo tiyisisa vuhlayiseki bya vatirhisi va gondzo na ku tlhela ku herisiwa, tinghozi leti koxeke vutomi bya vo tala.

eng: )during 2016, south africa also signed a cooperation agreement with the people’s republic of china (prc) to build the moloto rail development corridor.
tso: hi nkarhi wa 2016, afrika-dzonga ri tlhele ri sayina ntwanano wa ntirhisano na china ku aka moloto rail development corridor.

eng: in 2014, we launched the operation phakisa big fast results methodology in the ocean economy, health, education and mining sectors.
tso: hi 2014, hi simekile operation phakisa big fast results methodology eka swiyenge swa ikhonomi ya lwandle, rihanyo, dyondzo na migodi.

eng: the purpose was to find a few key projects where we could unlock growth in implementing the ndp.
tso: xikongomelo a ku ri ku kuma tiphurojeke ta nkoka ti nga ri tingani laha hi nga fikelelaka ku kula eku simekiweni ka ndp.

eng: all projects are proceeding well.
tso: tiphurojeke hinkwato ti le ku fambeni kahle.

eng: the south african navy also participates in the operation phakisa project and is preparing to host the government garage concept for all state-owned vessels in simon’s town, including the maintenance and repair of government-owned vessels, through the newly established south african navy/armscor/denel partnership.
tso: masocha ya le matini ya afrika-dzonga na wona ya nghenelerile eka phurojeke ya operation phakisa naswona ya le ku tilulamiseleni ku rhurhela miehleketo ya garaji ya mfumo ya swikepe swa mfumo hinkwaswo esimon’s town, ku katsa na mahlayiselo na ku lunghisa swikepe swa mfumo, hi ku tirhisa vutirhisani navy/armscor/denel bya afrika-dzonga lebya ha ku tumbuluxiwaka.

eng: we had identified tourism as a key job driver.
tso: hi langile vupfhumba tanihi vufambisi bya ntirho wa nkoka.

eng: we are thus pleased that our tourist arrival numbers for the period january to november 2016 increased to nine million, an increase of just over a million arrivals from 2015. this represents a 13% growth in tourist arrivals.
tso: hi mukhuva wolowo ha tsaka leswaku tinomboro ta ku fika ka vapfhumba va hina eka nkarhi wa sunguti ku fikela hukuri 2016 ti tlakukile ku fikela eka timiliyoni ta kaye, ntlakuko wa ku hundzanyana eka miliyoni wa lava fikeke ku suka hi 2015. leswi swi yimela ku kula ka 13% ka ku fika ka vapfhumba.

eng: government runs effective poverty alleviation programmes such as the expanded public works programme (epwp).
tso: mfumo wu fambisa hi vuswikoti minongonoko yo vevukisa vusweti yo fana na phurogireme ya mitirho ya mani na mani leyi ndlandlamuxiweke (epwp).

eng: in addition, social grants now reach close to 17 million people, mainly older persons and children.
tso: hi ku engetela, malimpfuneto ya vanhu sweswi yi fika kusuhi na 17 miliyoni wa vanhu, vo tala va vona i vadyuhari na vana.

eng: many families would not be able to put food on the table if it were not for social grants.
tso: mindyangu yo tala a yi nga ta swi kota ku xava swakudya loko a ku nga ri na mudende.

eng: the epwp has since 2014, created more than two million work opportunities towards the attainment of the target of six million work opportunities by the end of march 2019. of the work opportunities created, more than a million have been taken up by the youth.
tso: ku sukela hi 2014 epwp, yi tumbuluxile ku tlula timiliyoni timbirhi ta swivandlanene swa mitirho ku ya eka ku fikelela xikongomiso xa timiliyoni ta tsevu ta swivandlanene swa mitirho hi ku hela ka nyenyankulu 2019. eka swivandlanene swa mitirho leyi tumbuluxiweke, ku tlula miliyoni yi tekiwile hi vantshwa.

eng: during 2015/2016, more than 61 000 work opportunities were created through environmental programmes such as working for water, working for wetlands, working on fire and working for ecosystems.
tso: hi nkarhi wa 2015/2016, ku tlula 61 000 wa swivandlanene swa mitirho yi tumbuluxiwile hi ku tirhisa phurogireme ya swa mbango yo fana na ku tirhela mati, ku tirhela tindhawu leti tshamaka ti karhi ti tsakama, ku tirha hi ndzilo na ku tirhela tiikhosisiteme.

eng: more than 60% of the beneficiaries were young people.
tso: ku tlula 60% wa vavuyeriwa a ku ri vantshwa.

eng: government, working with society is fighting social ills that are tearing communities apart, such as drugs and substance abuse.
tso: mfumo, hi ku tirhisana na vaaki wu le ku lweni na swiphiqo swa vanhu leswi hangalasaka miganga, swo fana na ku tirhisa swidzidziharisi na swipyopyi hi ndlela yo ka yi nga ri kahle.

eng: from soshanguve to rosettenville or kwamashu to the cape flats, communities are in difficulty because of drugs.
tso: ku suka esoshanguve ku ya erosettenville kumbe ekwamashu ku ya ecape flats, miganga ya tikeriwa hikwalaho ka swidzidziharisi.

eng: other than law enforcement, the provision of treatment and prevention services is also critical.
tso: handle ka ku sindzisa nawu, ku nyikiwa ka vukorhokeri bya vutshunguri na nsivelo swi tlhela swi va swa nkoka.

eng: the department of social development is building new public treatment centres in provinces where there are no such facilities, in the northern cape, north west, limpopo, free state and the eastern cape.
tso: ndzawulo ya nhluvukiso wa vanhu yi le ku akeni ka tisenthara ta vutshunguri ta mani na mani tintshwa eka swifundzankulu leswi ku nga hava switirhisiwa swoleswo, ekapa-n’walungu, n’walungu-vupeladyambu, limpopo, free state na le kapa-vuxa.

eng: working together we will save our youth from drugs.
tso: hi ku tirhisana swin'we hi nga hlayisa vantshwa va hina ku suka eka swidzidziharisi.

eng: on health matters, the national health insurance (nhi) is our flagship project that is aimed at moving south africa towards universal health coverage.
tso: eka timhaka ta rihanyo, ndzindzakhombo wa rihanyo wa rixaka (nhi) i phurojeke ya hina yikulu eka hinkwato leyi kongomisiweke eku fambiseni ka afrika-dzonga ku ya eka angarhelo wa rihanyo wa matiko ya misava.

eng: the nhi will be implemented in a 14-year period in three phases.
tso: nhi yi ta simekiwa eka nkarhi wa malembe ya 14 hi swiphemu swinharhu.

eng: we are in the midst of the first phase, which is the preparatory phase, which started in 2012. compatriots,we are deeply distressed by the death of so many psychiatric patients in gauteng.
tso: hi le xikarhi ka xiphemu xosungula, lexi ku nga xiphemu xo lulamisela, lexi sunguleke hi 2012. vaakatikokulorhi,hi vavisekile swinene hi mafu yo tala ya vavabyi va miehleketo egauteng.

eng: mentally ill patients are some of the most vulnerable members of society, who need protection from the state itself and society as a whole.
tso: vavabyi va miehleketo hi van'wana va swirho leswi nga sirhelelekangiki swinene swa muganga, lava lavaka nsirhelelo ku suka eka mfumo hi woxe na miganga hinkwayo.

eng: i have instructed the minister of health to ensure that the health ombudsperson’s recommendations are wholly and speedily implemented without any reservations.
tso: ndzi lerisile holobye wa rihanyo ku tiyisisa leswaku swibumabumelo swa mulavisisi wa swivilelo wa rihanyo swi simekiwa hi xihatla na hi ku hetiseka handle ko siya swin'wana.

eng: we welcome the recommendation of the health ombudsperson that there is an urgent need to review the national health act, 2003 (act 61 of 2003) and the mental health care act, 2002 (act 17 of 2002) with a view that certain powers and functions revert to the minister of health.
tso: hi amukela swibumabumelo swa mulavisisi wa swivilelo wa rihanyo leswaku ku na xilaveko xa xihatla ku xopaxopa nawu wa rihanyo, 2003 (nawu wa 61 wa 2003) na nawu wa nhlayiso wa rihanyo ra miehleketo, 2002 (nawu wa 17 wa 2002) hi xikongomelo xa leswaku matimba na mitirho yin'wana swi vuyiseriwa eka holobye wa rihanyo.

eng: once more, we extend our heartfelt condolences to all families and relatives of the deceased.
tso: nakambe, hi rhumela ku chavelela ka hina ko suka etimbilwini eka mindyangu na maxaka hinkwawo ya vafi.

eng: government will provide support so that families do not face this burden alone.
tso: mfumo wu ta nyika nseketelo leswaku mindyangu yi nga langutani na ku tikeriwa loku yi ri yoxe.

eng: the premier of gauteng and the minister of health have already provided this assurance.
tso: holobyenkulu wa gauteng na holobye wa rihanyo se va nyikile ku tiyisisa loku.

eng: a lot more work has been done in the past year in implementing the nine-point plan and all our programmes.
tso: ntirho wo tala swinene wu endliwile eka lembe leri hundzeke eku simekiweni ka kungu ra timhaka ta kaye na minongonoko ya hina hinkwayo.

eng: ministers will report further on the programmes during the budget votes.
tso: vaholobye va ta vika ku ya emahlweni minongonoko hi nkarhi wa tivhoti ta mpimanyeto.

eng: honourable members,i would now like to speak on our priorities for the year ahead.
tso: swirho leswi chavisekaka,sweswi ndzi tsakela ku vulavula hi swirhangana swa hina swa lembe leri hi yimeleke.

eng: political freedom alone is incomplete without economic emancipation.
tso: ntshuxeko wa swa tipolotiki wu ri woxe a wu helelangi handle ka ntshuxeko wa ikhonomi.

eng: oliver tambo spoke clearly about this mission at a south african communist party anniversary meeting in london in 1981. he said: “the objective of our struggle in south africa, as set out in the freedom charter, encompasses economic emancipation.
tso: oliver tambo u vulavurile erivaleni mayelana na xikongomelo lexi eka nhlengeletano ya lembexidzana ya vandla ra makhomonisi ra afrika-dzonga elondon hi 1981. u te:“xikongomelo xa nyimpi ya hina eafrika-dzonga, hilaha swi vekiweke hakona eka tsalwa ra ntshuxeko, xi katsa ntshuxeko wa ikhonomi.

eng: it is inconceivable for liberation to have meaning without a return of the wealth of the country to the people as a whole.“to allow the existing economic forces to retain their interests intact is to feed the roots of racial supremacy and exploitation, and does not represent even the shadow of liberation.“it is therefore a fundamental feature of our strategy that victory must embrace more than formal political democracy.
tso: a swi ehleketeki ku va ntshuxeko wu va na nhlamuselo handle ko tlherisela rifuwo ra tiko eka vanhu hinkwavo.“ku pfumelela matimba ya ikhonomi leyi nga kona ku hlengeleta mitswalo ya vona yi helerile i ku cheleta timitsu ta matimba ya xihlawuhlawu na ku tirhisiwa hi ndlela yo ka yi nga ri kahle, naswona a swi yimeli hambi ndzhuti wa ntshuxeko.“hikokwalaho i xiphemu xa nkoka xa qhinga ra hina leswaku hi fanele hi amukela nhlulo ku tlula xidemokirasi xa swa tipolotiki ta ximfumo.

eng: and our drive towards national emancipation must include economic emancipation.”what do we mean by radical socio-economic transformation?
tso: naswona nsusumeto wa hina ku ya eka ntshuxeko wa rixaka wu fanele wu katsa ntshuxeko wa ikhonomi.”xana hi vula yini hi cinco wa ikhonomi ya vanhu wo hetiseka?

eng: we mean fundamental change in the structure, systems, institutions and patterns of ownership, management and control of the economy in favour of all south africans, especially the poor, the majority of whom are african and female, as defined by the governing party, which makes policy for the democratic government.
tso: hi vula ku cinca ka nkoka eka xivumbeko, tisisiteme, mavandla na tipheteni ta vun'winyi, mafambiselo na vulawuri bya ikhonomi hi ku seketela maafrika-dzonga hinkwawo, ngopfungopfu lava sweleke, vunyingi bya vona ku nga vantima na vamanana, hilaha swi hlamuseriweke hi vandla leri fumaka, leri endlaka pholisi ya mfumo wa xidemokirasi.

eng: twenty-two years into our freedom and democracy, the majority of black people are still economically disempowered.
tso: malembe ya makumembirhimbirhi eka ntshuxeko na xidemokirasi xa hina, vunyingi bya vanhu vantima va ha pfumala matimba ya swa ikhonomi.

eng: they are dissatisfied with the economic gains from liberation.
tso: a va korwisiwi hi mikumo ya swa ikhonomi ku suka eka ntshuxeko.

eng: the gap between the annual average household incomes of african-headed households and their white counterparts remains shockingly huge.
tso: vangwa exikarhi ka miholo ya ndyangu wa le xikarhi ya lembe na lembe ya mindyangu leyi rhangeriweke hi vantima na vakanetani va vona va valungu ri tshama ri hlamarisa swinene.

eng: white households earn at least five times more than black households, according to statistics sa.
tso: mindyangu ya valungu yi hola kwalomu ka ntlhanu ku tlula mindyangu ya vantima, hi ku ya hi tinhlayohlayo sa.

eng: the situation with regards to the ownership of the economy also mirrors that of household incomes.
tso: xiyimo hi mayelana na vun'winyi bya ikhonomi xi tlhela xi kombisa swa miholo ya mindyangu.

eng: only 10% of the top 100 companies on the johannesburg stock exchange are owned by black south africans, directly achieved principally, through the black empowerment codes, according to the national empowerment fund.
tso: ntsena 10% ya tikhamphani ta 100 ta le henhla leti nga eka johannesburg stock exchange ti nga na vun'winyi bya maafrika-dzonga va vantima, ti humeleleke swinene hi ku kongoma, hi ku tirhisa tikhodi ta ku nyika matimba eka vantima, hi ku ya hi xikimi xa ku nyika matimba xa rixaka.

eng: the pace of transformation in the workplace, the implementation of affirmative action policies as required by the employment equity act, 1998 (act 55 of 1998) also remains very slow.
tso: rivilo ra cinco etirhweni, ku simekiwa ka tipholisi ta endlelo ro lulamisa hilaha swi lavekaka hakona hi nawu wa ndzingano wa matholele, 1998 (nawu wa 55 wa 1998) na wona wu tshama wu nonoka.

eng: in terms of the 2015/16 information submitted to the employment equity commission, the representation of whites at top management level amounted to 72% while african representation was at 10%.
tso: hi ku ya hi mahungu ya 2015/16 lawa ya rhumeriweke eka khomixini ya ndzingano wa matholele, vuyimeri bya valungu eka tilevhele ta mafambiselo ta le henhla byi fikile eka 72% loko vuyimeri bya vantima byi ri eka 10%.

eng: the representation of coloureds stood at 4.5% and indians at 8.7%.
tso: vuyimeri bya makhaladi byi yime eka 4.5% naswona maindiya eka 8.7%.

eng: the report further provides that white south africans, in particular males, are afforded higher levels of recruitment, promotion and training opportunities as compared to the designated groups.
tso: xiviko xi yisa emahlweni xi vula leswaku maafrika-dzonga ya valungu, ngopfungopfu vavanuna, va nyikiwa tilevhele ta le henhla ta ku thoriwa, ntlakuso na mikateko ya vuleteri loko va pimanisiwa na mitlawa leyi thoriweke.

eng: at the level of gender at senior management level, males remain dominant at 67.6% and females at 32.4%.
tso: eka levhele ya rimbewu loko swi ta eka levhele ya vufambisi, vavanuna va tshama va ri ehenhla eka 67.6% naswona vamanana va ri eka 32.4%.

eng: the skewed nature of ownership and leadership patterns needs to be corrected.
tso: ntumbuluko wa vuxisi bya vun'winyi na tiphetheni ta vurhangeri wu lava ku lulamisiwa.

eng: there can be no sustainability in any economy if the majority is excluded in this manner.
tso: ku nga ka ku nga vi na ku kota ku yisa emahlweni ka ikhonomi yihi na yihi loko vunyingi byi nga katsiwi hi ndlela leyi.

eng: in my discussions with the business community, they accepted these transformation imperatives.
tso: eka mikanerisano ya mina na van'wamabindzu, va amukerile swileriso swa cinco lowu.

eng: today we are starting a new chapter of radical socio-economic transformation.
tso: namuntlha hi sungula hi vuntshwa cinco wa ikhonomi ya vanhu wo hetiseka.

eng: we are saying that we should move beyond words, to practical programmes.
tso: hi vula leswaku hi fanele ku endla ku tlula ku vulavula, ku ya eka minongonoko leyi koteka.

eng: the state will play a role in the economy to drive that transformation.
tso: mfumo wu ta teka xiave eka ikhonomi ku fambisa ku cinca koloko.

eng: in this regard, government will utilise to the maximum, the strategic levers that are available to the state.
tso: eka mhaka leyi, mfumo wu ta tirhisa hi ku hetiseka, vulawuri bya swa maqhinga lebyi nga kona eka mfumo.

eng: this includes legislation, regulations, licensing, budget and procurement as well as broad-based black economic empowerment charters to influence the behaviour of the private sector and drive transformation.
tso: leswi swi katsa milawu, swinawana, ku nyika tilayisense, mpimanyeto na nkumo xikan'we na matsalwa ya timfanelo ya ku nyika matimba eka ikhonomi ya vantima ko angarhela ku kucutela mahanyelo ya swiphemu swo ka swi nga ri swa mfumo na ku fambisa cinco.

eng: the state spends r500 billion a year buying goods and services.
tso: mfumo wu tirhisa r500 biliyoni hi lembe wu xava tinhundzu na vukorhokeri.

eng: added to this is the r900 billion infrastructure budget.
tso: ku engetela eka leswi i r900 biliyoni ya mpimanyeto wa switirhisiwa.

eng: those budgets must be used to achieve economic transformation.
tso: mipimanyeto yoleyo yi fanele ku tirhisiwa ku fikelela cinco wa ikhonomi.

eng: as a start, the new regulations making it compulsory for big contractors to subcontract 30% of business to black-owned enterprises have been finalised and were gazetted on 20 january.
tso: tanihi masungulo, swinawana swintshwa leswi endlaka swiboha eka van'watikontraka letikulu ku nyika kontraka ya 30% ya bindzu eka mabindzunyingi ya vun'winyi bya vantima se swi hetisisiwile naswona swi gazetiwile hi ti 20 sunguti.

eng: through such regulations and programmes, government will be able to use the state buying power to empower small enterprises, rural and township enterprises, designated groups and to promote local industrial development.
tso: hi ku tirhisa swinawana na tiphurogireme toleto, mfumo wu ta kota ku tirhisa matimba yo xava ya mfumo ku nyika matimba eka mabindzunyingi lamatsongo, mabindzunyingi ya le makaya na ya le malokixini, mitlawa leyi thoriweke na ku tlakusa nhluvukiso wa vumakelo bya laha kaya.

eng: two key challenges we face are the high levels of concentration in the economy and the collusion and cartels, which squeeze out small players and hamper the entry of young entrepreneurs and black industrialists.
tso: mitlhontlho ya nkoka yimbirhi leyi hi langutanaka na yona i tilevhele ta le henhla ta mianakanyiso eka ikhonomi na mitwanano na mihlangano, leyi humesaka vangheneleri lavatsongo na ku sivela ku nghena ka van'wamabindzu lavatsongo na vamaki va vantima.

eng: the competition authorities have done excellent work to uncover the cartels and punish them for breaking the law.
tso: vulawuri bya mphikizano byi endlile ntirho wa kahle swinene ku vhumbhunula mihlangano na ku yi xupula ku va yi tlula nawu.

eng: last year i signed into law, a provision to criminalise the cartels and collusion and it came into effect on 1 may.
tso: lembe leri hundzeke ndzi sayinile ku va nawu, swihlawulekiso swo khoma mihlangano na mitwanano naswona wu sungurile ku tirha hi ti1 mudyaxihi.

eng: we are now stepping up our actions to deal with the other challenge, namely economic concentration, where a small grouping controls most of a market.
tso: wu na xigwevo xo ya ejele ku fikela eka malembe ya 10. sweswi se hi tlakusa migingiriko ya hina ku tirhana na ntlhontlho wun'wana, ku wu boxa mianakanyiso ya ikhonomi, laha ntlawa lowutsongo wu lawulaka timakete to tala.

eng: during this year, the department of economic development will bring legislation to cabinet that will seek to amend the competition act, 1998 (act 89 of 1998).
tso: hi nkarhi wa lembe leri, ndzawulo ya nhluvukiso wa ikhonomi yi ta tisa nawu eka khabinete lowu nga ta lava ku antswisa nawu wa mphikizano,1998 (nawu wa 89 wa 1998).

eng: it will, among others, address the need to have a more inclusive economy and to de-concentrate the high levels of ownership and control we see in many sectors.
tso: wu ta, eka swin'wana swilo, lulamisa xilaveko ku va na ikhonomi yo tala leyi katsa hinkwavo na ku hunguta tilevhele ta le henhla ta vun'winyi na vulawuri leswi hi swi vonaka eka tisekithara to tala.

eng: we will then table the legislation for consideration by parliament.
tso: kutani hi ta andlala nawu ku va wu tekeriwa enhlokweni hi palamende.

eng: in this way, we seek to open up the economy to new players, give black south africans opportunities in the economy and indeed help to make the economy more dynamic, competitive and inclusive.
tso: hi ndlela leyi, hi lava ku pfula ikhonomi eka vangheneleri vantshwa, hi tlherisela endzhaku mikateko ya maafrika-dzonga eka ikhonomi naswona hakunene hi pfuna ku endla ikhonomi yi cincacinca swinene, yi phikizana na ku katsa hinkwavo.

eng: this is our vision of radical economic transformation.
tso: lexi i xivono xa hina xa cinco wa ikhonomi wo hetiseka.

eng: compatriots,government is actively involved in the property sector, having provided more than four million houses since 1994. this sector in our country is valued at approximately r7 trillion, with the subsidised sector being valued at r1.5 trillion.
tso: vaakatikokulorhi,mfumo wu nghenelela hi ku hiseka eka sekithara ya nhundzu, se wu nyikile ku tlula mune wa timiliyoni ta tindlu ku sukela hi 1994. sekitara leyi etikweni ra hina yi na nkoka wa kwalomu ka r7 mathiriliyoni, loko sekithara leyi pfuniweke yi ri na nkoka wa r1.5 mathiriliyoni.

eng: however, less than 5% of the sector is owned or managed by black people and africans in particular.
tso: hambiswiritano, ehansi ka 5% ya sekithara yi na vun'winyi na ku fambisiwa hi vanhu vantima naswona ngopfungopfu maafrika.

eng: a draft property practitioners bill will be published by the department of human settlements for public comment with the purpose of establishing a more inclusive, representative sector, towards radical economic transformation.
tso: mpfapfarhuto wa nawumbisi wa vativi va swa nhundzu wu ta kandziyisiwa hi ndzawulo ya vutshamiso bya vanhu ku va vanhu va nyika miehleketo hi xikongomelo xo tumbuluxa sekithara yo katsa swinene hinkwavo na vuyimeri, ku ya eka cinco wa ikhonomi wo hetiseka.

eng: among key priorities this year, government will also address the increasing delays and backlogs in registration and issuing of title deeds to beneficiaries of housing projects funded by the capital subsidy.
tso: exikarhi ka swirhangana swa nkoka lembe leri, mfumo wu ta tlhela wu lulamisa ku hlwela loku tlakukaka na ku salela endzhaku eku tsariseni na le ku nyikiweni ka mapapila ya vun'winyi eka vavuyeriwa va tiphurojeke ta tindlu leti seketeriweke hi swa timali hi mpfuno wa tinhundzu.

eng: compatriots,we reiterate that radical economic transformation should mean moving beyond share ownership schemes only.
tso: vaakatikokulorhi,hi vula nakambe leswaku cinco wa ikhonomi wo hetiseka wu fanele ku famba ku hundza eka swikimi swa vun'winyi bya minkavelo ntsena.

eng: we would like to see black people involved directly in business, owning factories.
tso: a hi ta tsakela ku vona vanhu vantima va nghenelela hi ku kongoma eka bindzu, va va vinyi va vumakelo.

eng: the development of the black industrialists programme is thus critical.
tso: hikokwalaho, nhluvukiso wa nongonoko wa vamaki va vantima i wa nkoka.

eng: the programme has from inception supported more than 22 entrepreneurs.
tso: ku sukela eku sunguleni nongonoko wu seketeriwile hi van'wamabindzu vo tlula 22. mfumo wu na mikateko yin'wana eka tiphurojeke ta mahlayiselo ya nhundzu ya ndzawulo ya mitirho.

eng: government has further opportunities in the property maintenance projects of the department of public works.
tso: ndzawulo yi ta vekisa kwalomu ka r100 miliyoni lembe leri eka minongonoko ya mahlayiselo na tinhundzu ta nkoka ku endla mahlaluko ya ximanguvalawa.

eng: they will also continue generating revenue from letting state-owned harbours and coastline properties, which will benefit black-owned smmes.
tso: yi ta tlhela yi ya emahlweni yi endla mitswariso ku suka eku hiriseni ka mahlaluko ya vun'winyi bya mfumo na tinhundzu ta ndzhati wa ribuwa, leswi nga ta vuyerisa tismme ta vun'winyi bya vantima.

eng: government will also continue to pursue policies that seek to broaden the participation of black people and smmes, including those owned by women and the youth, in the information and communications technology sector.
tso: mfumo wu ta tlhela wu ya emahlweni ku landzelela tipholisi leti lavaka ku anamisa ku nghenelela ka vanhu vantima na tismme, ku katsa na leta vun'winyi bya vavasati na vantshwa, eka sekitara ya mahungu na vuhlanganisi bya thekinoloji.

eng: we assure the youth that the lowering of the cost of data is uppermost in our policies and plans.
tso: hi tiyisisa vantshwa leswaku ku hungutiwa ka nxavo wa datha i swa le henhla eka tipholisi na makungu ya hina.

eng: compatriots,mining has always been the backbone of our economy and an important foreign exchange earner.
tso: vaakatikokulorhi,migodi yi tshama ku ri longo ra ikhonomi ya hina na muhori wa vucincanisi na matikomambe wa nkoka.

eng: we welcome the recovery in commodity prices, which has resulted in an upswing in mining output.
tso: hi amukela ku antswisiwa ka mixavo ya xixavisiwa, leswi vangeke ntlakuko eka swihumelerisiwa swa mayini.

eng: this augurs well for the industry.
tso: leswi swi tshembisa swa kahle eka vumaki.

eng: the mining charter is currently being reviewed.
tso: tsalwa ra timfanelo ra mayini sweswi ri le ku xopaxopiweni.
