eng: on youth employment, as from today, we begin the implementation of the presidential youth employment intervention – six priority actions over the next five years to reduce youth unemployment.
tso: eka ku thoriwa ka vantshwa, kusukela namuntlha, hi sungula nsimeko wa mphalalo wa ku thoriwa ka vantshwa wa le hofisini ya phuresidente – tsevu wa magoza lama rhangisiwaka emahlweni eka ntlhanu wa malembe lama taka ku hunguta mpfumaleko wa mitirho ka vantshwa.

eng: first, we are creating pathways for young people into the economy.
tso: xosungula, hi le ku tumbuluxeni ka tindlela to fikelela xitshunxo ta vantshwa eka ikhonomi.

eng: we are building cutting-edge solutions to reach young people where they are – online, on the phone and in person.
tso: hi le ku akeni ka switshunxo swa ximanguvalawa ku fikelela vantshwa laha va nga kona, eka inthanete, eka riqingho na munhu hi yexe.

eng: this will allow them to receive active support, information and work readiness training to increase their employability and match themselves to opportunities.
tso: leswi swi ta va pfumelela ku kuma nseketelo lowu gingirikaka, vuxokoxoko na vuleteri byo lunghekela ntirho ku engetela vutholeki bya vona na ku tifambelanisa na swivandlanene.

eng: starting this month, we are launching five prototype sites in five provinces that will grow to a national network reaching three million young people through multiple channels.
tso: ku sungula n’hweti yaleyi, hi simeka ntlhanu wa tindhawu ta xikombiso eka ntlhanu wa swifundzakulu leti ti nga ta kula kufika eka netiweke ya rixaka leyi fikelelaka timiliyoni tinharhu ta vantshwa hi ku tirhisa tichanelenyingi.

eng: this will allow them to receive active support, information and work readiness training to increase their employability and match themselves to opportunities.
tso: xavumbirhi, hi le ku cinceni hilaha hi lulamiselaka hakona vumundzuku bya ntirho, hi ku nyika tikhoso to koma, to cincacinceka swinene eka swikili swo karhi leswi vathori eka tisekitara leti kulaka hi ku hatlisa va swi dingaka.

eng: secondly, we are fundamentally changing how we prepare young people for the future of work, providing shorter, more flexible courses in specific skills that employers in fast-growing sectors need.
tso: xavunharhu, hi le ku tumbuluxeni eka tindlela letintshwa na ku va ta maendlelo lamantshwa ku seketela vun’wamabindzu bya vantshwa na vutitirhi.

eng: thirdly, we are developing new and innovative ways to support youth entrepreneurship and self-employment.
tso: xa vumune, hi le ku engeteleni ka mpimo wa vukorhokeri bya ku thoriwa ka vantshwa na ku tirhisana na tikholichi ta tvet na sekitara leyi nga riki ya mfumo ya mfumo ku tiyisisa leswaku vadyondzi vo tala va kuma ntokoto wo endla entirhweni ku hetisa vuleteri bya vona.

eng: fourthly, we are scaling up the youth employment service and working with tvet colleges and the private sector to ensure that more learners receive practical experience in the workplace to complete their training.
tso: xa vuntlhanu, hi le ku tumbuluxeni ka ntlawa wo sungula wa nongonoko wa vukorhokeri bya vantshwa wa le hofisini ya phuresidente lowu wu nga ta pfulela ejensi ya vantshwa na ku nyika swivandlanene ku kuma malinghena loko hi le tlhelo ku ri karhi ku hoxiwa xandla eka ku akiwa rixaka.

eng: fifthly, we are establishing the first cohort of a presidential youth service programme that will unlock the agency of young people and provide opportunities for them to earn an income while contributing to nation building.
tso: xohetelela, hi ta rhangela pfhumba ra ku thoriwa ka vantshwa leri ri nga ta nyikiwa timali hi ku veka etlhelo 1% ya mpimanyeto ku tirhana na tilevhele ta le henhla ta mpfumaleko wa mitirho ya vantshwa.

eng: finally, we will lead a youth employment initiative which will be funded by setting aside 1% of the budget to deal with the high levels of youth unemployment.
tso: leswi swi ta va hi ku hunguta hi le henhla ka mpimanyeto, leswi swi nga ta lava leswaku hi boha nkhamu na ku kongomisa hi vuntshwa swipfuno ku tirhana na xirilo xa ku mpfumaleko wa mitirho ya vantshwa.

eng: this will be through top slicing from the budget, which will require that we all tighten our belts and redirect resources to address the national crisis of youth unemployment.
tso: holobye wa timali u ta rhangisa emahlweni pfhumba leri na ku nyika vuxokoxoko byo kongoma loko a andlala xitatimente xa pholisi ya mpimanyeto wa le xikarhi ka theme eku fambeni ka lembe leri.

eng: the minister of finance will prioritise this initiative and give specific details when he delivers the medium-term budget policy statement later this year.
tso: magoza lama tsevu ya ri swin’we ya ta tiyisisa leswaku muntshwa un’wana na un’wana etikweni leri u na ndhawu yo ya eka yona, leswaku matimba na vuswikoti bya yena swi tirhisiwa, na leswaku a kota ku hoxa xandla eka ku kula ka miganga na tiko ra ka vona.

eng: these six actions will together ensure that every young person in this country has a place to go, that their energy and capabilities are harnessed, and that they can contribute to the growth of their communities and their country.
tso: tanihi xiphemu xa miphalalo, ejensi ya nhluvukiso wa vantshwa ya rixaka na ndzawulo ya nhluvukiso wa mabindzu lamatsongo va ta nyika timali na nseketelo wa mabindzu eka 1.000 ra van’wamabindzu va vantshwa eka 100 ra masiku lama taka – ku sungula mundzuku.

eng: we have invited three of these young entrepreneurs to join us here this evening: siyabonga tiwana, sibusiso mahone and tholakele nkosi.
tso: hi rhambile vanharhu va van’wamabindzu va vantshwa lava ku tikatsa na hina laha madyambu lama: siyabonga tiwana, sibusiso mahone na tholakele nkosi.

eng: they and others like them prove that, given the necessary support, young people can create their own opportunities.
tso: vona na van’wana vo fana na vona va kombile vumbhoni bya leswaku, loko vo nyikiwa nseketelo lowu lavekaka, vantshwa va nga kota ku titumbuluxela swivandlanene swa vona vini.

eng: these three young entrepreneurs form part of a larger and more ambitious programme to assist 100.000 young entrepreneurs over the next three years to access business skills training, funding and market facilitation.
tso: van’wamabindzu va vantshwa lavanharhu va vumba xiphemu xa nongonoko lowo lava ku fikelela swa xiyimo xa le henhlahenhla swinene ku pfuna 100.000 wa van’wamabindzu va vantshwa emalembeni manharhu lama taka ku fikelela vuleteri bya swikili swa bindzu, timali na vuhumelerisi bya timakete.

eng: the empowerment of women is critical to inclusive economic growth.
tso: havexerisamatimba wa vavasati i wa nkoka swonghasi eka ku kula ka ikhonomi.

eng: we are introducing the shetradesza platform to assist women-owned businesses to participate in global value chains and markets.
tso: hi le ku sunguleni ka pulatifomo ya shetradesza ku pfuna mabindzu lama nga ehansi ka vun’wini bya vavasati ku teka xiave eka nkhuluko wa nkoka wa misava hinkwayo na le timakete.

eng: over the next five years, the industrial development corporation is targeting r10 billion of own and partner funding for women-empowered businesses.
tso: emalembeni ya ntlhanu lama taka, khamphanikulu ya nhluvukiso wa tiindasitiri yi pakanisa r10 wa tibiliyoni ta timali ta vona vini na ta vatirhisani eka mabindzu ya havexerisamatimba wa vavasati.

eng: to create a larger market for small businesses, we plan to designate 1.000 locally produced products that must be procured from small, medium and micro entreprises.
tso: ku tumbuluxa makete lowukulu wa mabindzu lamatsongo, hi kunguhata ku hlawula 1.000 wa swikumiwa leswi humesiweke laha tikweni leswi swi faneleke ku xaviwa eka mabindzu lamatsongo, ya le xikarhi na lamatsongo swinene.

eng: the procurement bill will soon be presented to parliament as part of our efforts to empower black and emerging businesses and advance radical economic transformation.
tso: nawumbisi wa maxavelo ya tinhundzu na vukorhokeri ku nga ri khale wu ta andlariwa epalamende tanihi xiphemu xa matshalatshala ya hina ya ku havexerisa vantima matimba na mabindzu lama ha tumbulukaka na ku antswisa ncinco wa ikhonomi hinkwayo.

eng: this year, we intensify our investment drive with the establishment of an integrated investment promotion and facilitation capability coordinated from the presidency.
tso: nan’waka, hi tiyisa pfhumba ra hina ra vuvekisi hi ku tumbuluxiwa ka nkondletelo wa vuvekisi lebyi pfanganisiweke na vuswikoti byo humelerisa lebyi hlanganisiweke kusuka eka hofisi ya phuresidente.

eng: we will hold our third south africa investment conference in november to review the implementation of previous commitments and to generate new investment into our economy.
tso: hi ta khoma khomferense ya vuvekisi ya afrika-dzonga ya vunharhu hi hukuri ku kambisisa ku tirhisiwa ka vutiboheleri bya nkarhi lowu nga hundza na ku endla vuvekisi lebyintshwa eka ikhonomi ya hina.

eng: at the second south africa investment conference last year, over 70 companies made investment commitments of r364 billion in industries as diverse as advanced manufacturing, agro-processing, infrastructure, mining, services, tourism and hospitality.
tso: eka khomferense ya vuvekisi ya afrika-dzonga ya vumbirhi n’wexemu, kutlula 70 wa tikhamphani ti endle vutiboheleri bya vuvekisi bya r364 wa tibiliyoni eka tiindasitiri to hambanahambana tanihi vuendli lebyi antswisiweke, ku phurosesiwa ka swa vurimi, swimakiwakulu, vucelamigodi, vukorhokeri, vupfhumba na mafundzha.

eng: in the first two years of our ambitious investment drive, we have raised a total of r664 billion in investment commitments, which is more than half of our five-year target of r1.2 trillion.
tso: eka malembe mambirhi lamo sungula ya pfhumba ra hina ra vuvekisi lebyi nga na xikongomelo xa ku fikelela swa le henhlahenhla, hi hlengeletile ntsengo wa r664 wa tibiliyoni eka vutiboheleri bya vuvekisi, leti ti nga kutlula hafu ya mpakaniso wa hina wa ntlhanu wa malembe wa r1.2 wa tithiriliyoni.

eng: more importantly, these investments are having a real impact.
tso: xa nkoka swinene, vuvekisi lebyi byi na nhlohlotelo wa xiviri.

eng: already, projects with an investment value of r9 billion have been completed and 27 projects worth just over r250 billion are in implementation phases, with more coming on-stream this year.
tso: eka nkarhi wa sweswi tiphurojeke leti nga na nkoka wa vuvekisi wa r9 wa tibiliyoni ti hetiwile naswona 27 wa tiphurojeke leti nga na nkoka wa kutlulanyana r250 wa tibiliyoni ti le ka tifeyisi ta nsimeko, laha to tala ti nga ta va ti ri eku tirheni nan’waka.

eng: i have visited newly-built factories that make smartphones, and plants expanded to produce more cars, and walked through the dust on construction sites at supplier parks.
tso: ndzi endzerile tifeme leta ha ku akiwaka leti endlaka tiqingho ta ximanguvalawa, naswona tipulanti ti ndlandlamukile ku endla mimovha yo tala, naswona ndzi fambile hi milenge eritshurini eka tindhawu ta vuaki eka tiphaka ta mphakelo.

eng: we have been to the opening of facilities producing goods ranging from power cables to sanitary products, from tyres to food.
tso: a hi ri eku pfuleni ka switirhisiwa leswi endlaka tinhundzu leswi hambanaka kusuka eka tintambhu ta gezi kufika eka swimakiwa swa nkululo, kusuka eka mathayere kufika eka swakudya.

eng: we have made important progress in finalising and implementing master plans in vital parts of our economy.
tso: hi khatsile ndzima yo tivikana eka ku hetisa na ku simeka makungukulu eka swiphemu swa nkoka swonghasi swa ikhonomi ya hina.

eng: these master plans bring government, labour and business together to develop practical measures to spur growth at sector level and each partner contributes to making it work.
tso: makungukulu ya ku tisa endhawini yin’we mfumo, vatirhi na mabindzu ku tumbuluxa magoza yo tirhiseka ku hlohlotela ku kula eka levhele ya tisekitara naswona mutirhisani un’wana na un’wana u hoxa xandla ku ri endla ri tirha.

eng: thanks in large measure to the auto master plan, we sold more cars to the rest of the world last year than ever before, providing jobs for young people in eastern cape and kwazulu-natal.
tso: hi khensa swinene eka kungukulu ra mimovha, hi xavise mimovha yo tala emisaveni hinkwayo n’wexemu kutlula leswi swi nga tshama swi va xiswona, hi nyika vanhu vo tala mitirho ekapa-vuhumadyambu na kwazulu-natal.

eng: we launched a new auto special economic zone hub in tshwane, which will expand production and local manufacture of components.
tso: hi simeke habu ya zoni ya ikhonomi yo hlawuleka ya mimovha leyintshwa etshwane, leyi yi nga ta ndlandlamukisa vuendli na vuendli bya laha tikweni bya swiphemu.

eng: the clothing and textiles master plan, which was signed last year, aims to create 121.000 new jobs in the retail-clothing textile and footwear sector over the decade.
tso: kungukulu ra swiambalo na malapi, leri ri sayiniweke n’wexemu, ri na xikongomelo xa ku tumbuluxa 121.000 wa mitirho leyintshwa eka sekitara ya vuxavisi bya malapi na swiambalo swa le milengeni eka malembexikhume.

eng: it involves commitments by retailers to buy goods locally, by manufacturers to invest and support transformation, and by labour to develop bargaining structures that promote agile manufacturing.
tso: ri khumba vutiboheleri bya vaxavisi ku xava tinhundzu laha tikweni, hi vaendli ku vekisa na ku seketela ncinco, na hi vatirhi ku hluvukisa mitlawa yo pompela leyi yi kondletelaka vuendli lebyi hatlisaka.

eng: for its part, government has already begun to act vigorously against illegal imports, seizing almost 400 containers with under-invoiced products in the last quarter of 2019. this suit that i am wearing today, like last year, was proudly made by south african workers.
tso: eka xiphemu xa rona, mfumo se wu sungurile ku tirha hi matimba ehenhla ka switundziwa leswi nga riki enawini, ku tekiwile kwalomu ka 400 wa tikhontheni na swikumiwa leswi nga na inivhoyisi ya nxavo wa le hansi eka kotara leyi nga hundza ya 2019. suti leyi ndzi yi ambaleke namuntlha, ku fana na n’wexemu, yi endliwile hi ku tinyungubyisa hi vatirhi va afrika-dzonga.

eng: i would like to encourage all of us to buy south african products.
tso: ndzi ta tsakela ku khutaza hinkwerhu ka hina ku xava swimakiwa swa afrika-dzonga.

eng: we completed the poultry master plan to support chicken farmers and processors and save 54.000 jobs while creating new jobs.
tso: hi hetile kungukulu ra vufuwahuku ku seketela van’wamapurasi va tihuku na vaphurosesi na ku hlayisa 54.000 wa mitirho loko ku ri karhi ku tumbuluxiwa mitirho leyintshwa.

eng: the industry is now focused on growth, greater production and more investment.
tso: indasitiri leyi sweswi yi kongomisile eka ku kula, ntshovelo lowukulu na vuvekisi byo tala.

eng: we will, within two weeks, set a new poultry import tariff adjustment to support the local industry.
tso: ku nga si hundza mavhiki mambirhi, hi ta veka ncinconyana wa nxavo wa switundziwa swa vufuwahuku ku seketela indasitiri ya laha tikweni.

eng: we have developed a plan with farmers and industrial users to save jobs in the sugar industry and will finalise a sugar master plan within the next six weeks.
tso: hi hluvukisile kungu na van’wamapurasi na vatirhisi va indasitiri ku hlayisa mitirho eka indasitiri ya chukela naswona hi ta hetisa kungukulu ra chukela ku nga si hundza tsevu wa mavhiki lama taka.

eng: and expect a new steel master plan to be finalised in the coming six months.
tso: naswona hi langutela kungukulu ra nsimbhi ku hetisiwa eka tsevu wa tin’hweti leti taka.

eng: effective today, new regulations published in the government gazette will enable investigation and action against abuse of buyer power and price discrimination.
tso: kusukela namuntlha, swinawana leswintshwa leswi kandziyisiweke eka gazete ya mfumo swi ta kotisa vulavisisi na goza ehenhla ka ku tirhisiwa hindlela yo homboloka matimba ya muxavi na xihlawuhlawu xa mixavo.

eng: this will help even the playing field for small businesses and emerging entrepreneurs.
tso: leswi swi ta pfuna ku ringanisa ndzima yo tirhela ya mabindzu lamatsongo na van’wamabindzu lava ha tumbulukaka.

eng: market inquiries into data services, the grocery retail market and health care have provided the basis for measures to reduce costs to consumers and make these sectors more competitive.
tso: swivutiso swa vukorhokeri bya data, makete wa vuxavisi bya girosa na nhlayiso wa swa rihanyu swi nyike vatirhisi xivangelo xa magoza ya ku hunguta tihakelo na ku endla tisekitara leti ti kota ku phikizana swinene.

eng: the competition authorities are now working towards a resolution with the large mobile operators to secure deep cuts to data prices across pre-paid monthly bundles, additional discounts targeted at low income households, a free daily allocation of data and free access to educational and other public interest websites.
tso: valawuri va mphikizano sweswi va le ku tirheni ku kuma xitshunxo na valawuri va tiqingho to fambafamba na tona ku kuma mitshovo leyikulu ya mixavo ya data eka tibandlele ta n’hweti na n’hweti leti rhangaka hi ku xaviwa, mitshovo yo engetela leyi pakanisiweke eka miti ya malinghena ya le hansi, nkavelo wa siku na siku wa mahala wa data na mfikelelo wa mahala eka tiwebusayiti ta swa dyondzo na ta swa ntsakelo wa vaaki.

eng: this is an important step to improve lives, bring people into the digital economy and stimulate online businesses.
tso: leri i goza ra nkoka eka ku antswisa vutomi, ku nghenisa vanhu eka ikhonomi ya xidijitali na ku nyanyula mabindzu ya le ka inthanete.

eng: the digital economy will increasingly become a driver of growth and a creator of employment.
tso: ikhonomi ya xidijitali yi ta hundzuka hindlela leyi engetelaka mulawuri wa ku kula na mutumbuluxi wa mitirho.

eng: the presidential commission on the fourth industrial revolution has made far-reaching recommendations that impact on nearly every aspect of the economy and in many areas of our lives.
tso: khomixini ya le hofisini ya phuresidente eka ncinco wa tiindasitiri wa vumune wu endlile swibumabumelo leswi nga na nhlohlotelo lowukulu leswi swi hlohlotelaka eka kwalomu xiphemu xin’wana na xin’wana xa ikhonomi na le ka swiyenge swo tala swa vutomi bya hina.

eng: the commission’s report provides us with the tools to ensure that we extract the greatest benefit of these revolutionary technological changes.
tso: xiviko xa khomixini leyi xi hi nyika switirho ku tiyisisa leswaku hi tsavula mbuyelo lowukulukumba wa ku cinca ka xithekinoloji ka hinkwako.

eng: an important condition for the success of our digital economy is the availability of high demand spectrum to expand broadband access and reliability.
tso: xipimelo xa nkoka eka ku humelela eka ikhonomi ya hina ya xidijitali i vukona bya nkwangulatilo lowu lavekaka swinene ku ndlandlamukisa mfikelelo wa inthanete ya rivilo ra le henhla na vutshembeki.

eng: the regulator, the independent communications authority of south africa, has undertaken to conclude the licensing of high demand spectrum for industry via auction before the end of 2020. because of additional requirements, the licensing of the wireless open access network (woan) is likely to be completed during the course of next year.
tso: mulawuri, vulawuri bya vuhlanganisi lebyi tiyimelaka bya afrika-dzonga, u tibohile ku fikisa emakumu ku nyikiwa ka layisense eka nkwangulatilo lowu lavekaka swinene eka indasitiri hi ku tirhisa fandisi ku nga si hela 2020. hikwalaho ka swilaveko swo engetela ku nyikiwa ka layisense eka netiweke ya mfikelelo wo pfuleka wa nkatintambhu (woan) swi tikomba swi ta hetisiwa eku fambeni ka lembe leri taka.

eng: agriculture is one of the industries with the greatest potential for growth.
tso: vurimi i yin’wana ya tiindasitiri leti nga na vuswikoti lebyikulukumba bya ku kula.

eng: this year, we implement key recommendations of the presidential advisory panel on land reform and agriculture to accelerate land redistribution, expand agricultural production and transform the industry.
tso: nan’waka, hi ta tirhisa swibumabumelokulu swa phanele yo tsundzuxa ya le hofisini ya phuresidente eka mpfuxeto wa misava na vurimi ku hatlisisa vuhangalasi bya misava, ku ndlandlamukisa ntshovelo wa vurimi na ku cinca indasitiri leyi.

eng: government stands ready – following the completion of the parliamentary process to amend section 25 of the constitution – to table an expropriation bill that outlines the circumstances under which expropriation of land without compensation would be permissible.
tso: mfumo wu yima wu lunghekile – endzhaku ka ku hetisiwa ka phurosese ya palamende ku hundzuluxa xiyenge xa 25 xa vumbiwa – ku andlala nawumbisi wa ku tekiwa ka misava lowu wu hlamuselaka swiyimo leswi ehansi ka swona ku tekiwa ka misava ku ri hava ndziriso swi nga ta pfumeleriwa.

eng: to date, we have released 44.000 hectares of state land for the settlement of land restitution claims, and will this year release round 700.000 hectares of state land for agricultural production.
tso: kufika sweswi, hi humese 44 000 wa tihekitara ta misava ya mfumo eka ntshamisekiso wa swikoxo swa ntlheriso wa timfanelo ta misava, naswona nan’waka hi ta humesa 7 00 000 wa tihekitara ta misava ya mfumo eka ntshovelo wa vurimi.

eng: we are prioritising youth, women, people with disabilities and those who have been farming on communal land and are ready to expand their operations for training and allocation of land.
tso: hi le ku rhangiseni emahlweni vantshwa, vanhu lava nga na vutsoniwa na lavaya a va nga eku rimeni ka misava ya muganga naswona hi lunghekile ku ndlandlamukisa matirhelo ya vona ku kuma vuleteri na nkavelo wa misava.

eng: a new beneficiary selection policy includes compulsory training for potential beneficiaries before land can be allocated to them.
tso: pholisi ya nhlawulo ya vavuyeriwa leyintshwa yi katsa vuleteri lebyi bohaka eka vavuyeriwa lava nga tshukaka va va kona misava yi nga si averiwa eka vona.

eng: because of the drought in many parts of the country, farmers lost crops and livestock and many workers have lost their jobs and livelihoods.
tso: hikwalaho ka dyandza eka swiphemu swo tala swa tiko, van’wamapurasi va lahlekeriwe hi swirin’wa na swifuwo naswona vatirhi vo tala va lahlekeriwile hi mitirho na vutihanyisi.

eng: working with the agricultural research council and other scientific and agricultural bodies, we have developed drought mitigation strategies that focus on developing drought resistant seeds, planting and storing fodder, removing of invasive plantsand management strategies to prevent soil degradation.
tso: hi ku tirhisana na khansele ya ndzavisiso wa swa vurimi na tihuvo tin’wana ta swa sayense na vurimi, hi tumbuluxile maqhinga yo hunguta dyandza lama ya kongomisaka eka ku hluvukisa timbewu leti sihalalaka dyandza, ku byala na ku hlayisa furhu, ku susiwa ka swimila leswi milaka etindhawini leti nga ri ta ntumbuluko wa swona na maqhinga ya malawulelo ku sivela ku wa ka nono wa misava.

eng: this year we will open up and regulate the commercial use of hemp products, providing opportunities for small-scale farmers.
tso: nan’waka hi ta pfula na ku lawula ntirho wa xibindzu wa swimakiwa swa mbangi, ku nyika swivandlanene eka varimi va mpimo lowutsongo.

eng: and formulate policy on the use of cannabis products for medicinal purposes, to build this industry in line with global trends.
tso: na ku vumba tipholisi hi ntirhiso wa swimakiwa swa mbangi eka swikongomelo swa mirhi, ku aka indasitiri leyi hi ku fambisana na maendlekelo ya misava hinkwayo.

eng: the regulatory steps will soon be announced by the relevant ministers.
tso: magoza lamo lawula ku nga ri kahle ya ta tivisiwa hi vaholobye lava faneleke.

eng: a fundamental condition for growth and development is a healthy and productive population, with access to quality, affordable health care.
tso: xipimelo xa nkoka xa ku kula na nhluvukiso i nhlayo hinkwayo ya vanhu lava hanyeke kahle na ku va na ntshovelo, ku ri na mfikelelo wa nhlayiso wa swa rihanyu wa risima, lowu fikelelekaka.

eng: we have noted the enthusiastic support from south africans during public hearings on the national health insurance (nhi), and are putting in place mechanisms for its implementation following conclusion of the parliamentary process.
tso: hi lemukile leswaku nseketelo wa nkhinkhi kusuka eka maafrika-dzonga hi nkarhi wa tinhlengeletano to twa miehleketo ya vaaki hi ndzindzakhombo wa rihanyu wa rixaka (nhi), naswona hi le ku endleni ka tindlela ta ntirhiso wa yona endzhaku ka ku fikisiwa emakumu ka phurosese ya palamende.

eng: in preparation for the nhi, we have already registered more than 44 million people at over 3.000 clinics in the electronic health patient registration system, and are now implementing this system in hospitals.
tso: eka ku lulamisela nhi, se hi tsarisile 44 wa timiliyoni ta vanhu eka kutlula 3 000 wa titliliniki eka sisiteme ya ntsariso wa vavabyi ya rihanyu ya xielekitironiki, naswona sweswi hi le ku simekeni ka sisiteme leyi eswibedhlele.

eng: i have established the presidential working group on disability to advise my office on measures to advance the empowerment of persons with disabilities as government plans, budgets and implements its programmes.
tso: ndzi tumbuluxile ntlawa wo tirha wa le hofisini ya phuresidente eka vutsoniwa ku tsundzuxa hofisi ya mina hi magoza ya ku antswisa havexerisamatimba wa vanhu lava nga na vutsoniwa tanihiloko wu ri karhi wu kunguhata, wu pimanyeta na simeka minongonoko ya wona.

eng: following the recognition by the department of basic education in 2018 of south african sign language as a home language and the recommendation by the parliamentary constitutional review committee that it be the 12th official language, we are now poised to finalise the matter.
tso: endzhaku ka ku tekeriwa enhlokweni hi ndzawulo ya dyondzo ya masungulo hi 2018 ka ririmi ra swikoweto ra afrika-dzonga tanihi ririmi ra le kaya na xibumabumelo hi komiti ya nkambisiso wa vumbiwa ya palamende leswaku yi va ririmi ra ximfumo ra vu12, sweswi hi tiyimiserile ku hetisisa mhaka leyi.

eng: fellow south africans,earlier this week, i returned from addis ababa in ethiopia, where south africa assumed the chairship of the african union (au) for 2020. we take up this responsibility at an important time for our continent.
tso: maafrika-dzonga varikwerhu,emasungulweni ya vhiki reri, ndzi vuya eaddis ababa eethiyopiya, laha afrika-dzonga yi sunguleke vutshamaxitulu bya yuniyoni ya afrika (au) bya 2020. hi byarha vutihlamuleri lebyi hi nkarhi wa nkoka eka tikokulu ra ka hina.

eng: this year, the african continental free trade area (afcfta) will come into effect.
tso: nan’waka, ndhawu ya mabindzu ya nkaswipimelo ya tikokulu ra afrika (afcfta) yi ta sungula ku tirha.

eng: this is our moment, as the people of the continent, to give effect to the dreams of the founding fathers of african unity.
tso: lexi i xinkadyana xa hina, tanihi vanhu va tikokulu leri, ku humelerisa milorho ya vasimeki va vun’we bya afrika.

eng: south africa will host an extraordinary au summit in may this year to finalise the modalities of the free trade agreement before its implementation on 1 july 2020. here we will finalise the rules that define what is a ‘made in africa’ product, the tariff lines that will be reduced to zero over the next five years, and the services sectors that will be opened up across the continent.
tso: afrika-dzonga yi ta rhurhela samiti ya au leyi nga tolovelekangiki hi mudyaxihi nan’waka ku hetisisa maendlelo ya ntwanano wa mabindzu ya nkaswipimelo wu nga si sungula ku tirhisiwa ka wona hi siku ra 1 mawuwani 2020. laha hi ta hetisisa milawu leyi yi hlamuselaka leswi ku nga swona ximakiwa xa ‘xi endliwile eafrika’, mitila ya mixavo leyi yi nga ta hungutiwa kufika eka ziro eka ntlhanu wa malembe lama taka, na tisekitara ta vukorhokeri leti ti nga ta pfuriwa eka tikokulu leri hinkwaro.

eng: allow me to take this opportunity to congratulate our compatriot, mr wamkele mene, who was this past weekend elected as the first secretary-general of the afcfta, and assure him of our full support as he assumes this historic and challenging responsibility.
tso: ndzi pfumeleleni ku teka xivandlanene lexi ku hoyozela muakatikokulobye wa ka hina ttn wamkele mene, loyi eka vhiki leri hundzeke a hlawuriweke tanihi matsalani-jenerala wa afcfta wo sungula, na ku n’wi tshembisa nseketelo wa hina hi vutalo tanihiloko a ri karhi a sungula vutihlamuleri lebya nkoka eka matimu na ku va lebyi tlhontlhaka.

eng: south africa has, therefore, prioritised the economic empowerment of africa’s women during its term as au chair, working with all member states on measures to promote financial inclusion, preferential procurement and preferential trade arrangements for women.
tso: hikokwalaho, afrika-dzonga yi rhangisile emahlweni havexerisamatimba wa ikhonomi ya vavasati va afrika-dzonga hi nkarhi wa theme ya yona tanihi mutshamaxitulu wa au, ku ri karhi ku tirhisaniwa na mifumo leyi nga swirho hinkwayo eka magoza ya ku kondletela nkatsahinkwavo wa swa timali, maxavelo ya tinhundzu na vukorhokeri yo ya hi ntsakelo na mitwanano ya mabindzu yo ya hi ntsakelo ya vavasati.

eng: the au heads of state have pledged their support for measures to end gbv on the continent, and will work towards the adoption of an au convention on violence against women during the course of this year.
tso: tinhloko ta mfumo ta au ti tibohile nseketelo eka magoza ya ku herisa gbv eka tikokulu leri, na ku tirhela ku amukeriwa ka ntwanano wa au eka madzolonga ehenhla ka vavasati hi ku famba ka lembe reri.

eng: through the african peer review mechanism, south africa will work with other countries to advance good governance and democracy.
tso: hi ku tirhisa endlelo ra nkambisiso wa vutangha ra afrika, afrika-dzonga yi ta tirhisana na matiko man’wana ku antswisa mafumelo lamanene na xidemokirasi.

eng: we will use all the means at our disposal – including our membership of the un security council – to promote peace and security on the continent.
tso: hi ta tirhisa tindlela hinkwato leti hi nga na tona – ku katsa na vuxirho bya hina eka khansele ya nsirhelelo ya un – ku kondletela ku rhula na nsirhelelo eka tikokulu.

eng: honourable members,fellow south africans,everything we do must be underpinned by effective implementation.
tso: swirho leswi hloniphekaka,maafrika-dzonga varikwerhu,swilo hinkwaswo leswi hi swi endlaka swi fanele ku seketeriwa hi matirhiselo ya kahle.

eng: that is why we have developed the ddm, a unique form of social compacting that involves the key role players in every district so that we can unlock development and economic opportunities.
tso: sweswo hi swona swi endlaka leswaku hi tumbuluxa ddm, muxaka lowu fanaka wu ri woxe wa ku twanana ka vaaki loku ku khumbaka vatlanginkulu va swiave eka xifundzatsongo xin’wana na xin’wana ku endlela leswaku hi kota ku pfulela nhluvuko na swivandlanene swa ikhonomi.

eng: it builds the capability of the state where it has been most broken.
tso: swi aka vuswikoti bya mfumo laha wu tshovekeke kona swinene.

eng: during the sona of february 2019, i addressed the five most urgent tasks of the moment, key among which was the need to strengthen the capacity of the state to address the needs of the people.
tso: hi nkarhi wa sona ya nyenyanyana 2019, ndzi tirhanile na ntlhanu wa mitirho ya xihatla ya xinkadyana xolexo, lexikulu exikarhi ka yona a ku ri xidingo xa ku tiyisa vuswikoti bya mfumo ku tirhana na swidingo swa vanhu.

eng: a broad range of critical work is being done across government to strengthen the capacity of local government, as the sphere of government closest to the people, to achieve its developmental mandate of finding sustainable ways to meet the social, economic and material needs of communities and improve the quality of their lives.
tso: mpimo wo angarhela wa ntirho wa nkoka swonghasi wu le ku endliweni eka mfumo hinkwawo ku tiyisa vuswikoti bya mfumo wa miganga, tanihi xiyenge xa mfumo lexi nga ekusuhisuhi na vanhu, ku fikelela xilerisoximfumo xa wona xa nhluvukiso xa ku kuma tindlela leti yisekaka emahlweni ku fikelela swidingo swa vaaki, ikhonomi na swipfuno swa vaakandhawu na ku antswisa risima ra vutomi bya vanhu.

eng: provincial and national government will re-double their efforts to support and strengthen the capacity of municipalities as required by section 154 of the constitution and provide for the monitoring and support of municipalities.
tso: mfumo wa swifundzakulu na wa rixaka wu ta mbirhihata matshalatshala ya wona ku seketela na ku tiyisa vuswikoti bya timasipala tanihilaha swi lavekaka hakona hi xiyenge xa 154 xa vumbiwa na ku lulamisela vuvekatihlo na nseketelo wa timasipala.

eng: it is only when the structured support has failed that the provincial executive or national government will invoke a section 139 intervention in strengthening local government.
tso: ko va ntsena loko nseketelo lowu nga na xivumbeko wu hlulekile hi kona vurhangerinkulu bya xifundzakulu kumbe mfumo wa rixaka wu nga ta tirhisa miphalalo wa xiyenge xa 139 eka ku tiyisa mfumo wa miganga.

eng: currently there are 40 municipalities in the country subjected to such intervention.
tso: eka nkarhi wa sweswi ku na 40 timasipala etikweni leti vekiweke eka mphalalo wolowo.

eng: the measures that will be taken will complement the objectives of the new district-based model of development, that seeks to take an integrated approach to service deliveryresidents of the mamusa municipality in north west have already seen this approach in action, where the ddm was effectively utilised to clear illegal dumping sites, refurbish pump stations to stop sewage spilling in the streets, build roads and lay water pipes, and provide water and toilets to local schools.
tso: magoza lama ya nga ta tekiwa ya tatisa swikongomelo swa modlolo lowuntshwa lowu simekiweke eka swifundzakulu wa nhluvukiso, lowu wu lavaka ku ku yisa endlelo leri pfanganisiweke eka mphakelo wa vukorhokeri.

eng: this year, we plan to expand the ddm to 23 new districts, drawing on lessons from the three pilot districts – or tambo district municipality, ethekwini and waterberg district municipality.
tso: vatshami xa masipala wa mamusa en’walungu-vupeladyambu se va vonile endlelo leri ri ri eku tirheni, laha ddm yi tirhisiweke hindlela ya kahle ku basisa matala lama nga riki enawini, ku pfuxa switichi swo pompa ku yimisa nkululo lowu khulukaka eswitarateni, ku aka magondzo na ku vekela tiphayiphi ta mati, na ku phakela mati na swihambukelo eswikolweni swa le migangeni.

eng: to strengthen the capacity of the state and increase accountability, i will be signing performance agreements with all ministers before the end of this month.
tso: ku tiyisa vuswikoti bya mfumo na ku engetela vutihlamuleri, ndzi ta va ndzi sayina mitwanano ya matirhelo na vaholobye hinkwavo ku nga si hela n’hweti leyi.

eng: these agreements – which are based on the targets contained in the medium-term strategic framework – will be made public so that the people of south africa can hold those who they elected into office to account.
tso: mitwanano leyi – leyi yi simekiweke ehenhla ka mipakaniso leyi kumekaka eka rimba ra maqhinga ya le xikarhi ka theme – yi ta endliwa yi kumeka eka vaaki ku endlela leswaku vanhu va afrika-dzonga va kota ku endle lava va va hlawuleke ku nghena ehofisini va tihlamulela.

eng: we see these performance agreements as the cornerstone of a new culture of transparency and accountability, where those who are given the responsibility to serve – whether as elected office bearers or public servants – do what is expected of them.
tso: hi vona mitwanano leya matirhelo tanihi ribyeyinhla ra ntolovelo lowuntshwa wa nkavuciva na vutihlamuleri, laha lavaya va nyikiweke vutihlamuleri ku tirhela – hambi loko va hlawurile tanihi vakhomi va ntirho kumbe vatirhelamfumo – va endla leswi swi languteriwaka eka vona.

eng: it is a culture where corruption, nepotism and patronage are not tolerated, and action is taken against those who abuse their power or steal public money.
tso: i ntolovelo laha vukungundzwana, xin’wanamanana na xinghananghana swi nga pfumeleriwiki, naswona goza ri tekiwaka ehenhla ka lavaya va tirhisaka hindlela yo homboloka matimba ya vona kumbe ku yiva mali ya mfumo.

eng: since i took office, we have built capacity in the presidency and elsewhere in the state to fast-track progress on a clear list of urgent reforms.
tso: kusukela loko ndzi nghene ehofisini, hi akile vuswikoti eka hofisi ya phuresidente na kun’wana na kun’wana eka mfumo ku hatlisisa nhluvuko lowu nga eka nxaxamelo wa mipfuxeto ya xihatla.

eng: we have established the project management office, the infrastructure and investment unit and the policy and research services to address obstacles to reform and improve government delivery.
tso: hi tumbuluxile hofisi ya malawulelo ya tiphurojeke, yuniti ya swimakiwakulu na vuvekisi na vukorhokeri bya tipholisi na ndzavisiso ku tirhana na swirhalanganyi ku pfuxeta na ku antswisa mphakelo wa mfumo.

eng: these units are working closely with the presidential infrastructure coordinating commission, investsa and the ease of doing business task team to remove impediments to investment and growth and ensure that government demonstrates visible progress quickly.
tso: tiyuniti leti ti tirhisana na khomixini yo hlanganisa swimakiwakulu ya le hofisini ya phuresidente, investsa na xipano xa ntirho xa vuolovi bya ku endla bindzu ku susa swirhalanganyi eka vuvekisi na ku kula ku tiyisisa leswaku mfumo wu kombisa nhluvuko lowu vonakaka hi ku hatlisa.

eng: with an efficient and capable machinery now in place at the centre of government, we will focus on the most urgent reforms and intervene where necessary to ensure implementation.
tso: hi matirhelo ya xihatla na vuswikoti lebyi nga kona sweswi eka vuxikarhi bya mfumo, hi ta kongomisa eka mipfuxeto ya xihatla swinene na ku phalala laha swi lavekaka ku tiyisisa leswaku ya tirhisiwa.

eng: fellow south africans,we find ourselves at a decisive moment in our history.
tso: maafrika-dzonga varikwerhu,hi tikuma hi ri eka xinkadyana xa ku teka swiboho eka matimu ya hina.

eng: it is a time of great difficulty and doubt, but also a time laden with great opportunities.
tso: i nkarhi wa ku tika lokukulu na ku kanakana, kambe wu tlhela wu va nkarhi lowu nga tala hi swivandlanene leswikulu.

eng: over the last two years, we have worked together to build a foundation for progress.
tso: emalembeni mambirhi lama nga hundza, hi tirhisanile ku aka masungulo ya nhluvuko.

eng: now is the time for us to build on that foundation, to unite, to work, to persevere.
tso: sweswi i nkarhi eka hina ku aka ehenhla ka masungula walawo, ku vumba vun’we, ku tirha hi ku tiyisela.

eng: we will not surrender our future to doubt, despair, or division or to those who are permanently negative to the work that is being done to improve the lives of our people.
tso: a hi nga nyikeli vumundzuku bya hina eka ku kanakana, ku hela matimba, kumbe ku avana kumbe eka lavaya vo kokela etlhelo nkarhi hinkwawo eka ntirho lowu wu nga eku endliweni ku antswisa vutomi bya vanhu va ka hina.

eng: we will continue our onward march to improve the lives of our people.
tso: hi ta ya emahlweni na ku macha hi ya emahlweni ku antswisa vutomi bya vanhu va ka hina.

eng: we will embrace change.
tso: hi ta vukarha ku cinca.

eng: speaker of the national assembly (na), ms thandi modise,chairperson of the national council of provinces (ncop), mr amos masondo,deputy president david mabuza,former president thabo mbeki and mrs mbeki,former deputy president phumzile mlambo-ngcuka,former deputy president baleka mbete,chief justice mogoeng mogoeng and esteemed members of the judiciary,ministers and deputy ministers,honourable members of the na,honourable members of the ncop,dean of the european region, representing the diplomatic corps, his excellency, mr beka dvali, distinguished guests,fellow south africans,on this day, 31 years ago, president nelson mandela walked out of the gates of victor verster prison a free person, a living embodiment of the resilience and courage of the south african people.
tso: xipikara xa huvo ya rixaka (na), mnn thandi modise,mutshamaxitulu wa huvo ya rixaka ya swifundzakulu (ncop), ttn amos masondo,xandla xa phuresidente david mabuza,khale ka phuresidente thabo mbeki na mnn mbeki,khale ka xandla xa phuresidente phumzile mlambo-ngcuka,khale ka xandla xa phuresidente baleka mbete,muavanyisinkulu mogoeng mogoeng na swirho swo xiximeka swa vuavanyisi,vaholobye na swandla swa vaholobye,swirho leswi xiximekaka swa na,swirho leswi xiximekaka swa ncop,dini ya xifundza xa europe, hi ku yimela huvo ya xidipulamati, muhlonipheki, ttn beka dvali, vayeni vo hlonipheka,maafrika-dzonga varikwerhu,hi siku leri fanaka na namuntlha, 31 wa malembe lama nga hundza, phuresidente nelson mandela u humile hi tinyangwa ta khotso ra victor verster tanihi munhu loyi a tshunxekeke, xiyimeri lexi hanyaka xa ku kondzelela na xitiyanhlana xa vanhu va afrika-dzonga.

eng: for nearly 40 million years, an extraordinary ecosystem has existed here at the southernmost tip of our continent.
tso: ku ringana kwalomu ka 40 wa timiliyoni ta malembe, ikhosisiteme yo hlamarisa yi vile kona laha makumu ka dzonga wa tiko ra ka hina.

eng: the fynbos biome, which stretches across the cape, has among the most distinctive features of any plants found on earth.
tso: fynbos biome, leyi yi hangalakaka na kapa, yi na swihlawulekisi swo hlawuleka swinene swa swimilana swihi kumbe swihi leswi kumekaka emisaveni.

eng: it can adapt to dry, hot summers and cold rainy winters.
tso: yi nga hanya eka ximumu xo oma, xo hisa na le ka xixika xo titimela xa mpfula.

eng: our national flower, the protea, is a species of fynbos.
tso: xiluva xa hina xa rixaka, protea, i muxaka wa fynbos.

eng: when i opened the third national investment conference last year, i spoke of the protea's unique properties that in so many ways resemble our national character.
tso: loko ndzi pfula khomferense ya vuvekisi ya rixaka lembe leri nga hela, ndzi vulavule hi swihlawulekisi leswi fanaka swoxe swa protea leswi hi tindlela to tala swi fanaka na vumunhu bya hina bya rixaka.

eng: what is most unique and special about fynbos is that to be sustainable and survive, it needs fire.
tso: lexi fana xoxe na ku va xo hlawuleka swinene hi mayelana na fynbos hi leswaku ku kota ku hlayiseka na ku hanya, yi dinga ndzilo.

eng: at least once every twenty years, fynbos must burn at extremely high temperatures to allow the ecosystem to be rejuvenated and grow afresh.
tso: hi mpimo hansi wa kan'we eka malembe ma makumembirhi man'wana na man'wana, fynbos yi fanele ku tshwa eka ndzilo lowu hisaka kutlula mpimo ku pfumelela ikhosisiteme ku pfuxeleriwa na ku kula hi vuntshwa.

eng: throughout the summer, the burned foliage lies desolate.
tso: ximumu hinkwaxo, matluka ma tshama ma nga kombi ntshembo.

eng: but when the autumn rains return, the seeds germinate, and its life cycle begins all over again.
tso: kambe loko timpfula ta xixikana ti vuya, mbewu yi sungula ku baleka, naswona ndzhendzeleko wa vutomi bya yona ya sungula nakambe.

eng: the mountains bloom with new life as plants which once seemed lost grow back even stronger than before.
tso: tintshava ti baleka swiluva hi vutomi byintshwa tanihiloko swimilana leswi nkarhi wun'wana a swi tikomba swi lahlekile swi mila nakambe swi tiyile kutlula emasungulweni.

eng: we, the people of south africa, have over the past year experienced a terrible hardship.
tso: hina, vanhu va afrika-dzonga, hi tokotile ku tikeriwa ko chavisa eka lembe leri nga hundza.

eng: like a wildfire that sweeps across the mountainous ranges where the fynbos grows, a deadly pandemic has swept across the world, leaving devastation in its path.
tso: ku fana na ritshwa leri kukulaka evunavini bya tintshava laha fynbos yi milaka kona, ntungukulu wo dlaya wu kukurile emisaveni hinkwayo, wu siya nchavo endleleni ya wona.

eng: and yet, like the hardy fynbos of our native land, we too have proven to be resilient in many ways.
tso: naswona hambiswiritano, kufana na fynbos yo tiya ya misava ya ka hina, na hina hi kombisile ku tiyisela hi tindlela to tala.

eng: for three centuries, we were victims of oppression, dispossession and injustice.
tso: ku ringana malembexidzana manharhu, a hi ri vaxanisiwa va ntshikelelo, ku tekeriwa nhundzu na mpfumaleko wa vululami.

eng: and for three centuries, we resisted.
tso: naswona ku ringana malembexidzana manharhu, hi arile.

eng: the flames of injustice may have scarred us, but they did not consume us.
tso: malangavi ya mpfumaleko wa vululami ya nga ha va ya hi chavisile, kambe a ya hi mitangi.

eng: the rains of democracy brought rejuvenation and the birth of a new nation.
tso: timpfula ta xidemokirasi ti tisile mpfuxelelo na ku tswariwa ka rixaka rintshwa.

eng: we have risen time and time again from the depths of darkness to herald a new day.
tso: hi tlakukile nkarhi na nkarhi nakambe eka munyama wo enta ku va xikombiso xa siku rintshwa.

eng: as we look on the grave damage that this disease has caused, we know that like the fynbos, like all those who have walked this land before us, we will rise again.
tso: loko hi languta eka ku onha lokukulu loku vuvabyi lebyi byi nga ku vanga, ha swi tiva leswaku kufana na fynbos, kufana na lava va nga hi rhangela ku famba eka misava leyi, hi ta tlakuka nakambe.

eng: nearly a year has passed since south africa saw its first case of the novel coronavirus, covid-19.
tso: kwalomu ka lembe ri hundzile kusukela loko afrika-dzonga yi vonile mhangu ya yona yo sungula ya khoronavhayirasi leyi yi nga si tshamaka yi va kona, covid-19.

eng: since then, nearly one-and-a-half million people in our country are known to have been infected by the virus.
tso: kusukela nkarhi wolowo, kwalomu ka miliyoni na hafu ya vanhu va tiveka ku va va tluleriwile hi xitsongwatsongwana lexi.

eng: more than 45 000 people are known to have died.
tso: kutlula 45 000 wa vanhu va tiveka ku va va lovile.

eng: beyond these statistics lies a human story of tragedy and pain.
tso: kuhundza eka tinhlayonhlayo leti ku na xitori xa munhu xo chavisa na ku vava.

eng: there is no family, no community and no place of work that has not lost someone they knew, worked with and loved.
tso: a ku na dyangu, a ku na muganga naswona a ku na ndhawu ya ntirho laha va nga lahlekeriwangiki hi munhu loyi a va n'wi tiva, loyi a va tirha na yena naswona a va n'wi rhandza.

eng: it is also a story of courage and resilience.
tso: ku tlhela ku va xitori xa xitiyanhlana na ku kondzelela.

eng: the resilience of the hospital worker who – day after day, night after night – goes to work to save lives, knowing that they, themselves, are at risk of infection.
tso: ku kondzelela ka mutirhi wa le xibedhlele loyi – siku endzhaku ka siku, vusiku endzhaku ka vusiku – a yaka entirhweni ku ya ponisa vutomi, a karhi a swi tiva leswaku yena n’wini, u le ka nxungeto wa ntluletavuvabyi.

eng: it is a wonderful account of the courage of the police officer, the soldier, the essential worker, the carer and all those on the frontline, who have kept our country safe, our people fed and our economy going.
tso: i ndzungulo wa kahle swinene wa xitiyanhlana xa phorisa, socha, mutirhi wa nkoka swonghasi, muhlayisi na hinkwavo lava tirhaka na vanhu hi ku kongoma, lava va nga endla leswaku tiko ra hina ri tshama ri hlayisekile, vanhu va ka hina va phameriwa na ikhonomi ya hina yi tirha.

eng: it is a story of solidarity and compassion.
tso: i xitori xa ku komba nseketelano na ntwelavusiwana.

eng: of a nation that has stood together to confront covid-19 in ways not seen since the early days of our democracy.
tso: xa rixaka leri ri nga yima swin'we ku jamelana na covid-19 hi tindlela leti ti nga si tshamaka ti voniwa kusukela eka masiku yo sungula ya xidemokirasi xa hina.

eng: more than anything else, this crisis has revealed the true character of our remarkable nation.
tso: kutlula hinkwaswo, nkitsinkitsi lowu wu paluxiwile hi vumunhuhatwa bya ntiyiso bya rixaka ra hina lero hlamarisa.

eng: it has revealed a spirit of the people who refused to be defeated.
tso: wu paluxile moya wa vanhu lava va alaka ku hluriwa.

eng: it is this south african spirit that must drive our resolve to build a new and more equal economy and a better, more just society.
tso: hi wona moya lowu wa afrika-dzonga lowu wu bohaka ku lawula vutiyimiseri bya hina ku aka ikhonomi yo ringana swinene yintshwa naswona yo antswa, rixaka ra kahle swinene.

eng: the year ahead must be a time for change, for progress and for rebirth.
tso: lembe leri hi langutaneke na rona ku boheka ku va nkarhi wa ku cinca, wa ku hluvuka na ku tswariwa hi vuntshwa.

eng: it must be a year in which we rise.
tso: ku boheka ku va lembe leri eka rona hi tlakukaka.

eng: this is no ordinary year, and this is no ordinary sona.
tso: leri a hi lembe ro toloveleka, naswona leyi a hi sona ya ntolovelo.

eng: i will therefore, focus this evening on the foremost, overriding priorities of 2021. first, we must defeat the coronavirus pandemic.
tso: hikwalaho ndzi ta, kongomisa madyambu lama eka swirhangana, swa nkoka kutlula hinkwaswo, emahlweni swinene swa 2021. xo sungula, hi boheka ku hlula ntungukulu lowu wa khoronavhayirasi.

eng: second, we must accelerate our economic recovery.
tso: xa vumbirhi, hi boheka ku hatlisisa nhlakarhelo wa ikhonomi ya hina.

eng: third, we must implement economic reforms to create sustainable jobs and drive inclusive growth.
tso: xa vunharhu, hi boheka ku simeka miantswiso ya ikhonomi ku tumbuluxa mitirho leyi yisekaka emahlweni na ku lawula ku kula loku ku katsaka hinkwavo.

eng: and finally, we must fight corruption and strengthen the state.
tso: naswona xo hetelela, hi boheka ku lwa na vukungundzwana na ku tiyisa mfumo.

eng: in the coming weeks, we will address the other important elements of government’s programme for the year.
tso: eka mavhiki lama taka, hi ta tirhana na swiphemu swa nkoka swin'wana swa nongoloko wa mfumo wa lembe leri.

eng: fundamental to our nation’s recovery is an unrelenting and comprehensive response to overcome the coronavirus.
tso: xa nkoka eka nhlakarhelo wa rixaka ra ka hina i angulo wo ka wu nga heli matimba na ku va wo angarhela ku hlula khoronavhayirasi.

eng: south africa has just emerged from the second wave of infections since covid-19 arrived on our shores in march last year.
tso: afrika-dzonga ya ha ku huma eka gandlati ra vumbirhi ra mitluletavuvabyi kusukela loko covid-19 yi fikile etibuweni ta hina hi nyenyankulu lembe leri nga hundza.

eng: driven by a new variant of the virus, this second wave was more severe and cost many more lives than the first wave.
tso: hi ku lawuriwa hi muxaka wuntshwa wa xitsongwatsongwana lexi, gandlati lera vumbirhi a ri tikile swinene naswona ri koxe vutomi byo tala kutlula gandlati lero sungula.

eng: nevertheless, the human cost could have been far greater.
tso: hambiswiritano, hakelo ya vanhu a yi tava yi tikile ngopfu.

eng: had we not moved quickly to restrict movement and activity, had we not prepared our health facilities, had south africans not observed the basic health protocols, the devastation caused by this virus could have been far worse.
tso: loko a hi nga tekangi magoza hi ku hatlisa ku alela ku jikajika na nghingiriko, loko a hi nga lulamiselangi miako ya hina ya swa rihanyu ya ka hina, loko maafrika-dzonga a va nga landzelelangi milawu ya rihanyu ya masungulo, ku onhakeriwa lokukulu loku ku nga vangiwa hi xitsongwatsongwana lexi a ku ta va ku tikile swinene.

eng: this year, we must do everything in our means to contain and overcome this pandemic.
tso: lembe leri, hi boheka ku endla hinkwaswo leswi hi swi kotaka ku kamanyeta na ku hlula ntungukulu lowu.

eng: this means intensifying our prevention efforts and strengthening our health system.
tso: leswi swi vula ku tiyisa matshalatshala ya hina ya ku sivela na ku tiyisa sisiteme ya hina ya rihanyu.

eng: it also means that we must undertake a massive vaccination programme to save lives and dramatically reduce infections across the population.
tso: swi tlhela swi vula leswaku hi fanele ku sungula nongoloko wa nsawutiso lowukulu ku ponisa vutomi na ku hunguta mitluletavuvabyi eka rixaka ra vanhu hinkwaro.

eng: earlier this week, we were informed that one of the vaccines that we had procured, the astrazeneca vaccine, offers minimal protection from mild to moderate infection by the new variant known as 501y.
tso: emasungulweni ya vhiki leri, hi tivisiwile leswaku xin'wana xa swisawutisi leswi hi nga swi xava, xisawutisi xa astrazeneca, xi nyika nsirhelelo wa mpimohansi kusuka eka ntluletavuvabyi wo vevuka kufika eka wa le xikarhi eka muxaka wuntshwa lowu tivekaka tanihi 501y.

eng: this is according to early findings of a study by our scientists and researchers.
tso: leswi i ku ya hi swikumiwa swa le masungulweni swa ndzavisiso hi van’watisayense na valavisisi va ka hina.

eng: we applaud these scientists for leading this research and providing new evidence that is vital for guiding our response.
tso: hi bela mavoko van’watisayense lava ku va va rhangela ndzavisiso lowu na ku nyika vumbhoni byintshwa lebyi byi nga bya nkoka swonghasi eka ku letela angulo wa hina.

eng: since this variant is now the dominant variant in our country, these findings have significant implications for the pace, design and sequencing of our vaccine programme.
tso: tanihiloko muxaka lowu ku ri wona muxaka lowu wu nga tala sweswi etikweni ra ka hina, swikumiwa leswi swi na mikucetelo ya nkoka eka rivilo, xivumbeko na nandzelelano wa nongoloko wa swisawutisi wa hina.

eng: while it should not delay the start of the vaccination programme by much, it will affect the choice of vaccines and the manner of their deployment.
tso: loko swi nga fanelangi ku hlwerisa ku sungula ka nongoloko wa swisawutisi hi mpimo lowukulu, swi ta khumba xihlawuriwa xa swisawutisi na ndlela ya matirhiselo ya swona.

eng: the first phase of our vaccination programme, which is targeted at health and other frontline workers, will now use the johnson & johnson vaccine, which has been shown to be effective against the 501y.
tso: xiphemu xo sungula xa nongoloko wa hina wa nsawutiso, lowu wu nga kongomisiwa eka vatirhi va swa rihanyu na vatirhi lava va tirhanaka na vanhu hi ku kongoma, sweswi xi ta tirhisa xisawutisi xa johnson & johnson, lexi xi nga kombisa ku tirha kahle ehenhla ka muxaka wa 501y.

eng: v2 variant.
we have secured nine million doses of the johnson & johnson vaccine.
tso: hi kumile kaye wa timiliyoni ta mipimamurhi ya xisawutisi xa johnson & johnson.

eng: the first batch, of 80 000 doses, will arrive in the country next week.
tso: gaxa lero sungula, ra mipimamurhi ya 80 000, ri ta fika laha tikweni vhiki leri taka.

eng: further consignments will arrive over the next four weeks, totalling 500 000 johnson & johnson vaccines.
tso: magaxa man'wana ma ta fika eka mavhiki ma mune lama landzelaka, leswi endlaka ntsengo wa 500 000 johnson & johnson wa swisawutisi.

eng: all provinces have rollout plans in place as the first vaccines come through.
tso: swifundzakulu hinkwaswo swi na makungu ya nsimeko tanihiloko swisawutisi swo sungula swi fikile.

eng: i wish to thank all provinces for their level of preparedness for this massive undertaking that we are about to embark upon.
tso: ndzi rhandza ku khensa swifundzakulu hinkwaswo eka levhele ya ku lulamela ya vona ka xisunguriwa lexikulukumba lexi hi lavaka ku xi sungula.

eng: in addition, we have secured 12 million vaccine doses from the global covax facility.
tso: hi ku tatisa, hi kumile 12 wa timiliyoni ta mipimamurhi ya xisawutisi kusuka eka ndhawu ya misava ya covax.

eng: this will be complemented by other vaccines that are available to south africa through the african union’s (au) african vaccine acquisition task team facility.
tso: leswi swi ta tatisiwa hi swisawutisi swin'wana leswi swi nga kona eafrika-dzonga hi ku tirhisa xipano xa xintirhwana xo kuma xisawutisi xa afrika xa nhlangano wa matiko ya afrika (au).

eng: pfizer has committed 20 million vaccine doses, commencing with deliveries at the end of the first quarter.
tso: pfizer yi ti bohile 20 wa timiliyoni ta mipimamurhi ya xisawutisi, yi ta sungula ku fikisa ekuheleni ka kotara yo sungula.

eng: we are continuing our engagements with all the vaccine manufacturers to ensure that we secure sufficient quantities of vaccines that are suitable to our conditions.
tso: hi yisa emahlweni mikanerisano ya hina na vamaki va swisawutisi hinkwavo ku tiyisisa leswaku hi kuma mipimo yo ringanela ya swisawutisi leswi swi nga ringanela swiyimo swa hina.

eng: the health and safety of our people remains our paramount concern.
tso: rihanyu na vuhlayiseko bya vanhu va ka hina swi tshama swi ri xivileriso xa nkoka swinene.

eng: all medication imported into the country is monitored, evaluated, investigated, inspected and registered by the south african health products regulatory authority.
tso: mirhi hinkwayo leyi nghenisiwaka etikweni yi vekiwa tihlo, ya lavisisiwa, ya kamberiwa naswona ya tsarisiwa hi huvo yo lawula swimakiwa swa rihanyu ya afrika-dzonga.

eng: we will continue to use the science-driven approach that has served us well since the earliest days of the pandemic.
tso: hi ta ya emahlweni hi tirhisa endlelo leri lawuriwaka hi sayense leyi yi nga hi tirhela kahle kusukela eka masiku yo sungula ya ntungukulu.

eng: the success of the vaccination programme will rely on active collaboration between all sectors of society.
tso: ku humelela ka nongoloko lowu wa nsawutiso swi ta tshembela eka ntirhisano wo tirha exikarhi ka tisekitara hinkwato ta rixaka.

eng: we are greatly encouraged by the active involvement of business, labour, the health industry and medical schemes, in particular, in preparing for this mass vaccination drive.
tso: hi hlohloteriwa swinene hi ku pfuneta ka nkhinkhi ka mabindzu, vatirhi, indasitiri ya rihanyu na swikimi swa vutshunguri, hi ku kongoma, hi ku lulamisela pfhumba lera nsawutiso wa xitshungu.

eng: as we have overcome before, we will overcome again and rise.
tso: tanihiloko hi hlurile ku sungula, hi ta hlula nakambe naswona hi ta tlakuka.

eng: but it is not just this disease that we must defeat.
tso: kambe a hi vuvabyi lebyi ntsena lebyi hi bohekaka ku byi hlula.

eng: we must overcome poverty, hunger, joblessness and inequality.
tso: hi fanele ku hlula vusweti, ndlala, ku pfumaleka ka mitirho na ku pfumaleka ka ndzingano.

eng: we must overcome a legacy of exclusion and dispossession that continues to impoverish our people, and which this pandemic has severely worsened.
tso: hi fanele ku hlula ndzhaka ya ku pfaleriwa ehandle na ku tekeriwa nhundzu leswi swi yaka emahlweni swi siwanekisa vanhu va ka hina, na leswi ntungukulu lowu wu nga swi nyanyisa swinene.

eng: when i delivered the sona in this house last year, none of us could have imagined how – within a matter of weeks – our country and our world would have changed so dramatically.
tso: loko ndzi nyika sona eka huvo leyi lembe leri nga hela, ku hava na un'we wa hina loyi a nga swi anakanya hilaha – eka xinkadyana xa mavhiki – tiko ra ka hina na misava ya hina a swi ta va swi cincile hi xitshuketana.

eng: our plans had to be adapted in response to a global emergency.
tso: makungu ya hina a ma fanele ku fambelanisiwa na angulo eka xilamulelamhangu xa misava hinkwayo.

eng: budgets had to be reprioritised and many programmes had to be deferred.
tso: mipimanyeto a ti fanele ku endliwa yi rhangisa swo karhi emahlweni hi vuntshwa naswona minongoloko yo tala yi fanele ku tlhelerisiwa endzhaku.

eng: over the past year, south africa has experienced a sharp decline in growth and a significant increase in unemployment.
tso: eka lembe leri nga hundza, afrika-dzonga yi tokotile ku hunguteka swinene ka ku kula na ntlakuko wo tivikana wa ku pfumaleka ka mitirho.

eng: poverty is on the rise.
tso: vusweti byi le ku tlakukeni.

eng: inequality is deepening.
tso: nkandzingano wu le ku enteni.

eng: in the third quarter of 2020, our economy was 6% smaller than it was in the last quarter of 2019. there were 1,7 million fewer people employed in the third quarter of 2020 than there were in the first quarter, before the pandemic struck.
tso: eka kotara ya vunharhu ya 2020, ikhonomi ya hina a yi ri yintsongo hi 6% kutlula leswi a yi ri xiswona hi kotara yo hetelela ya 2019. a ku ri na 1,7 wa timiliyoni ta vanhu vantsongo lava a va thoriwile eka kotara ya vunharhu ya 2020 kutlula leswi a va ri xiswona hi kotara yo sungula, ntungukulu lowu wu nga si fika.

eng: our unemployment rate now stands at a staggering 30,8%.
tso: mpimo wa ku pfumaleka ka mintirho sweswi wu yime eka 30,8% leyi hlamarisaka.

eng: as a result of the relief measures that we implemented and the phased reopening of the economy, we expect to see a strong recovery in employment by the end of the year.
tso: hikwalaho ka magoza ya mphalalo lama hi nga ma simeka na ku pfuriwa hi swiphemuphemu ka ikhonomi, hi langutela ku vona nhlakarhelo wo tiya eka mitirho hi ku hela ka lembe.

eng: as we worked to contain the spread of the virus, we also had to take extraordinary measures to support ordinary south africans, assist businesses in distress and protect people’s livelihoods.
tso: tanihileswi hi nga tirha ku kamanyeta ku hangalaka ka xitsongwatsongwana lexi, hi tlhele hi teka magoza mo ka ma nga tolovelekangi ku seketela maafrika-dzonga ma ntsenantsena, hi pfuna mabindzu lama a ma ri eku tikeriweni na ku sirhelela vutihanyisi bya vanhu.

eng: the social and economic relief package that we introduced in april last year is the largest intervention of its kind in our history.
tso: phakeji ya mphalalo wa vanhu na ikhonomi leyi hi nga yi tivisa hi dzivamisoko lembe leri nga hela i mphalalo lowukulukumba wa muxaka wa wona eka matimu ya hina.

eng: it identified measures worth a total of r500 billion – or about 10% of our gross domestic product – to provide cash directly to the poorest households, to provide wage support to workers and to provide various forms of relief to struggling businesses.
tso: yi kombile magoza ya nkoka wa ntsengo wa r500 wa tibiliyoni– kumbe kwalomu ka 10% ta ntsengo wa ximakiwa xa hina xa tiko hinkwaxo – ku nyika mali hi ku kongoma eka mindyangu leyi nga swela swinene, ku nyika nseketelo wa muholo eka vatirhi na ku nyika mixaka yo hambanahambana ya mphalalo eka mabindzu lama tikeriwaka.

eng: a total of 18 million people, or close to one-third of the population, received additional grant payments through these relief measures.
tso: ntsengo wa 18 wa timiliyoni ta vanhu, kumbe kufika kwalomu ka n’wexanharhu xa rixaka ra vaaki hinkwavo, va kumile tihakelo ta malimpfuneto yo engetelela hi magoza lama mphalalo.

eng: it is estimated that this grant lifted more than five million people above the food poverty line, helping to alleviate hunger in a moment of great crisis.
tso: swi kumbeteriwile leswaku malimpfuneto leyi yi tlakusile kutlula ntlhanu wa timiliyoni ta vanhu kuhundza eka layeni ya vusweti bya swakudya, ku pfuna ku hunguta ndlala hi nkarhi wa nkitsinkitsi lowukulu.

eng: to date, more than r57 billion in wage support has been paid to over 4,5 million workers through the special unemployment insurance fund temporary employer-employee relief scheme (ters).
tso: kufika namuntlha, kutlula r57 wa tibiliyoni hi nseketelo wa muholo ti hakeriwile eka kutlula 4,5 wa timiliyoni ta vatirhi hi ku tirhisa xikimi xa mphalalo xa muthoriwa-muthori xa nkarhinyana xa nkwama wo pfuna lavanga tirhiki (ters).

eng: more than r1,3 billion has been provided in support mainly for small- and medium-sized businesses.
tso: kutlula 1,3 wa tibiliyoni yi nyikiwile hi ku seketela ngopfungopfu mabindzu lamatsongo na ma le xikarhi.

eng: in addition, over r70 billion in tax relief was extended to businesses in distress.
tso: hi ku tatisa, kutlula r70 wa tibiliyoni wa mphalalo wa xibalo wu endliwile wu katsa mabindzu lama ma nga ku tikeriweni.

eng: around r18,9 billion in loans have been approved for 13 000 businesses through the loan guarantee scheme.
tso: kwalomu ka r18,9 wa tibiliyoni hi mali yo lomba ti pasiseriwile mabindzu ya 13 000 hi ku tirhisa xikimi xa mali yo lomba leyi tiyisisiweke.

eng: fellow south africans,it is nearly four months since i stood here before a joint sitting of this parliament to present to the nation the economic reconstruction and recovery plan.
tso: maafrika-dzonga varikwerhu,swi lava kufika kwalomu ka tin'hweti ta mune kusukela loko ndzi yimile laha emahlweni ka ntshamo wa nhlanganelo ya palamende ku nyika mbulavulo eka rixaka hi kungu ra ku aka hi vuntshwa na nhlakarhelo wa ikhonomi.

eng: this evening, we stand here not to make promises but to report on progress in the implementation of the recovery plan and the priority actions we must take to restore growth and create jobs.
tso: madyambu lawa, hi yima laha kungari ku endla switshembiso kambe ku vika hi ndzima eka nsimeko wa kungu ra nhlakarhelo na swiendlo swa swirhangana leswi hi bohekaka ku swi endla ku vuyisela ku kula na ku tumbuluxa mitirho.

eng: since the launch of the plan, we have focused on four priority interventions:we announced that we would be embarking on a massive rollout of infrastructure throughout the country.
tso: kusukela loko ku simekiwile kungu leri, hi kongomisile eka miphalalo ya swirhangana ya mune:hi tivisile leswaku hi ta va hi sungula nsimeko lowukulu wa swimakiwakulu etikweni hinkwaro.

eng: we knew that to achieve this objective we would need to steadily rebuild technical skills within government to prepare and manage large infrastructure projects.
tso: hi swi tivile leswaku ku fikelela xikongomelo lexi hi ta dinga ku aka nakambe hi ntolovelo swikili swa xithekiniki eka mfumo ku lulamisela na ku lawula tiphurojeke ta swimakiwakulu letikulu.

eng: we have now developed an infrastructure investment project pipeline worth r340 billion in network industries such as energy, water, transport and telecommunications.
tso: sweswi hi tumbuluxile nongoloko wa phurojeke ya vuvekisi bya swimakiwakulu swo ringana r340 wa tibiliyoni eka tiindasitiri to tanihi ta eneji, mati, vutleketli, na vuhlanganisi bya tiqingho.

eng: construction has started and progress is being made on a number of these projects.
tso: vuaki byi sungurile naswona ndzima yi le khatsiweni eka to hlayanyana ta tiphurojeke leti.

eng: since the announcement of the economic reconstruction and recovery plan, we have launched two major human settlements projects that will provide homes to almost 68 000 households in the gauteng province.
tso: kusukela loko ku tivisiwile hi kungu ra ku akiwa hi vuntshwa na nhlakarhelo wa ikhonomi, hi simekile tiphurojekekulu timbirhi ta vutshamiso bya vanhu leti ti nga ta nyika makaya eka kwalomu ka kufika ka 68 000 ya miti eka xifundzakulu xa gauteng.

eng: similar human settlements projects are planned in other provinces.
tso: tiphurojeke ta vutshamiso bya vanhu to fana ti kunguhatiwile eka swifundzakulu swin'wana.

eng: two years ago, i spoke about the dream of building new cities that will enable us to make a break with apartheid’s spatial development.
tso: eka malembe mambirhi lama nga hundza, ndzi vulavule hi norho wo aka madorobakulu mantshwa lama ma nga ta hi pfumelela ku hambana na nhluvukiso wa tindhawu wa mpfumo wa xihlawuhlawu.

eng: new post-apartheid cities are being conceptualised in a number of places in our country.
tso: madorobakulu mantshwa endzhaku ka mfumo wa xihlawuhlawu ma le ku kunguhatiweni eka tindhawu to hlaya etikweni ra ka hina.

eng: the lanseria smart city, the first new city to be built in a democratic south africa, is now a reality in the making.
tso: dorobakulu ra xithekinoloji ra lanseria, dorobakulu ro sungula ku akiwa eka afrika-dzonga ya xidemokirasi, sweswi i xiviri lexi nga eku endliweni.

eng: the draft masterplan for this smart city – which will become home to between 350 000 to 500 000 people within the next decade – was completed in november 2020 and is now out for public comment.
tso: kungukulu ra mpfapfarhuto ra dorobakulu ra xithekinoloji – leri ri nga ta hundzuka kaya ra exikarhi ka 350 000 ku ya eka 500 000 wa vanhu eka malembexikhume lama taka – ri hetiwile hi hukuri 2020 naswona sweswi ri humesiwile leswaku vanhu va veka mavonelo.

eng: progress is being made on several major water infrastructure projects.
tso: ndzima yi le ku khatsiweni eka tiphurojekekulu ta swimakiwakulu swa mati swo talanyana.

eng: these include phase 2a of the mokolo and crocodile river project, and the umkhomazi water project.
tso: leti ti katsa xiphemu xa 2a xa phurojeke ya milambu ya mokolo na crocodile, na phurojeke ya mati ya umkhomazi.

eng: the infrastructure investment plan identifies roads projects worth r19 billion covering the spine of the south african road network.
tso: kungu lera vuvekisi bya switirhisiwa ri komba tiphurojeke ta mapatu to durha r19 wa tibiliyoni leti katsaka nkhenunkhenu wa netiweke ya mapatu ya afrika-dzonga.

eng: work is underway to finalise finance structuring for these projects.
tso: ntirho wu le ku endliweni ku hetisisa ku pakiwa ka mali ya tiphurojeke leti.

eng: resources have been committed from the fiscus to support the construction and rehabilitation of the major n1, n2 and n3 highways.
tso: swipfuno swi averiwile kusuka enkwameni ku seketela ku akiwa na ku pfuxetiwa ka mapatu lamakulu ma nkoka ku nga n1, n2 na n3.

eng: these infrastructure projects will lead to the revival of the construction industry and the creation of much-needed jobs.
tso: tiphurojeke leti ta swimakiwakulu ti ta yisa eka mpfuxelelo wa indasitiri ya vuaki na ku tumbuluxiwa ka mitirho leyi dingekaka swinene.

eng: the r100 billion infrastructure fund is now in full operation.
tso: nkwama wa swimakiwakulu wa r100 wa tibiliyoni wu le ku tirheni sweswi.

eng: this fund will blend resources from the fiscus with financing from the private sector and development institutions.
tso: nkwama lowu wu ta hlanganisa nhundzu kusuka enkwameni hi mali kusuka eka sekitara yo ka yi nga ri ya mfumo na mihlangano ya nhluvukiso.

eng: its approved project pipeline for 2021 is varied and includes the student housing infrastructure programme, which aims to provide 300 000 student beds.
tso: nongoloko wa wona wa tiphurojeke lowu pasisiweke wa 2021 wu hambanisiwile na ku katsa nongoloko wa swimakiwakulu swa tiyindlu ta swichudeni, leyi yi kongomaka eka ku nyika mibedo ya swichudeni ya 300 000. phurojeke leyi pasisiweke yin'wana i sa connect, nongoloko wa ku simeka inthanete yo hatlisa eswikolweni, eswibedhlele, eswitichini swa maphorisa na le ka miako ya mfumo yin'wana.

eng: the second priority intervention of the recovery plan is to support a massive increase in local production and to make south african exports globally competitive.
tso: mphalalo wa xirhangana xa vumbirhi wa kungu ra nhlakarhelo i ku seketela ntlakuko wa matimba wa vuhumelerisi bya laha tikweni na ku endla leswaku ku xavisela ehandle ka afrika-dzonga swi kota ku phikizana.

eng: this will encourage greater investment by the private sector in productive activity.
tso: leswi swi ta hlohlotela vuvekisi lebyikulu hi sekitara yo ka yi nga ri ya mfumo eka nghiriko wo humelerisa.

eng: key to this plan is a renewed commitment from government, business and organised labour to buy local.
tso: xa nkoka eka kungu leri i ku tinyiketela loku pfuxeleriweke kusuka eka mfumo, mabindzu na vatirhi lava nga na tiyuniyoni ku xava laha tikweni.

eng: this commitment should lead to increased local production, which will lead to the revival of our manufacturing industry.
tso: ku tinyiketela loku swi fanele ku yisa eka vuhumelerisi bya laha tikweni lebyi tlakusiweke, leswi swi nga ta yisa eka mpfuxelelo wa indasitiri ya vumaki.

eng: all social partners that participated in the development of the economic reconstruction and recovery plan, as part of our social compact, have agreed to work together to reduce our reliance on imports by 20% over the next five years.
tso: vatirhisani va vanhu hinkwavo lava va tekeke xiave eka nhluvukiso wa kungu ra ku aka hi vuntshwa na nhlakarhelo wa ikhonomi, tanihi xiphemu xa ntwanano wa vanhu, va pfumelelanile leswaku va ta tirhisana ku hunguta ku tshembela ka hina na ku xava ematikweni mambe hi 20% eka malembe ma ntlhanu lama taka.

eng: they have identified 42 products – ranging from edible oils to furniture, fruit concentrates, personal protective equipment, steel products and green economy inputs – that can be sourced locally.
tso: va kumile swimakiwa swa 42 – leswi hambanaka kusuka eka mafurha lama dyiwaka ku ya eka fanichara, swakunwa swa mihandzu, switirhisiwa swo tisirhelela hi wexe, swimakiwa swa nsimbi na ku hoxa xandla ka ikhonomi ya rihlaza – leswi swi nga kumekaka laha tikweni.

eng: if we achieve our target, we will significantly expand our productive economy, potentially returning more than r200 billion to the country’s annual output.
tso: loko ho fikelela xikongomelo xa hina, hi ta ndlandlamuxa swinene vuhumelerisi bya ikhonomi ya hina, ku vuyelerisa ko tshembisa ka kutlula r200 wa tibiliyoni eka vuhumelerisi bya lembe na lembe bya tiko.

eng: last year, we undertook to create a larger market for small businesses and designate 1 000 locally produced products that must be procured from small, medium and micro enterprises (smmes).
tso: lembe leri nga hela, hi sungule ku tumbuluxa makete lowukulu wa mabindzu lamatsongo na ku hlawula 1.000 wa swimakiwa leswi humesiweke laha tikweni leswi swi faneleke ku xaviwa eka mabindzu lamatsongo, ma le xikarhi na lamatsongotsongo (tismme).

eng: as the covid-19 pandemic forced the closure of global value chains, we have been able to speed up this initiative as the local supply chains became open for locally manufactured products.
tso: tanihiloko ntungukulu lowu wa covid-19 wu sindzise ku pfariwa ka mikhulukelano ya nkoka ya misava, hi kotile ku hatlisisa pfhumba leri tanihiloko mikhulukelano ya mphakelo ya laha tikweni ya pfulerile swimakiwa swo makiwa laha tikweni.

eng: to this end, cabinet approved the smme-focused localisation policy framework which identified the 1 000 products.
tso: ku humelerisa leswi, khabinete yi pasise rimba ra pholisi yo endla laha tikweni yo kongomisa-tismme leri ri nga kuma swimakiwa swa 1 000. ku yisa emahlweni, tindzawulo ta nhluvukiso wa mabindzu lamatsongo, mabindzu na vumaki na mphikizano ti seketela tismme ku fikelela timakete letikulu ta laha tikweni na ta matiko mambe.

eng: these efforts are supported by robust manufacturing support programmes.
tso: matshalatshala lama ya seketeriwa hi minongoloko yo seketela yo tiya.

eng: in the sona last year, i said that our vision for industrialisation is underpinned by sector master plans to rejuvenate and grow key industries.
tso: eka sona lembe leri nga hela, ndzi vule leswaku xivono xa hina xa ku endliwa ka tiindasitiri xi seketeriwa hi makungukulu ma sekitara ku pfuxelela na ku kurisa tiindasitiri ta nkoka.

eng: four master plans that have been completed and signed to date – which are part of the social compact between labour, business, government and communities – have already had an impact in their respective industries.
tso: makungukulu ya mune lama ma nga hetiwa na ku sayiniwa kutafika namuntlha – lama ma nga xiphemu xa ntwanano wa vanhu exikarhi ka vatirhi, mabindzu, mfumo na miganga – se ma vile na nkhumbo eka tiindasitiri ta wona to hambanahambana.

eng: through the implementation of the poultry master plan, the industry has invested r800 million to upgrade production.
tso: hi ku simeka kungukulu ra vufuwahuku, indasitiri leyi yi vekisile r800 wa timiliyoni ku antswisa vuhumelerisi.

eng: south africa now produces an additional one million chickens every week.
tso: sweswi afrika-dzonga yi humesa miliyoni yo engetelela ya tihuku vhiki na vhiki.

eng: the sugar master plan was signed during the lockdown, with a commitment from large users of sugar to procure at least 80% of their sugar needs from local growers.
tso: kungukulu ra chukela ri sayiniwile hi nkarhi wa mpfalelo, na ku tinyiketela kusuka eka vatirhisi lavakulu va chukela ku kuma mpimohansi wa 80% ta swidingo swa vona swa chukela kusuka eka vakurisi va laha tikweni.

eng: through the implementation of the plan, last year saw a rise in local production and a decline in imported sugar, creating stability for an industry which employs some 85 000 workers.
tso: hi ku simekiwa ka kungu leri, lembe leri nga hela ri vone ku tlakuka eka vuhumelerisi bya laha tikweni na ku hunguteka ka chukela ro xaviwa ematikweni mambe, leswi tumbuluxeke ntshamiseko eka indasitiri leyi yi tholaka 85 000 wa vatirhi.

eng: support for black small-scale farmers is being stepped up, with a large beverage producer committing to expand their procurement sharply.
tso: nseketelo wa van'wamapurasi lavatsongo wu le ku tlakusiweni, laha muhumesi wa swakunwa lonkulu a tinyiketelaka ku ndlandlamuxa ku xava ka yena swinene.

eng: since the signing of the clothing, textile, footwear and leather masterplan in november 2019, the industry has invested more than half a billion rand to expand local manufacturing facilities, including smmes.
tso: kusukela loko ku sayiniwile kungukulu ra swiambalo, malapi, tintangu na dzovo hi hukuri 2019, indasitiri yi vekisile kutlula hafu ya biliyoni ya tirhandi ku ndlandlamuxa tindhawu ta vumaki ta laha tikweni, ku katsa tismme.

eng: we have worked closely with the auto sector to help it weather the pandemic.
tso: hi tirhile ekusuhi swinene na sekitara ya mimovha ku yi pfuna ku kondzelela ntungukulu lowu.

eng: by the end of the year, the sector had recovered around 70% of its normal annual production, in difficult circumstances.
tso: hi ku hela ka lembe, sekitara a yi hlakarherile kwalomu ka 70% wa vuhumelerisi bya yona bya ntolovelo bya lembe na lembe, eka swiyimo swo tika.

eng: last week, the ford motor company announced a r16 billion investment to expand their manufacturing facility in tshwane for the next generation ford ranger bakkie.
tso: vhiki leri nga hela, khamphani ya mimovha ya ford yi tivise r16 wa tibiliyoni ta vuvekisi bya ku ndlandlamuxa muako wa vumaki etshwane ku endlela rixaka leri landzelaka ra xibebe xa ford ranger.

eng: this investment will support the growth of around 12 small and medium enterprises in automotive component manufacturing.
tso: vuvekisi lebyi byi ta seketela ku kula ka kwalomu ka 12 wa mabindzu lamatsongo na ma le xikarhi eka vumaki bya swiphemutsongo swa mimovha.

eng: nearly half of the procurement spend on construction of the bulk earthworks and top structure at the tshwane special economic zone during this phase is expected to be allocated for smmes, an amount equal to r1,7 billion in procurement opportunities.
tso: kwalomu ka hafu ya matirhiselo ya mali ya ku xava eka vuaki bya tinhulu ta misava to tala na muako wa le henhla eka zoni ya ikhonomi yo hlawuleka ya tshwane hi nkarhi wa xiphemu lexi yi languteriwile ku averiwa tismme, na ntsengo wo ringana r1,7 wa tibiliyoni eka swivandlanene swa ku xaviwa ka nhundzu.

eng: toyota has invested in its kwazulu-natal facility to start production of the first generation of hybrid electric vehicles to come off a south african assembly line.
tso: toyota yi vekisile eka muako wa yona wa le kwazulu-natal ku sungula vuhumelerisi bya muxaka wo sungula wa swipandzamananga swa gezi swa mpfangano ku huma eka ndhawu yo hlanganisa ya afrika-dzonga.

eng: this follows investment announcements by nissan, mercedes benz and isuzu in expanded production facilities, all of which cement south africa’s position as a global player in auto manufacturing.
