tso: leswi swi landzela switiviso swa vuvekisi hi nissan, mercedes benz na isuzu eka ku ndlandlamuxiwa ka miako ya vuhumelerisi, leswi eka swona hinkwaswo swi tiyisaka xiyimo xa afrika-dzonga tanihi mutlangi wa misava hinkwayo eka vumaki bya mimovha.

eng: this year, our focus will be on getting the industry back to full production, implementing the black industrialist fund and working on a new platform for expanded auto trade with the rest of the continent.
tso: lembe leri, nkongomiso wa hina wu ta va eka ku vuyisela indasitiri leyi eka vuhumelerisi hi ku hetiseka, ku simeka nkwama wa tiindasitiri ta vantima na ku tirha eka pulatifomo yintshwa ya bindzu ra mimovha leri ndlandlamuxiweke na tikokulu hinkwaro.

eng: this will be part of our concerted effort to boost the manufacturing sector.
tso: leswi ku ta va xiphemu xa matshalatshala ya nhlanganelo ku nyika matimba eka sekitara ya vumaki.

eng: this year, we will begin to harness the opportunities presented by the african continental free trade area (afcfta), which came into operation on 1 january, following the adoption of the johannesburg declaration by the au.
tso: lembe leri, hi ta sungula ku tirhisa swivandlanene leswi nyikiweke hi ndhawu ya mabindzu ya nkaswipimelo ya tikokulu ra afrika (afcfta), leyi yi nga sungula ku tirha hi siku ra 1 sunguti, hi ku landza ku pfumeriwa ka xitiviso xa johannesburg hi au.

eng: the afcfta provides a platform for south african businesses to expand into markets across the continent, and for south africa to position itself as a gateway to the continent.
tso: afcfta yi nyika pulatifomo eka mabindzu ya afrika-dzonga ku ndlandlamuka ya va eka timakete etikwenikulu hikwaro, na ku va afrika-dzonga yi tiveka tanihi ndlela yo ya eka tikokulu.

eng: to address the deep inequalities in our society, we must accelerate the implementation of broad-based black economic empowerment policies on ownership, control and management of the economy.
tso: ku tirhana na nkandzingano wo enta eka rixaka ra ka hina, hi fanele ku hatlisisa nsimeko wa tipholisi to nyika ikhonomi ya vantima yo anama matimba eka vun'wini, vulawuri na vufambisi bya ikhonomi.

eng: last year, government agreed to landmark deals with companies that will advance black economic empowerment by transferring ownership to their workers.
tso: lembe leri nga hela, mfumo wu pfumerile mitwanano ya nkoka swonghasi na tikhamphani leyi yi nga ta antswisa ku nyika matimba ka ikhonomi eka vantima hi ku hundzisela vun'wini eka vatirhi va tona.

eng: in november last year, we held our third south africa investment conference to review the implementation of previous commitments and to generate new investment into our economy.
tso: hi hukuri lembe leri nga hela, hi khomile khomferense ya hina ya vuvekisi ya afrika-dzonga ya vunharhu ku kambisisa ku tirhisiwa ka vutiboheleri bya nkarhi lowu nga hundza na ku endla vuvekisi lebyintshwa eka ikhonomi ya hina.

eng: even under difficult economic circumstances, the investment conference managed to raise some r108 billion in additional investment commitments.
tso: na le ka swiyimo swa ikhonomi swo tika, khomferense ya vuvekisi yi kotile ku endla mali ya r108 wa tibiliyoni eka vutiboheleri bya vuvekisi byo engetelela.

eng: together with investment confirmed from the two previous conferences, we have now received r773 billion in investment commitments towards our five-year target of r1,2 trillion.
tso: kun'we na vuvekisi lebyi tiyisisiweke kusuka eka tikhomferense timbirhi leti nga hundza, sweswi hi kumile r773 wa tibiliyoni eka vutiboheleri bya vuvekisi ku ya eka nkongomo wa hina wa malembe ya ntlhanu wa r1,2 wa tithiriliyoni.

eng: firms have reported that some r183 billion of these investments has already flowed into projects that benefit the south african economy.
tso: tifeme ti vikile leswaku yin'wana ya r183 wa tibiliyoni ta vuvekisi lebyi se yi hoxiwile eka tiphurojeke leti ti vuyerisaka ikhonomi ya afrika-dzonga.

eng: this shows that our country is still an attractive investment destination for both local and offshore companies.
tso: leswi swi komba leswaku tiko ra ka hina ra ha ri ndhawu ya vuvekisi yo koka rinoko eka havumbirhi bya tikhampani ta laha tikweni na tikhamphani ta le handle ka tiko.

eng: we have worked to facilitate investment by increasing the ease of doing business, including making it easier to start a business.
tso: hi tirhile ku humelerisa vuvekisi hi ku tlakusa ku olova ka ku endla bindzu, ku katsa ku endla leswaku swi olova ku sungula bindzu.

eng: in the past year, more than 125 000 new companies were registered through the bizportal platform, completing their registration in just a matter of hours from the comfort of their homes or offices.
tso: eka lembe leri ri nga hundza, kutlula 125 000 wa tikhamphani tintshwa ti tsarisiwile hi ku tirhisa pulatifomo ya bizportal, ku hetisisa ntsariso wa tona hi tiawara titsongo ti ri emakaya kumbe etihofisini ta tona.

eng: we are making it easier for business to do business.
tso: hi le ku oloviseleni ka mabindzu ku endla bindzu.

eng: our third priority intervention is an employment stimulus to create jobs and support livelihoods.
tso: mphalalo wa xirhangana xa vunharhu i xihlohloteri xa mitirho ku tumbuluxa mitirho na ku seketela vutihanyisi.

eng: the largest numbers of jobs will be created by the private sector in a number of industries as the economy recovers.
tso: tinhlayo letikulu ta mitirho ti ta tumbuluxiwa hi sekitara yo ka yi nga ri ya mfumo eka tiindasitiri to hlayanyana tanihi loko ikhonomi yi hlakarhela.

eng: we continue to work in a social compact with the private sector to create a more conducive environment for them to be able to create jobs.
tso: hi ta ya emahlweni hi tirha na ntwanano wa vanhu na sekitara yo ka yi nga ri ya mfumo ku va tumbuluxela mbangu wo tirheka swinene leswaku va kota ku tumbuluxa mitirho.

eng: our compact with the private sector is underpinned by a clear commitment to grow our economy and to create jobs.
tso: ntwanano wa hina na sekitara yo ka yi nga ri ya mfumo wu seketeriwile hi ku tinyiketela loku nga erivaleni ku kurisa ikhonomi ya hina na ku tumbuluxa mitirho.

eng: however, the public sector has a responsibility to stimulate job creation.
tso: hambiswiritano, sekitara ya mfumo yi na vutihlamuleri byo hlohlotela ku tumbuluxiwa ka mitirho.

eng: both through its policies and through direct job creation opportunities.
tso: hi havumbirhi bya tipholisi ta yona na hi swivandlanene swa ku tumbuluxiwa ka mitirho yo kongoma.

eng: the presidential employment stimulus is one of the most significant expansions of public and social employment in south africa’s history.
tso: xihlohloteri xa mitirho xa phuresidente i xin'wana xa mindlandlamuxo ya nkoka swinene ya mintirho ya mfumo na ya vanhu eka matimu ya afrika-dzonga.

eng: by the end of january 2021, over 430 000 opportunities were already supported through the stimulus.
tso: hi ku hela ka sunguti 2021, kutlula 430 000 wa swivandlanene se a swi seketeriwile hi ku tirhisa xihlohloteri lexi.180 000 wa swivandlanene swo yisa emahlweni eka nkarhi wa sweswi swi le ka phurosese yo lava vanhu.

eng: these opportunities are in areas like education, arts and culture, global business services, early childhood development (ecd), and small-scale and subsistence farming.
tso: swivandlanene leswi swi le ka swiyenge swo fana na dyondzo, vutshila na mfuwo, vukorhokeri bya bindzu bya misava hinkwayo, nhluvukiso wa vundzumulo (ecd), na vurimi bya mpimo lowutsongo na byo tihanyisa.

eng: it involves environmental programmes such as the clearing of alien trees, wetland rehabilitation, fire prevention, and cleaning and greening across all municipalities.
tso: swi katsa minongoloko ya mbangu yo fana na ku susa minsinya leyi yi nga riki ya laha tikweni, mpfuxelelo wa tindhawu ta ntlangasi, ku sivela ndzilo, na ku basisa na ku byala swimilana eka timasipala hinkwato.

eng: these programmes are about real lives and real livelihoods.
tso: minongoloko leyi yi hi mayelna na vutomi bya xiviri na vutihanyisi bya xiviri.

eng: nearly half a million people are now receiving an income, developing new skills and contributing to their community and the country’s economy.
tso: kwalomu ka hafu ya miliyoni ya vanhu sweswi va kuma malinghena, va antswisa swikili swintshwa na ku hoxa xandla eka miganga ya ka vona na le ka ikhonomi ya tiko.

eng: we will continue to support employment for as long as it is necessary while the labour market recovers, even as we work to promote stronger and more resilient growth in the private sector.
tso: hi ta ya emahlweni hi seketela mitirho ntsena loko swi fanerile loko makete ya vatirhi wu ri karhi wu hlakarhela, na loko hi ri karhi hi tirha ku tlakusa ku kula loku kondzelelaka swinene na ku va ko tiya eka sekitara yo ka yi nga ri ya mfumo.

eng: in the sona last year, in response to the huge challenge our country faces of youth unemployment, i announced that the national youth development agency and the department of small business development would provide grant funding and business support to 1 000 young entrepreneurs within 100 days.
tso: eka sona lembe leri ri nga hela, hi ku angula eka ntlhontlho lowukulu lowu tiko ra hina ri nga langutana na wona wa ku pfumaleka ka mintirho ya vantshwa, ndzi tivise leswaku ejensi ya nhluvukiso wa vantshwa ya rixaka na ndzawulo ya nhluvukiso wa mabindzu lamatsongo swi ta nyika hakelo ya malimpfuneto na nseketelo wa bindzu eka 1 000 ya van'wamabindzu va vantshwa ku nga si hela 100 ra masiku.

eng: while the programme had to be put on hold due to the coronavirus restrictions, it nevertheless managed to reach its target of 1 000 businesses by international youth day on 12 august 2020. this provides a firm foundation for our efforts to support 15 000 start-ups by 2024. last year, we said we would establish the national pathway management network to provide support and opportunities to young people across the country.
tso: loko nongoloko wa ha fanele ku yimisiwa hikwalaho ka swipimelo swa khoronavhayirasi, hambiswiritano wu kotile ku fikelela nkongomo wa wona wa 1 000 ya mabindzu hi siku ra vantshwa ra misava hi 12 mhawuri 2020. leswi swi nyika masungulo yo tiya eka matshalatshala ma hina ku seketela 15 000 wa masungulo ya mabindzu hi 2024. lembe leri nga hela, hi vule leswaku hi ta tumbuluxa netiweke ya malawulelo ya ndlela ya rixaka ku nyika nseketelo na swivandlanene eka vantshwa etikweni hinkwaro.

eng: i want to encourage every young south african to join the more than 1,2 million people who are already in the network, and take their next steps to a better future.
tso: ndzi lava ku hlohlotela muafrika-dzonga wa muntshwa un'wana na un'wana wa le ku tikatsa eka kutlula 1,2 wa timiliyoni ta vanhu lava se va nga eka netiweke leyi, na ku teka magoza ya vona lama landzelaka kuya eka vumundzuku byo antswa.

eng: of the many hardships our people had to experience last year, schooling disruption placed a huge burden on learners, teachers and families.
tso: eka ku tikeriwa loku ko tala loku vanhu va ka hina va bohekeke ku ku tokota lembe leri nga hela, ku kavanyeteka ka ku dyondza swi vekile ndzhwalo lowukulu ehenhla ka vadyondzi, vadyondzisi na mindyangu.

eng: despite this, they persevered.
tso: handle ka leswi, va tiyiserile.

eng: it is our priority for this year to regain lost time and improve educational outcomes, from the early years through to high school and post-school education and training.
tso: hi lexi hi xi rhangisaka emahlweni eka lembe leri ku vuyisela nkarhi lowu nga lahleka na ku antswisa mivuyelo ya dyondzo, kusuka eka malembe ma le kusunguleni kuya eka xikolo xa le henhla na dyondzo ya le ndzhaku ka xikolo na vuleteri.

eng: the fourth priority intervention of the economic reconstruction and recovery plan is to rapidly expand energy generation capacity.
tso: mphalalo wa vumune lowu rhangaka emahlweni wa kungu ro aka hi vuntshwa na nhlakarhelo i ku ndlandlamukisa hi ku hatlisa ntalo wa ku endliwa ka eneji.

eng: restoring eskom to operational and financial health and accelerating its restructuring process is central to this objective.
tso: ku vuyisela eskom eka rihanyu ra matirhelo na ra swa timali na ku hatlisisa phurosese ya ku vumba hi vuntswha i swa nkoka eka xikongomelo lexi.

eng: eskom has been restructured into three separate entities for generation, transmission and distribution.
tso: eskom yi vumbiwile hi vuntshwa hi mavandla manharhu yo hambana yo endla gezi, hundziselo na vuhangalasi.

eng: this will lay the foundations for an efficient, modern and competitive energy system.
tso: leswi swi ta vumba masungulo ya sisiteme ya eneji tirha kahle, ya ximanguvalawa na ku va leyi phikizanaka.

eng: eskom is making substantial progress with its intensive maintenance and operational excellence programmes to improve the reliability of its coal fleet.
tso: eskom yi le ku khatseni ka ndzima yo tivikana hi vuhlayisi bya yona bya xiyimo xa le henhla na minongoloko yo tirha ya kahle swinene ku antswisa ku tshembhela ka yona ka swipandzamananga swa malahla.

eng: we are working closely with eskom on proposals to improve its financial position, manage its debt and reduce its dependence on the fiscus.
tso: hi tirhisana swinene na eskom eka swiringanyeto swa ku antswisa xiyimo xa yona xa timali, lawula xikweleti xa yona na ku hunguta ku tshembela ka yona eka nkwama.

eng: this requires a review of the tariff path to ensure that it reflects all reasonable costs and measures to resolve the problem of municipal debt.
tso: leswi swi lava nkambisiso wa ndlela ya mixavo ku tiyisisa leswaku yi kombisa tihakelo to twala hinkwato na magoza ya ku lulamisa xiphiqo xa xikweleti xa timasipala.

eng: in december 2020, government and its social partners signed the historic eskom social compact, which outlines the necessary actions we must take, collectively and as individual constituencies, to meet the country’s energy needs now and into the future.
tso: hi n'wendzamhala 2020, mfumo na vatirhisani va wona va vaaki wu sayinile ntwanano wa vanhu wa eskom, lowu wu andlalaka magoza lama faneleke lama hi bohekaka ku ma teka, hi nhlanganelo na tindhawu ta vatirhisi hi yin'weyin'we wa vavhoti, ku fikelela swidingo swa eneji swa tiko swa sweswi na swa nkarhi lowu taka.

eng: over the last year, we have taken action to urgently and substantially increase generation capacity in addition to what eskom generates:despite this work, eskom estimates that, without additional capacity, there will be an electricity supply shortfall of between 4 000 and 6 000 mw over the next five years, as old coal-fired power stations reach their end of life.
tso: eka lembe leri nga hundza, hi tekile goza ku engetela ku hatlisa na ntalo wa ku endliwa ka gezi hi ku tatisa eka leri eskom yi ri endlaka: handle ka ntirho lowu, eskom yi kumbetela leswaku, handle ka vuswikoti byo engetelela, ku ta va na ku kayivela ka mphakelo wa gezi exikarhi ka 4 000 na 6 000 mw eka malembe ma ntlhanu lama taka, tanihiloko switichi swa gezi swa khale swa malahla swi fika emakumu ka vutomi bya swona.

eng: as part of the measures to address this shortfall, we will in the coming weeks issue a request for proposals for 2 600 mw from wind and solar energy as part of bid window 5. this will be followed by another bid window in august 2021. recent analysis suggests that easing the licensing requirements for new embedded generation projects could unlock up to 5 000 mw of additional capacity and help to ease the impact of load shedding.
tso: tanihi xiphemu xa magoza mo tirhana na nkayivelo lowu, eka mavhiki lama taka hi ta humesa xikombelo xa swiringanyeto swa 2 600 mw kusuka eka eneji ya moya na dyambu tanihi xiphemu xa nkarhi wo ngheni tibidi wa 5. leswi swi ta landzeriwa hi nkarhi wo nghenisa tibidi wun'wana hi mhawuri 2021. nxopaxopo wa sweswinyana wu ringanyeta leswaku ku olovisiwa ka swilaveko swa ku nyika tilayisense eka tiphurojeke to endla gezi leti tiyisiweke tintshwa ta nga pfula kufika kwalomu ka 5 000 mw wa ntalo wo engetelela na ku pfuna ku olovisa swiphiqo swa ku timekeriwa hi gezi.

eng: we will therefore amend schedule 2 of the electricity regulation act, 2006 (act 4 of 2006) within the next three months to increase the licensing threshold for embedded generation.
tso: hikokwalaho hi ta cinca xedulu ya 2 ya nawu wa gezi, 2006 (nawu wa 4 wa 2006) ku nga si hela tin'hweti tinharhu leti taka ku tlakusa mpimo wa masungulo wa ku nyika tilayisense eka endliwa ka gezi loku tiyisiweke.

eng: this will include consultation among key stakeholders on the level at which the new threshold should be set and the finalisation of the necessary enabling frameworks.
tso: leswi swi ta katsa ku vulavurisana exikarhi ka vakhomaxiave va nkoka eka levhele leyi yona mpimo wa masungulo lowuntshwa wu faneleke ku ku vekiwa na ku hetisisiwa ka marimba lama kotisaka lama faneleke.

eng: eskom has already started work to expedite its commercial and technical processes to allow this additional capacity onto the grid without undue delay.
tso: eskom se yi sungurile ntirho wo hatlisisa tiphurosese ta bindzu na ta xithekiniki ku pfumelela ntalo lowo engetela eka netiweke ya gezi handle ko hlwela.

eng: as we mobilise all of the resources at our disposal to support economic recovery, we cannot lose sight of the threat that climate change poses to our environmental health, socioeconomic development and economic growth.
tso: loko hi karhi hi hlengeleta hinkwaswo swa swipfuno leswi hi nga na swona ku seketela nhlakarhelo wa ikhonomi, a hi nga bakanyeli etlhelo nxungeto lowu tisiwaka hi ku cinca ka tlilayimete eka rihanyu ra mbangu wa hina, nhluvukiso wa ikhonomi na vanhu na ku kula ka ikhonomi.

eng: we are, therefore, working to fulfil our commitments under the united nations framework convention on climate change and its paris agreement which include the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions.
tso: hikwalaho, hi le ku tirheni ku fikelela ku tiboha ka hina ehansi ka ntwanano wa rimba wa nhlangano wa tinxaka eka ku cinca ka tlilayimete na ntwanano wa paris wa wona lowu katsaka ku hungutiwa ka ku humesiwa ka moya lowu hoxaka xandla eka ku khomiwa ka masana ya dyambu exibakabakeni.

eng: eskom, our largest greenhouse gas emitter, has committed in principle to net zero emission by 2050 and to increase its renewable capacity.
tso: eskom, xihumesi lexikulu xa moya lowu hoxaka xandla eka ku khomiwa ka masana ya dyambu exibakabakeni, yi tibohile hi nawu kufika eka ndzingano ku humesiwa na ku tswongiwa ka moya exibakabakeni hi 2050 na ku tlakusa ntalo wa ku pfuxeta.

eng: eskom will be looking to partner with investors to repurpose and repower part of its coal fleet.
tso: eskom yi ta va yi langutile ku tirhisana na vavekisi ku kongomisa nakambe na ku tiyisa nakambe xiphemu xa swipandzamananga swa yona swa malahla.

eng: this will be done in a way that stimulates investment, local economic activity and local manufacturing, as part of a just transition.
tso: leswi swi ta endliwa hi ndlela leyi hlohlotelaka vuvekisi, nghingiriko wa ikhonomi wa laha tikweni na vumaki bya laha tikweni, tanihi xiphemu xa ku cinca lokunene.

eng: our work on climate change will be guided by the presidential coordinating commission on climate change, which is meeting for the first time this month.
tso: ntirho wa hina eka ku cinca ka tlilayimete wu ta leteriwa hi khomixini yo tirhisanisa ya phuresidente eka ku cinca ka tlilayimete, leyi yi hlanganaka ro sungula n'hweti leyi.

eng: the commission will work on a plan for a just transition to a low-carbon economy and climate resilient society.
tso: khomixini yi ta endla kungu ra ku cinca lokunene ku ya eka ikhonomi ya moyakhubu wa le hansi na rixaka leri kondzelelaka tlilayimete.

eng: we will not achieve higher rates of growth and employment if we do not implement structural economic reforms.
tso: a hi nga fikeleli mipimo ya le henhla ya ku kula na mitirho loko hi nga simeki miantswiso ya ikhonomi ya xivumbeko.

eng: these reforms are necessary to reduce costs and barriers to entry, increase competition, stimulate new investment and create space for new entrants in the market.
tso: miantswiso leswi yi fanerile ku hunguta tihakelo na swirhalanganyi eka ku nghena, ku tlakusa mphikizano, ku hlohlotela vuvekisi byintshwa na ku tumbuluxa xivandla xa vangheni vantshwa emakete.

eng: this work is being driven through operation vulindlela, which involves a team in the national treasury and the president’s office.
tso: ntirho lowu wu le ku fambisiweni hi operation vulindlela, leyi yi katsaka xipano eka vutamelankwama bya rixaka na hofisi ya phuresidente.

eng: operation vulindlela is focusing on reforms in the electricity, water, telecommunications and transport sectors, as well as reforms to our visa and immigration regime.
tso: operation vulindlela yi kongomisile eka miantswiso eka gezi, mati, vuhlanganisi bya tiqingho na tisekitara ta vutleketli, xikan’we na miantswiso eka vhisa ya hina na endlelo ra ku rhurhela laha tikweni.

eng: the completion of digital migration is vital to our ability to effectively harness the enormous opportunities presented by technological change.
tso: ku hetiwa ka ku rhurhisiwa ka xidijitali i swa nkoka swonghasi eka vuswikoti bya hina byo tirhisa swivandlanene swo hlayanyana leswi tisiwaka hi ku cinca ka thekinoloji.

eng: after many delays, we will begin the phased switch-off of our analogue television transmitters from next month.
tso: endzhaku ka ku hlwela ko tala, hi ta sungula ku timiwa ka swiphemuphemu ka swifambisi swa magandlati ya moya swa thelevixini ya analogo kusukela n'hweti leyi taka.

eng: it is anticipated that this process, which will be done province-by-province, will be completed by the end of march 2022. the process for the licensing of high-demand spectrum is at an advanced stage.
tso: swi languteriwile leswaku phurosese leyi, leyi yi nga ta endliwa xifundzakulu hi xifundzakulu, yi ta hetisiwa hi ku hela ka nyenyankulu 2022. phurosese ya ku nyika tilayisense ka vunavi bya magandlati ya moya ya xidingo xa le henhla yi le ka xiteji lexi fambeke swinene.

eng: we hope that the ongoing litigation on the licensing matter will provide legal certainty and will not unduly delay the spectrum auction process.
tso: hi tshemba leswaku vumangalelani leyi yaka emahlweni eka mhaka ya ku nyika tilayisense yi ta nyika ku tiyisisa ka xinawu naswona a swi nga hlwerisi swi nga fanelangi phurosese ya fandisi ya vunavi bya magandlati ya moya.

eng: in the water sector, we are working through operation vulindlela to ensure that water license applications are finalised within the revised timeframe of 90 days.
tso: eka sekitara ya mati, hi le ku tirheni hi operation vulindlela ku tiyisisa leswaku swikombelo wa layisense ya mati swa hetisisiwa ku nga si hundza nkarhi lowu nga pfuxetiwa wa masiku ya 90. na ku pfuxelela minongoloko ya green drop na blue drop ku tiyisa vulanguteri bya risima ra mati.

eng: and to revive the green drop and blue drop programmes to strengthen water quality monitoring.
tso: hi ta hetisisa na ku simeka qhinga ra tihakelo ta mati mambisi, na ku hatlisisa ku tumbuluxiwa ka ejensi ya swimakiwakulu swa swipfuno swa mati ya rixaka.

eng: we will finalise and implement the revised raw water pricing strategy, and accelerate the establishment of a national water resources infrastructure agency.
tso: vuswikoti bya hina ku phikizana eka timakete ta misava ti ya hi tirhelo ra netiweke ya tihlaluko na swiporo swa ka hina.

eng: our ability to compete in global markets depends on the efficiency of our ports and rail network.
tso: hi le ku vekeni hi vuntshwa durban tanihi hlaluko ya habu hemisifiya ya le dzongeni na ku hluvukisa ngqura tanihi miako yo fikela eka yona ya tikhontheni ya leyi u nga yi hlawulaka.

eng: we are repositioning durban as a hub port for the southern hemisphere and developing ngqura as the container terminal of choice.
tso: phacisi ya xiporo kusuka egauteng yi le ku kurisiweni ku pfumelela ku rhumeriwa ematikweni mambe ka swipandzamananga hi le port elizabeth.

eng: the rail corridor from gauteng is being extended to enable the export of vehicles through port elizabeth.
tso: lama i magoza ma nkoka swonghasi ku fambisa nhundzu hi tiraka kusuka epatwini kuya exiporweni na ku engetela mphikizano wa sisiteme ya xiporo.

eng: these are crucial steps to move freight from road to rail and increase the competitiveness of the rail system.
tso: ntirho wu le ku endliweni na tindzawulo leti khumbekaka ku antswisa vhisa ya hina na endlelo ra ku rhurhela laha tikweni mambe ku koka swikili na ku kurisa sekitara ya vupfhumba.

eng: work is underway with the relevant departments to reform our visa and immigration regime to attract skills and grow the tourism sector.
tso: tanihiloko ku endzela matiko mambe swi sungula ku hlakarhela eka ku tumbuluka ka covid-19, hi ta endla nsimeko wo hetiseka wa tivhisa ta xielekitironiki eka vaendzi vo huma echina, india, nigeria, kenya na matiko man'wana ma 10. nxaxamelo lowu pfuxetiweke wa swikili swa nkoka swonghasi wu ta humesiwa hi ndzawulo ya timhaka ta xikaya leswaku vanhu va veka mavonelo, hi vhiki rin'we, ku tiyisisa leswaku mavonelo mo hetelela ma komba swikili leswi dingiwaka hi ikhonomi.

eng: as international travel starts to recover in the wake of covid-19, we will undertake a full rollout of evisas to visitors from china, india, nigeria, kenya and 10 other countries.
tso: ntamu wa operation vulindlela se wu akile, na nseketelo lowu yi nga wu kuma eka mfumo hinkwawo, wu komba leswaku hi tiyimiserile hi mayelana na antswiso.

eng: the revised list of critical skills will be published for public comment by the department of home affairs, within one week, to ensure that the final version reflects the skills needed by the economy.
tso: hi ta ya emahlweni hi tirha hi nga heli matimba na ku ka hi nga wisi ku tumbuluxa ikhonomi ya manguvalawa, yo tirha kahle na ku va ya mphikizano leyi yi nga pfulekela maafrika-dzonga hinkwavo.

eng: the momentum that operation vulindlela has already built, and the support that it has received across government, shows that we are serious about reform.
tso: ku seketela phurosese ya hina ya antswiso, khansele ya mabindzu lama nga ehansi ka vun’wini bya mfumo ya phuresidente (tisoe) yi andlarile xikatsa lexi ka erivaleni xa miantswiso leyi yi nga ta pfumelela tikhamphani leta nkoka swonghasi ku fikelela xilerisoximfumo xa tona xa ku kula na nhluvukonawu wo angarhela wa tikhamphani leti nga ehansi ka vun’wini bya mfumo wu ta andlariwa eka khabinete eka lembeximali leri na le palamende lembeximali leri taka.

eng: to support our reform process, the presidential state-owned enterprises (soes) council has outlined a clear set of reforms that will enable these vital public companies to fulfil their mandate for growth and development.
tso: modlolo wa soe lowu yisiweke exikarhi wu le ku simekiweni eka lembeximali leri, lowu wu nga ta tiyisisa leswaku ku va na mafumelo lama ringanerisiweke, rimba ra malawulelo ya timali na matirhelo ya mitirho ra tisoe hinkwato.

eng: overarching legislation for state-owned companies will be tabled in cabinet this financial year and in parliament in the next the financial year.
tso: swilerisoximfumo leswa tisoe hinkwato ti le ku kamberiweni hi vuntshwa ku tiyisisa leswaku swa angula eka swidingo swa tiko na nsimeko wa kungu ra nhluvukiso ra rixaka.

eng: a centralised soe model is being implemented this financial year, which will ensure a standardised governance, financial management and operational performance framework for all soes.
tso: exikarhi ka ku onhaka ka ikhonomi loku ku nga vangiwa hi covid-19, sekitara ya vurimi ya afrika-dzonga yi tirhile kahle swinene.

eng: the mandates of all soes are being re-evaluated to ensure that they are responsive to the country’s needs and the implementation of the national development plan.
tso: hi 2020, hi hundzukile vaxaviseli va matiko ya le handle va xiyimo xa vumbirhi va malamula va misava, lava nga na ku kula ka ku xavisela matiko ya le handle ko tiya ka vhinyo, mavele, timanga, mihandzu yo wisa makamba na mimovamaxelo ma kahle hi 2020 na le masunguleni ya 2021 ma vula leswaku vurimi byi nga ha kula eka theme ya le kusuhi.

eng: in the midst of the economic damage caused by covid-19, south africa’s agricultural sector has performed remarkably well.
tso: leswi swi nyika xivandlanene xa xinakulobye xa mfumo-sekitara yo ka yi nga ri ya mfumo xo yisa emahlweni eka vurimi ku tlakusa ku cinca na ku tiyisisa ku kula loku hlayisekaka.

eng: this provides an opportunity for further public-private partnership in agriculture to promote transformation and ensure sustainable growth.
tso: i xivandlanene xa ku hatlisisa mphakelo hi vuntshwa wa misava hi ku tirhisa switirho swo hambanahambana swo tanihi ku vuyisela mfanelo ya misava na ku tekeriwa vun’wini bya misava hi xikongomelo xa ku nyika matimba eka swihumesiwa swa vurimi.

eng: it is an opportunity to accelerate land redistribution through a variety of instruments such as land restitution and expropriation of land in order to boost agricultural output.
tso: kutafika namuntlha, mfumo wu phakerile hi vuntshwa kutlula ntlhanu wa timiliyoni ta tihekitara (ha) ta misava, leswi ringanaka hi ku hetiseka na kwalomu ka 5 500 wa mapurasi, eka vavuyeriwa vo tlula 300 000. leswi i ku tatisa eka phurosese yo phakela misava, leyi yi nga vuyerisa kutlula timiliyoni timbirhi ta vakoxi va misava naswona swi hetelele ku va na ku hundziseriwa ka kwalomu ka 2,7 wa timiliyoni ta tihekitara.

eng: to date, government has redistributed over five million hectares (ha) of land, totalling around 5 500 farms, to more than 300 000 beneficiaries.
tso: hi tlhela hi va hi ri eku susumeteni ka minongoloko ku pfuneta van'wamapurasi lavantsongo na lava va ha sungulaka hi mfikelelo wa makete, ku kuma swikili eka nkhulukelano wa nkoka wa vurimi hinkwawo na ku engetela nhlayo ya van'wamapurasi va bindzu va vantima.

eng: during the course of the next financial year, we will establish a land and agrarian reform agency to fast-track land reform.
tso: hi ku famba ka lembeximali leri taka, hi ta tumbuluxa ejensi ya antswiso wa misava na vurimi ku hatlisisa antswiso wa misava.

eng: the public service is at the coalface of government, and lack of professionalism does not just impact service delivery.
tso: vukorhokeri bya mfumo byi le ka ndhawu ya ntirho ya mfumo, naswona ku pfumaleka ka moya wa xiphurofexinali a swi khumbi ntsena mphakelo wa vukorhokeri.

eng: it also dents public confidence.
tso: swi tlhela swi onha tshembo wa vanhu.

eng: advancing honesty, ethics and integrity in the public service is critical if we are to build a capable state.
tso: ku antswisa swa vutshembeki, matikhomelonene na vutengi eka vukorhokeri bya mfumo i swa nkoka swonghasi loko hi ta aka rixaka leri swi kotaka.

eng: through the national school of government, we continue to roll out courses and training programmes for government officials from entry level to senior management and the executive.
tso: hi ku tirhisa xikolo xa rixaka xa mfumo, hi ya emahlweni hi simeka minongoloko ya tikhoso na vuleteri bya vatirhelamfumo kusuka eka levhele ya masungulo ku ya eka vafambisi lavakulu na vurhangerinkulu.

eng: in october last year, i signed off on ministerial performance agreements with all ministers, which have now been published online.
tso: hi nhlangula lembe leri nga hela, ndzi sayinerile mitwanano ya matirhelo ya vaholobye hinkwavo, leyi sweswi yi nga humesiwa eka inthanete.

eng: this will enhance accountability and focused performance by members of the executive.
tso: leswi swi ta antswisa vutihlamuleri na matirhelo yo kongomisa hi swirho swa vurhangerinkulu.

eng: we remain on course to build a capable and professional civil service that delivers on its mandate and is accountable to the south african people.
tso: ha ha languteka hi ta fikelela xikongomelo xaku aka ka vukorhokeri bya vanhu byo swi kota na ku va bya xiphurofexinali lebyi humelerisaka xilerisoximfumo xa byona naswona lebyi byi tihlamulelaka eka vanhu va afrika-dzonga.

eng: we are proceeding with our efforts to strengthen the local government infrastructure and accelerate service delivery through the district development model.
tso: hi le ku yeni emahlweni na matshalatshala ya hina ku tiyisa swimakiwakulu swa mfumo wa miganga na ku hatlisisa mphakelo wa vukorhokeri hi ku tirhisa modlolo wa nhluvukiso wa swifundzatsongo.

eng: the model brings all three spheres of government to focus on key priorities and implementation of critical high impact projects.
tso: modlolo lowu wu tisa swiyenge swinharhu hinkwaswo swa mfumo ku kongomisa eka swirhanganakulu na nsimeko wa tiphurojeke ta nkhumbo wa le henhla swonghasi.

eng: working with both public and private sector partners, government is implementing a range of measures to support municipalities to address inadequate and inconsistent service delivery in areas such water provision, infrastructure build and maintenance.
tso: hi ku tirhisana na havumbirhi bya vatirhisani va tisekitara ta mfumo na to ka ti nga ri ta mfumo, mfumo wu le ku simekeni ka magoza yo hambanahambana ku seketela timasipala ku tirhana na mphakelo wa vukorhokeri wa xiyimo xa le hansi na ku va lowu nga fananiki eka swiyenge swo fana na mphakelo wa mati, ku akiwa ka swimakiwakulu na vuhlayisi.

eng: we are focusing on the appointment of properly qualified officials at a local level to ensure effective management and provision of services.
tso: hi kongomisa eka ku thola tiofixiyali leti nga thwasa hi mfanelo eka levhele ya miganga ku tiyisisa leswaku ku va na malawulelo na mphakelo lowu tirhaka kahle wa vukorhokeri.

eng: as we prepare for local government elections, which are due take place this year, we will need to adjust to the conditions forced upon us by covid-19 to ensure that the people of this country can determine who represents them at this crucial level of government.
tso: loko haha lulamisela mihlawulo ya mfumo wa miganga, leyi yi faneleke ku humelela lembe leri, hi ta dinga ku tifambelanisa eka swiyimo leswi nga boheleriwa ehenhla ka hina hi covid-19 ku tiyisisa vanhu va tiko leri va kota ku hlawula leswaku i mani a nga ta va yimela eka levhele leya nkoka swonghasi ya mfumo.

eng: fellow south africans,corruption is one of the greatest impediments to the country’s growth and development.
tso: maafrika-dzonga varikwerhu,vukungundzwana i xin'wana xa swikanganyisi swa ku kula na nhluvukiso wa tiko.

eng: the revelations from the zondo commission of inquiry lay bare the extent of state capture and related corruption.
tso: mihlavutelo yo huma eka khomixini ya zondo ya vulavisisi byi andlala erivaleni mpimo wa ku lawuriwa ka mfumo hi vanhu lava nga riki xiphemu na vukungundzwana lebyi yelanaka.

eng: testimony at the commission has shown how the criminal justice system was compromised and weakened.
tso: vumbhoni eka khomixini leyi byi kombile hilaha sisiteme ya vululami bya vugevenga a yi vevukisiwile hakona.

eng: it is, therefore, vital that we sustain the momentum of the rebuilding effort that we began three years ago.
tso: hikokwalaho, i swa nkoka ku hiteka eka matshalatshala ya ku aka hi vuntshwa lama hi nga ma sungula malembe manharhu lama nga hundza.

eng: there has been great progress in turning around law enforcement bodies.
tso: ku vile na ku antswa eka ku cinca tihuvo ta nsindziso wa nawu.

eng: critical leadership positions have been filled with capable, experienced and trustworthy professionals.
tso: swivandla swa vurhangeri swa nkoka swonghasi swi pfariwile hi tiphurofexinali ta vuswikoti, ta ntokoto na ku va to tshembeka.

eng: there is improved cooperation and sharing of resources between the respective law enforcement agencies, enabling a more integrated approach to investigations and prosecutions.
tso: ku na ntirhisano wo antswisiwa na ku avelaniwa ka swipfuno exikarhi ka tiejensi ta nsindziso wa nawu hi ku hambanahambana, ku pfumelela endlelo leri pfanganisiweke swinene ra vulavisisi na vuchuchisi.

eng: we have started implementation of the national anti-corruption strategy, which lays the basis for a comprehensive and integrated society-wide response to corruption.
tso: hi sungurile nsimeko wa qhinga ro lwisana na vukungundzwana ra rixaka, leri ri nyikaka masungulo ya angulo wo anama wa rixaka wo angarhela na ku va lowu pfanganisiweke eka vukungundzwana.

eng: we will shortly be appointing members of the national anti-corruption advisory council, which is a multi-sectoral body that will oversee the initial implementation of the strategy and the establishment of an independent statutory anti-corruption body that reports to parliament.
tso: kungari khale hi ta va hi thola swirho swa khansele ya vutsundzuxi bya ku lwisana na vukungundzwana ya rixaka, leyi yi nga huvo ya nkoka ya tisekitaranyingi leyi yi nga ta angamela nsimeko wa qhinga na ku tumbuluxiwa ka huvo yo lwisana na vukungundzwana leyi tiyimelaka leyi vikaka epalamende.

eng: when reports started to surface last year about possible fraud and corruption in the procurement of covid-19-related goods and services, we acted decisively to put a stop to these practices, to investigate all allegations and to act against those responsible.
tso: loko swiviko swi sungula ku humelela lembe leri nga hela hi mayelana na vumbabva na vukungundzwana eka ku xaviwa ka nhundzu na vukorhokeri byo fambelana na covid-19, hi tirhile hi mfanelo ku herisa maendlelo lama, ku lavisisa swihehlo hinkwaswo na ku tirhana na lava va khumbekaka.

eng: we established a fusion centre, which brings together key law enforcement agencies to share information and resources.
tso: hi tumbuluxile senthara ya nhlanganiso, leyi yi hlanganisaka tiejensi ta nsindziso wa nawu ta nkoka ku avelana vuxokoxoko na swipfuno.

eng: the fusion centre has brought many cases to trial and preserved or recovered millions of rands in public funds.
tso: senthara ya nhlanganiso yi tisile milandzu yo tala eku tengiweni naswona yi hlayisile kumbe ku vuyisa timiliyoni ta tirhandi ta mali ya mfumo.

eng: the special investigating unit (siu) was authorised to investigate allegations of unlawful conduct with respect to covid-19 procurement by all state bodies during the national state of disaster.
tso: yuniti yo hlawuleka yo lavisisa (siu) a yi pfumeleriwile ku lavisisa swihehlo swa matikhomelo yo ka ya nga ri enawini hi mayelana na ku xaviwa ka swa covid-19 hi tihuvo ta mfumo hinkwato hi nkarhi wa xiyimo xa mhangu xa rixaka.

eng: as it reported last week, the siu has finalised investigations into 164 contracts with a total value of r3,5 billion.
tso: tanihileswi yi nga vika vhiki leri nga hela, siu yi hetisisile vulavisisi eka tikontiraka ta 164 leti nga na nkoka wa ntsengo wa r3,5 wa tibiliyoni.

eng: in a significant advance for transparency and accountability, the political party funding act, 2018 (act 6 of 2018) will come into operation on 1 april this year.
tso: eka ku antswa ko tivikana ka nkavuciva na vutihlamuleri, nawu wa ku nyikiwa ka timali ka mavandla ya tipolitiki, 2018 (nawu wa 6 wa 2018) wu ta sungula ku tirha hi siku ra 1 dzivamisoko lembe leri.

eng: this will regulate public and private funding of political parties.
tso: leswi swi ta lawula ku nyikiwa ka timali ka mfumo na ko ka ku nga ri ka mfumo ka mavandla ya tipolitiki.

eng: among other things, it requires the disclosure of donations to parties and establishes two funds that will enable represented political parties to undertake their programmes.
tso: exikarhi ka swin'wana, swi lava mpaluxo wa minyikelo eka mavandla naswona swi tumbuluxa mikwama yimbirhi leyi yi nga ta kotisa mavandla ya tipolitiki lama yimeriweke ku sungula minongoloko ya wona.

eng: crime and violence continue to undermine people’s sense of safety and security.
tso: vugevenga na madzolonga swi ya emahlweni swi tekela ehansi moya wa vanhu wa nhlayiseko na nsirhelelo.

eng: tackling crime is central to the success of our recovery.
tso: ku tirhana na vugevenga i swa nkoka swonghasi eka ku humelela ka nhlakarhelo wa hina.

eng: crimes like cable theft, railway infrastructure vandalism, land invasions, construction site disruptions and attacks on truck drivers hamper economic activity and discourage investment.
tso: vugevenga byo fana na ku yiviwa ka tikhebulu, ku onheteriwa ka swimakiwakulu swa le xiporweni, ku phangiwa ka misava, ku kavanyeta ndhawu ya vumaki na ku hlaseriwa ka vachayeri va titiraka swi kavanyeta nghingiriko wa ikhonomi na ku heta ntamu wa vuvekisihi tekile magoza naswona hi ta ya emahlweni hi herisa vugevenga lebyi na ku tirhana na lava va khumbekaka hi ndlela ya nawumitlawa ya xintirhwana yi simekiwile eka swifundzakulu swo hlayanyana ku tirhana na ku endla vanhu va hakela timali swi nga ri enawini na madzolonga eka tindhawu ta nghingiriko wa ikhonomi.

eng: we have taken steps and will continue to stop these crimes and deal with those responsible in terms of the law.
tso: hi le ku landzeleriseni hi ku hatlisa nsimeko na ku nyikiwa ka vuswikoti ka ejensi ya malawulelo ya mindzilekano ku hunguta ku nghena etikweni swi nga ri enawini na vugevenga bya le mindzilekanini.

eng: task teams have been set up in a number of provinces to deal with extortion and violence on sites of economic activity.
tso: ku herisa madzolonga yo ya hi rimbewu (gbv) swi na nkoka swinene loko hi tivika ku va rixaka leri nga simekiwa eka ndzingano na ku ka ri nga hlawuli rimbewu.

eng: ending gender-based violence (gbv) is imperative if we lay claim to being a society rooted in equality and non-sexism.
tso: loko ndzi simeka kungu ra xiqhinga ra rixaka eka madzolonga yo ya hi rimbewu na ku dlayeteriwa ka vaxisati gbvf) hi dzivamisoko lembe leri nga hela, ndzi endle xitshembiso eka vavasati na vana va tiko leri leswaku hi ta tiyisa sisiteme ya vululami bya vugevenga ku va sivela ku chavisiwa nakambe, na ku tiyisisa leswaku vaonhi va langutana na vululami.

eng: when i launched the national strategic plan on gender-based violence and femicide (gbvf) in april last year, i made a promise to the women and children of this country that we were going to strengthen the criminal justice system to prevent them being traumatised again, and to ensure that perpetrators face justice.
tso: ku endla leswaku leswi swi tirha, swiphemu swinharhu swa nkoka swa nawu swi andlariwile epalamende lembe leri nga hela ku endlela leswaku sisiteme ya vululami bya vugevenga yi tirha kahle ku lwisana na gbv.

eng: to give effect to this, three key pieces of legislation were introduced in parliament last year to make the criminal justice system more effective in combatting gbv.
tso: ku tiyisisa leswaku vaonhi va mangariwa, hi le ku khatseni ka ndzima eka ku hunguta ku salela endzhaku ka milandzu ya gbv.

eng: to ensure that perpetrators are brought to book, we are making progress in reducing the backlog of gbv cases.
tso: hi ya emahlweni hi nyika nhlayiso na nseketelo eka lava va poneke eka gbv.

eng: in the sona last year, i said that we would prioritise the economic empowerment of women.
tso: eka sona lembe leri nga hela, ndzi vule leswaku hi ta rhangisa emahlweni ku nyika vavasati matimba ya ikhonomi.

eng: last year, cabinet approved a policy that 40% of public procurement should go to women-owned businesses and entities.
tso: lembe leri nga hela, khabinete yi pasise pholisi ya leswaku 40% ta ku xava ka mfumo ti fanele ku ya eka mabindzu na mavandla lama nga ehansi ka vun’wini bya vavasati.

eng: several departments have started implementing this policy and are making progress.
tso: tindzawulo to talanyana ti sungurile ku tirhisa pholisi leyi naswona ti le ku endleni ka ku cinca.

eng: last week, we also launched a groundbreaking private sector-led gbvf response fund.
tso: vhiki leri nga hundza, hi tlhele hi simeka nkwama wa angulo wa gbvf lowuntshwa lowu rhangeriwaka hi sekitara yo ka yi nga ri ya mfumo.

eng: several south african companies and global philanthropies made pledges to the value of r128 million.
tso: tikhamphani to talanyana ta afrika-dzonga na mihlangano yo nyikela ya misava va humesile swihanano swa nkoka wa r128 wa timiliyoni.

eng: over the next three years, government will allocate approximately r12 billion to implement the various components of the national strategic plan.
tso: eka malembe manharhu lama taka, mfumo wu ta avela kwalomu ka 12 wa tibiliyoni ku simeka swiphemutsongo swo hambanahambana swa kungu ra qhinga ra rixaka.

eng: gbv will only end when everyone takes responsibility for doing so in their homes, in their communities, in their workplaces, in their places of worship and in their schools.
tso: gbv yi ta hela ntsena loko un'wana na un'wana a byarha vutihlamuleri eka ku endla tano emakaya ya vona, emigangeni ya ka vona, eka tindhawu ta vona ta ntirho, eka tindhawu ta vona ta vukhongeri na le swikolweni swa ka vona.

eng: equally, we need to give attention to issues affecting children, including improving school-readiness, ecd planning and funding, protection against preventable diseases, policy reform around child welfare and reducing violence against children.
tso: hi ku ringana, hi dinga ku tekela enhlokweni timhaka leti khumbaka vana, ku katsa ku antswisa ku lulamela xikolo, nkunguhato wa ecd na ku nyikiwa ka timali, nsirhelelo eka mavabyi lama sivelekaka, antswiso wa tipholisi eka nhlayiseko wa vana na ku hunguta madzolonga eka vana.

eng: in the year ahead, we are also going to forge ahead with efforts to provide greater opportunities for persons with disabilities to participate in the economy and in society in general.
tso: eka lembe leri hi nga langutana na rona, hi ta tlhela hi ya emahlweni na matshalatshala ya ku nyika swivandlanene leswikulukumba eka vanhu lava nga na vutsoniwa ku teka xiave eka ikhonomi na rixaka hi ku angarhela.

eng: as we rebuild our economy in the midst of a pandemic, it is necessary that we continue – within our means – to provide support to those businesses and individuals that continue to be most affected.
tso: loko ha ha aka hi vuntshwa ikhonomi exikarhi ka ntungukulu lowu, i swa nkoka leswaku hi ya emahlweni - hi ku kota ka hina - ku nyika nseketelo eka mabindzu malamo na vanhu hi un’weun’we lava va yaka emahlweni va khumbekamabindzu lama nga eka tisekitara to talanyana ma ha ri ku tikeriweni naswona mindyangu yo tala yi ya emahlweni yi hlupheka tanihiloko makete wa mitirho wu hlakarhela hi ku nonokaeka tin'hweti titsongo leti nga hundza, hi vile na mikanerisano leyi yaka emahlweni na vatirhisani va hina va vaaki lava nga eka mabindzu, vatirhi na mihlangano ya miganga, lava va ringanyeteke ku engeteriwa ka yin'wana ya miseketelo na vanhu na ya ikhonomi.

eng: we have, therefore, decided to extend the period for the special covid-19 grant of r350 by a further three months.
tso: hikokwalaho hi vile hi boha ku engetela nkarhi wa malimpfuneto ya covid-19 yo hlawuleka ya r350 hi tin'hweti tinharhu to engetela.

eng: this has proven to be an effective and efficient short-term measure to reduce the immediate impact on the livelihoods of poor south africans.
tso: leswi swi tiyisisile ku va goza ro koma ro tirha kahle na ku va leri nga tlangisiki swipfuno ku hunguta ku khumbheka ka xihatla eka vutihanyisi bya maafrika-dzonga lava nga swela.

eng: we have also decided to extend the covid-19 ters benefit until 15 march 2021, only for those sectors that have not been able to open and operate.
tso: hi tlhele hi boha ku engetela mbuyelo wa covid-19 ters kufika siku ra 15 nyenyankulu 2021, ntsena eka tisekitara letiya a ti nga koti ku pfula ti tirha.

eng: the conditions of this extension and the sectors to be included will be announced after consultations with social partners at the national economic development and labour council.
tso: swipimelo swa engetelo lowu na tisekitara leti nga ta katsiwa swi ta tivisiwa endzhaku ka ku burisana na vatirhisani va vaaki eka khansele ya nhluvukiso wa ikhonomi na vatirhi ya rixaka.

eng: the national treasury will work with its partners and stakeholders on improvements to the loan guarantee scheme so that it better addresses the realities of smmes and other businesses as they strive to recover.
tso: vutamelankwama bya rixaka byi ta tirhisana na vatirhisani va byona na vakhomaxiave eka ku miantswiso ya xikimi xo tiyisisa mali yo lomba ku endlela leswaku xi ta tirhana ku antswa na mitiyiso ya tismme na mabindzu man'wana loko ma ha tirhela ku hlakarhela.

eng: we will work with our social partners to ensure that these and other interventions provide the relief to those who most need it.
tso: hi ta tirhisana na vatirhisani va hina va vaaki ku tiyisisa leswaku miphalalo leyi na yin'wana yi nyika mphalalo wa lava va wu dingaka ngopfu.

eng: fellow south africans,just as a harsh fire gives new life to our country’s fynbos, this crisis is an opportunity to build a different, better south africa.
tso: maafrika-dzonga varikwerhu,tanihiloko ndzilo wa vukarhi wu nyika vutomi byintshwa eka fynbos ya tiko ra ka hina, nkayankayo lowu i xivandlanene xo aka afrika-dzonga yo hambana na ku antswa.

eng: rebuilding our country requires a common effort.
tso: ku aka hi vuntshwa tiko ra ka hina swi lava matshalatshala yo fana.

eng: it requires that all south african take responsibility and play their part.
tso: swi lava leswaku maafrika-dzonga hinkwavo va byarha vutihlamuleri naswona va tlanga xiphemu xa vona.

eng: let us work together as government, as business, as labour, as political parties and as all of society to clear away the rubble and lay a new foundation.
tso: a hi tirheni swin'we tanihi mfumo, tanihi mabindzu, tanihi vatirhi, tanihi mavandla ya tipolitiki na tanihi rixaka ku basisa leswi weke na ku aka masungulo mantshwa.

eng: above all, let us return this country to the values upon which it was founded.
tso: ehenhla ka hinkwaswo, a hi vuyiseleni tiko leri eka mikhuvanene leyi ri nga simekiwa ehenhla ka yona.

eng: on the day of his release, 31 years ago, madiba gave his first public address here in cape town, where he reminded south africans that there were difficult days ahead, and that the battle was far from won.
tso: hi siku leri a nga humesiwa hi rona, malembe ma 31 lama nga hundza, madiba u nyike mbulavulo wa yena wo sungula kwala kapa, laha a nga tsundzuxa maafrika-dzonga leswaku a ku ri na masiku yo tika lama a va langutanile na wona, na leswaku nyimpi ya ha ri kule na ku hluriwa.

eng: madiba said:“now is the time to intensify the struggle on all fronts.”“to relax our efforts now would be a mistake which generations to come will not be able to forgive.”in counting the great cost to our society over the past year, we may be tempted to lose faith.
tso: madiba u te:“now is the time to intensify the struggle on all fronts.”“to relax our efforts now would be a mistake which generations to come will not be able to forgive.”hi ku hlayela ku lahlekeriwa ka rixaka ra ka hina eka lembe leri nga hela, hi nga ringeka ku tshika ripfumelo.

eng: but we can get through this.
tso: kambe hi nga hundza eka leswi.

eng: because we are a nation of heroes.
tso: hikuva hi rixaka ra tinhenha.

eng: i am referring not to the glorious lineage of struggle icons, but to the everyday heroes that walk among us, who work hard every day to put food on the table, to keep the company running, and to give support, help and care to our people.
tso: a ndzi langutisi ntsena eka rixaka ra ndhuma ra tinhenha ta nyimpi, kambe eka tinhenha ta masiku hinkwawo leti ti fambaka exikarhi ka hina, leti ti tirhaka hi matimba masiku hinkwawo ku veka swakudya etafuleni, ku endla khamphani yi tirha, na ku nyika nseketelo na nhlayiso wa vanhu va ka hina.

eng: it is your resilience that will help this country recover.
tso: i ku tiyisela ka n'wina leswi nga ta pfuna nhlakarhelo wa tiko.

eng: in addition to the many challenges that beset our people, we have heard that his majesty king goodwill zwelithini has not been well in recent days and is admitted to hospital.
tso: hi ku tatisa eka mitlhontlho leyo tala leyi yi karhataka vanhu va ka hina, hi twile leswaku ndabezitha hosinkulu goodwill zwelithini a nga pfukangi eka masiku ma sweswi naswona u amukeriwile exibedhlele.

eng: i wish to convey my wishes for the speedy recovery of his majesty king goodwill zwelithini ka bhekuzulu.
tso: ndzi tsakela ku n'wi navelela ku hola hi ku hatlisa ndabezitha hosinkulu zwelithini ka bhekuzulu.

eng: our thoughts and prayers are with the royal household and the zulu nation at this time.
tso: miehleketo na swikhongelo swa hina swi na yindlu ya vukosi na rixaka ra mazulu hi nkarhi lowu.

eng: as we prepare for the difficult path ahead, we can draw strength from maya angelou’s great poem, still i rise.
tso: loko ha ha lulamisela ndlela yo tika leyi hi nga langutana na yona, hi nga kuma matimba eka xitlhokovetselo xa maya angelou, still i rise.

eng: she writes:out of the huts of history’s shamei riseup from a past that’s rooted in paini risei’m a black ocean, leaping and wide,welling and swelling i bear in the tide.
tso: a tsala:out of the huts of history’s shamei riseup from a past that’s rooted in paini risei’m a black ocean, leaping and wide,welling and swelling i bear in the tide.

eng: leaving behind nights of terror and feari riseinto a daybreak that’s wondrously cleari risebringing the gifts that my ancestors gave,i am the dream and the hope of the slave.
tso: leaving behind nights of terror and feari riseinto a daybreak that’s wondrously cleari risebringing the gifts that my ancestors gave,i am the dream and the hope of the slave.

eng: speaker of the national assembly, ms nosiviwe mapisa-nqakula,chairperson of the national council of provinces, mr amos masondo,deputy president david mabuza,former president thabo mbeki,former deputy president phumzile mlambo-ngcuka,former deputy president baleka mbete,former speaker of the national assembly, mr max sisulu,acting chief justice raymond zondo,mayor of the city of cape town, mr geordin hill-lewis,dean of the diplomatic corps, mr bene m'poko,members of the judiciary,heads of institutions supporting democracy,members of parliament,fellow south africans,this year, for the first time since the dawn of our democracy, the sona is not being delivered in the chamber of the national assembly.
tso: xipikara xa huvo ya rixaka, mnn nosiviwe mapisa-nqakula,mutshamaxitulu wa huvo ya rixaka ya swifundzakulu, ttn amos masondo,xandla xa phuresidente david mabuza,khale ka phuresidente thabo mbeki,khale ka xandla xa phuresidente phumzile mlambo-ngcuka,khale ka xandla xa phuresidente baleka mbete,khale ka xipikara xa huvo ya rixaka, ttn max sisulu,muavanyisinkulu wo khomela raymond zondo,meyara wa dorobakulu ra kapa, ttn geordin hill-lewis,dini ya huvo ya xidipulomati, ttn bene m'poko,swirho swa vuavanyisi,varhangeri va mihlangano leyi seketelaka xidemokirasi,swirho swa palamente,maafrika-dzonga varikwerhu,lembe leri, rosungula hi mpfhuka ku sungule xidemokirasi xa hina, sona yi nga andlaleriwi eka yindlu ya huvo ya rixaka.

eng: as we entered this new year, a huge fire engulfed the seat of our democracy.
tso: loko hi ri karhi hi nghena eka lembe lerintshwa, ndzilo lowukulu wu hisile ndhawu ya hina ya xidemokirasi.

eng: we all watched in outrage and sadness as the flames devoured the buildings in which our democratic constitution was born, in which laws of transformation and progress have been passed, in which the freely-chosen representatives of the people have shaped our young nation.
tso: hinkwerhu hi hlalele hi ku hlamala na ku tsana loko malangavi ma hlasela miako ya laha vumbiwa ra hina ra xidemokirasi ri nga velekiwa kona, laha milawu ya ku cinca na ku humelela yi nga pasisiwa kona, hi laha vayimeri va vanhu lava hlawuriweke hi ku tshunxeka va cinceke xivumbeko xa rixaka ra ka hina leritsongo.

eng: for many, what happened in parliament speaks to a broader devastation in our land.
tso: eka vo tala, leswi swi humeleleke epalamente swi vula ku onhakeriwa lokukulu etikweni ra ka hina.

eng: for many, the fire was symbolic of the devastation caused by the covid-19 pandemic, by rising unemployment and deepening poverty.
tso: eka vo tala, ndzilo wu vile mfungho wa ku onhakeriwa loku vangiweke hi ntungukulu wa covid-19, hi ku tlakuka ka mpfumaleko wa mitirho na ku nyanyisa vusweti.

eng: it spoke to the devastation of a pandemic that over the past two years has taken the lives of tens of thousands of south africans, put two million people out of work and brought misery to families.
tso: wu kombisile hi ku onhiwa hi ntungukulu lowu eka malembe mambirhi lama hundzeke wu tekeke vutomi bya makume ya magidi ya maafrika-dzonga, kutani wu susa timiliyoni mambirhi ya vanhu emitirhweni ni ku tisa maxangu emindyangwini.

eng: the fire in parliament reminded us of the destruction, violence and looting that we witnessed in parts of the country in july last year, of the more than 300 lives lost and many more livelihoods ruined.
tso: ndzilo wa le palamente wu hi tsundzuxile hi ku onheteriwa, madzolonga na ku phanga leswi hi swi voneke eka swiphemu swa tiko hi mawuwana lembe leri hundzeke, ka kutlula 300 ya vutomi lebyi lahlekeke na vutihanyisi byin’wana byo tala lebyi onheteriweke.

eng: as we reflect on the past year, we recall the words of president thabo mbeki who reminded us that: “trying times need courage and resilience.
tso: loko hi karhi hi ehleketisisa hi lembe leri hundzeke, hi tsundzuka marito ya phuresidente thabo mbeki loyi a hi tsundzuxeke leswaku: “mikarhi yo ringeta yi lava xivindzi na ku sihalala.

eng: our strength as a people is not tested during the best of times”.
tso: matimba ya hina tanihi vanhu a ma kamberiwi hi mikarhi leyi swilo swi fambaka kahle”.

eng: that we are gathered together in the cape town city hall instead of the national assembly chamber reflects the extraordinary circumstances of this time.
tso: leswaku hi hlengeletanile kun’we eka holo ya dorobakulu ra kapa ematshan’wini ya le ka yindlu ya huvo ya rixaka swi kombisa vukheta swiyimo swo ka swi nga tolovelekangi xa nkarhi lowu.

eng: it reflects the determination of the presiding officers of parliament and indeed all the members of our two houses that the work of this democratic institution should continue without interruption.
tso: swi kombisa ku tinyiketela ka vatshamaxitulu va palamente naswona hakunene a swirho hinkwaswo swa tindlu ta hina timbirhi leswaku ntirho wa nhlangano lowa xidemokirasi wu nga ya emahlweni handle ko kavanyetiwa.

eng: there are moments in the life of a nation when old certainties are unsettled and new possibilities emerge.
tso: ku na mikarhi evuton’wini bya rixaka loko vutitshembi bya khale byi nga tshamisekangi kutani mikoteko yintshwa yi tumbuluka.

eng: in these moments, there is both the prospect of great progress and the risk of reversal.
tso: hi mikarhi leyi, ku na havumbirhi bya nkoteko wa ku humelela hi ndlela yo hlamarisa na nxungeto wa ku tlhelela endzhaku.

eng: today, we are faced with such a moment.
tso: namuntlha, hi langutanile ni nkarhi walowo.

eng: the path we choose now will determine the course for future generations.
tso: ndlela leyi hi yi hlawulaka sweswi yi ta lawula nhluvukiso wa tinxaka ta nkarhi lowu taka.

eng: that is why we are taking steps to strengthen our democracy and reaffirm our commitment to a constitution that protects us all.
tso: hikokwalaho hi tekaka magoza ku tiyisa xidemokirasi xa hina ni ku tiyisisa ku tiboha ka hina eka vumbiwa leri ri hi sirhelelaka hinkwerhu.

eng: we are working together to revitalise our economy and end the inequality and injustice that impedes our progress.
tso: hi le ku tirhisaneni ku nyika matimba hi vuntshwa ikhonomi ya hina na ku herisa nkandzingano na nkavululami leswi kavanyetaka ku humelela ka hina.

eng: we are standing together against corruption and to ensure that those who are responsible for state capture are punished for their crimes.
tso: hi yimile kun’we ku lwisana ni vukungundzwana na ku tiyisisa leswaku lava va nga ni vutihlamuleri eka ku tekiwa ka vulawuri hi va le handle va xupuleriwa vugevenga bya vona.

eng: we are rebuilding the state and restoring trust and pride in public institutions.
tso: hi aka hi vuntshwa mfumo na ku vuyelerisa ntshembo ni vutinyungubyisi eka mihlangano ya mani na mani.

eng: if there is one thing we all agree on, it is that the present situation – of deep poverty, unemployment and inequality – is unacceptable and unsustainable.
tso: loko ku ri ni nchumu wun’we lowu hi pfumelelanaka eka wona, hileswaku xiyimo xa sweswi – xa vusweti lebyikulu, ku pfumaleka ka mitirho na nkandzingano – a xi amukeleki naswona a xi nga heti nkarhi wo leha.

eng: there is agreement among a broad and diverse range of south africans that fundamental reforms are needed to revive economic growth.
tso: ku ni ntwanano exikarhi ka mixaka leyikulu yo hambana ya maafrika-dzonga leswaku ku miantswiso ya nkoka ya dingiwa ku pfuxelela ku kula ka ikhonomi.

eng: there is a need both to address the immediate crisis and to create conditions for long-lasting stability and development.
tso: ku na xidingo xa havumbirhi bya ku ololoxa xirilo xa xihatla na ku tumbuluxa swiyimo swa ntshamiseko na lowu nga tekaka nkarhi wo leha na nhluvukiso.

eng: to achieve this, south africa needs a new consensus.
tso: ku fikelela leswi, afrika-dzonga ri dinga ntwanano wuntshwa.

eng: a consensus that is born out of a common understanding of our current challenging situation and a recognition of the need to address the challenges of unemployment, poverty and inequality.
tso: ntwanano lowu tswariwaka hi ku twisisa kun’we ka xiyimo xa hina xo tlhontlha xa sweswi na ku tekela enhlokweni xidingo xo ololoxa mitlhontlho ya mpfumaleko wa mitirho, vusweti na nkandzingano.

eng: this should be a new consensus which recognises that the state must create an environment in which the private sector can invest and unleash the dynamism of the economy.
tso: leswi a ku fanele ku va ntwanano wuntshwa lowu tekelaka enhlokweni leswaku mfumo wu boheka ku tumbuluxa mbangu lowu eka wona sekitara leyi nga riki ya mfumo yi nga kotaka ku vekisa na ku tshunxa vucincacinceki bya ikhonomi.

eng: but equally, an environment in which south africans can live a better life and unleash the energy of their capabilities.
tso: kambe hi ku ringana, mbangu lowu eka wona maafrika-dzonga va nga hanyaka vutomi byo antswa na ku tshunxa matimba ya vuswikoti bya vona.

eng: this should also be a new consensus which embraces our shared responsibility to one another, and acknowledges that we are all in this together.
tso: leswi swi fanele ku tlhela swi va ntwanano wuntshwa lowu vukarhaka vutihlamuleri bya hina lebyi avelaniwaka kuya eka un’wana, ni ku tekela enhlokweni leswaku hinkwerhu hi le ka swona swin’we.

eng: as the social partners – government, labour, business and communities – we are working to determine the actions we will take together to build such a consensus.
tso: tanihi vatirhisani va vaaki – mfumo, mitirho, mabindzu na miganga – hi tirhela ku teka xiboho xa swiendlo leswi hi nga ta swi endla swin’we ku aka ntwanano wolowo.

eng: we have begun discussions on what trade-offs are needed and what contribution we will each need to make.
tso: hi se hi sungule mikanelo ya leswi mabindzu ya nga tipfumataka swona ni ndlela leyi hi faneleke ku pfuneta hayona hi un’weun’we.

eng: we have given ourselves 100 days to finalise a comprehensive social compact to grow our economy, create jobs and combat hunger.
tso: hi tinyikile 100 wa masiku ku hetisisa ntwanano wa vanhu wo katsakanya ku kurisa ikhonomi ya hina, ku tumbuluxa mitirho na ku lwa na ndlala.

eng: this work will build on the foundation of the economic reconstruction and recovery plan (errp), which remains our common programme to rebuild the economy,we remain focused on the priorities we identified in the sona last year:to be effective, this social compact needs to include every south african and every part of our society.
tso: ntirho lowu wu ta aka ehenhla ka masungulo ya kungu ra ku akiwa hi vuntshwa na nhlakarhelo wa ikhonomi (errp), lowu wu tshamaka wu ri nongoloko wa hina lowu tolovelekeke wo aka ikhonomi hi vuntshwa.

eng: no one must be left behind.
tso: ku nga vi ni loyi a siyiwaka endzhaku.

eng: fellow south africans,when i last addressed the state of our nation, we were deep in the throes of the worst pandemic in more than a century.
tso: maafrika-dzonga varikwerhu,loko ro hetela ndzi andlarile mbulavulo xiyimo xa rixaka ra ka hina, a hi ri endzeni ka ntungukulu wo vava swinene eka kutlula lembexidzana.

eng: since covid-19 reached our shores, we have endured successive waves of infection, the emergence of new variants and the devastating cost of nearly 100 000 recorded covid-19 deaths.
tso: kusukela loko covid-19 yi fikile etibuweni ta ka hina, hi tiyiserile magandlati lama a ma landzelelana ya ntluletavuvabyi, ku tumbuluka ka mixaka yintshwa ni ntsengo wo hlamarisa wa kwalomu ka 100 000 ya mafu ma covid-19 lama kandziyisiweke.

eng: south africans have responded to this grave threat with courage and resilience, with compassion and restraint.
tso: maafrika-dzonga va hlamurile eka nxungeto lowu wo chavisa hi xitiyanhlana na ku sihalala, ni ku komba rirhandzu ni ku tikhoma.

eng: over the past two years, we have taken unprecedented actions to strengthen our health system, build laboratory capacity and prevent infections.
tso: eka malembe mambirhi lama hundzeke, hi tekile magoza lama nga si tshamaka ma va kona ku tiyisa sisiteme ya hina ya rihanyo, ku aka nhlayo ya tilaboretari na ku sivela mitluletavuvabyi.

eng: the nation owes a great debt of gratitude to the dedicated healthcare workers and other frontline staff who put their health and their lives at risk to care for the ill and vulnerable during this pandemic.
tso: tiko ri kolota xikweleti lexikulu xa mikhenso eka vatirhi va nhlayiso wa rihanyo lava tinyiketeleke ni vatirhi van’wana va le mahlweni lava vekeke rihanyu ni vutomi bya vona enxungetweni ku hlayisa vavabyi na lava nga sirhelelekangiki hi nkarhi wa ntungukulu lowu.

eng: within weeks of the first reported infection in our country, i announced the establishment of the solidarity fund, with the goal of uniting the country in the fight against the pandemic.
tso: ku nga si hela mavhiki eka ntluletavuvabyi lowu vikiweke rosungula etikweni ra ka hina, ndzi tivise hi ku tumbuluxiwa ka nkwama wa nseketelano, hi xikongomelo xo khomanisa tiko eka ku lwisana ni ntungukulu lowu.

eng: in a wave of generosity that swept the country, the fund raised r3.4 billion from more than 300 000 individuals and 3 000 companies and foundations.
tso: eka gandlati ra vuhanani leri kukuleke tiko, nkwama wu hlengeletile r3.4 wa tibiliyoni kusuka eka vanhu vo tlula 300 000 na 3 000 wa tikhamphani na tifawundexini.

eng: more than 400 individuals and 100 companies volunteered their time and services.
tso: kutlula vanhu va 400 ni tikhamphani ta 100 leti nyikeleke nkarhi na vukorhokeri bya vona.

eng: the fund has played a pivotal role in supporting the national health response and alleviating the humanitarian crisis.
tso: nkwama lowu wu tekile xiphemu xa nkoka lowukulu hi ku seketela angulo wa rihanyo ra rixaka na ku hunguta xirilo xo hlayisa vanhu.

eng: i would like to thank everyone who contributed to the solidarity fund and the great many who came together in countless other initiatives to support those affected by the pandemic.
tso: ndzi ta tsakela ku khensa munhu un’wana na un’wana loyi a nyikeleke eka nkwama wa nseketelano na le ka lavotala lava hlanganeke swin’we eka mihlangano ya ntsandzavahlayi ku seketela lava khumbiweke hi ntungukulu lowu.

eng: as the trajectory of the pandemic has continued to change, we have had to adapt and evolve.
tso: tanihiloko ndlela ya ntungukulu yi yile emahlweni yi ri karhi yi cinca, a hi fanele ku tifambelanisa na ku luka mano.

eng: our approach has been informed throughout by the best available scientific evidence, and we have stood out both for the quality of our scientists and for their involvement in every step of our response.
tso: maendlelo ma hina a ma leteriwa hinkwawo ka wona hi vumbhoni bya xisayense bya kahle swinene lebyi a byi ri kona, kutani hi tiyiserile swa risima ra van’watisayense va ka hina na ku tikatsa ka vona eka goza rin’wana na rin’wana ra ku angula ka hina.

eng: during the past year, we have focused on accelerating our vaccine rollout.
tso: eka lembe leri hundzeke, hi langutile hi vukheta eka ku hatlisisa ku hangalasa ka hina ka swisawutisi.

eng: so far, we have administered 30 million doses of covid-19 vaccines.
tso: kufikela sweswi, hi tirhisile 30 wa timiliyoni ta mipimamurhi ya swisawutisi swa covid-19.

eng: consequently, nearly 42% of all adults and 60% of everyone over 50 is fully vaccinated.
tso: hikokwalaho, kwalomu ka 42% ta vatswatsi hinkwavo na 60% ta munhu un’wana na un’wana wa kutlula 50 wa malembe va sawutisiwile hi ku hetiseka.

eng: we are now ready to enter a new phase in our management of the pandemic.
tso: sweswi hi tiyimiserile ku nghena eka xiphemu xintshwa eka malawulelo ya hina ya ntungukulu lowu.

eng: it is our intention to end the national state of disaster as soon as we have finalised other measures under the national health act, 2003 (act 61 0f 2003) and other legislation to contain the pandemic.
tso: i xikongomelo xa hina ku herisa xiyimo xa rixaka xa mhangu hi ku hatlisa tanihiloko hi fikisile emakumu magoza man’wana lama nga ehansi ka nawu wa rihanyo wa rixaka, 2003 (nawu wa 61 wa 2003) na milawu yin’wana ku kamanyeta ntungukulu lowu.

eng: nearly all restrictions on economic and social activity have already been lifted.
tso: kwalomu ka swipimelo hinkwaswo swa nghingiriko wa ikhonomi na vaaki se swi susiwile.

eng: vaccines have proven to be the best defence we have against illness and death from covid-19.
tso: swisawutisi swi tiyisisiwile ku va xisirhelelo xo antswa lexi hi nga na xona ku lwisana ni vuvabyi na rifu ro vangiwa hi covid-19.

eng: if we all get vaccinated, continue to observe basic health measures and remain ever vigilant, we will be able to get on with our lives even with the virus in our midst.
tso: loko hinkwerhu hi sawutisiwa, hi ya emahlweni hi landzelela magoza ya rihanyo ya masungulo na ku tshama hi tilanguterile, hi nga swi kota ku ya emahlweni ni vutomi bya hina hambiloko xitsongwatsongwana xi ri exikarhi ka hina.

eng: the state of the nation is linked inextricably to the state of our economy.
tso: xiyimo xa rixaka xi hlanganisiwa ku nga ri ni ku hambaniseka eka xiyimo xa ikhonomi ya hina.

eng: in addition to the divides of race, geography and education, covid-19 has exacerbated the divide between those who are employed and unemployed.
tso: ku engetela eka swiavanyisi swa rixaka, ntivomisava na dyondzo, covid-19 yi nyanyisile xiavanyisi exikarhi ka lava tirhaka ni lava nga tirhiki.

eng: last year, our unemployment rate reached its highest recorded level.
tso: lembe leri hundzeke, mpimo wa hina wa mpfumaleko wa mitirho yi lerile levhele ya yona le henhlahenhla.

eng: unemployment has been caused by low growth, which has in turn resulted from a long-term decline in investment.
tso: mpfumaleko wa mitirho wu vangiwile hi ku kula ka le hansi, loku na ku kona ku vangiweke hi ku ehla ka nkarhi wo leha eka vuvekisi.

eng: in the last year, we have benefited from a clear and stable macroeconomic framework, strong commodity prices and a better-than-expected recovery.
tso: eka lembe leri hundzeke, hi vuyeriwile kusuka eka rimba ra ikhonomi leyikulu leri nga erivaleni na ku leri tshamisekeke mixavo ya switirhisiwa na nhlakarhelo wo antswa kutlula lowu languteriweke.

eng: however, we have been held back by an unreliable electricity supply, inefficient network industries and the high cost of doing business.
tso: hambiswiritano, hi kokeriwile endzhaku hi mphakelo wa gezi wo ka wu nga tshembeki, nhlanganiso wa tiindasitiri leti nga tirhiki kahle na ndhurho wa le henhla wa ku endla mabindzu.

eng: we have been taking extraordinary measures to enable businesses to grow and create jobs alongside expanded public employment and social protection.
tso: a hi ri karhi hi teka magoza mo hlamarisa ku endla leswaku mabindzu ma kula ni ku tumbuluxa mitirho hi ku fambelanisa na mitirho ya mfumo leyi ndlandlamukisiweke na nsirhelelo wa vaaki.

eng: we all know that government does not create jobs.
tso: hinkwerhu ha swi tiva leswaku mfumo a wu tumbuluxi mitirho.

eng: business creates jobs.
tso: mabindzu hi wona ma tumbuluxaka mitirho.

eng: around 80% of all the people employed in south africa are employed in the private sector.
tso: kwalomu ka 80% ta vanhu hinkwavo lava tirhaka eafrika-dzonga va thoriwile eka sekitara leyi nga riki ya mfumo.

eng: the key task of government is to create the conditions that will enable the private sector – both big and small – to emerge, to grow, to access new markets, to create new products, and to hire more employees.
tso: ntirho lowukulu wa mfumo i ku tumbuluxa swiyimo leswi nga ta endla leswaku mabindzu mo ma ri nga ri ma mfumo – havumbirhi lamakulu na lamatsongo – ku tumbuluka, ku kula, ku fikelela timakete tintshwa, ku tumbuluxa swimakiwa swintshwa, na ku thola vatirhi vo tala.

eng: the problems in the south african economy are deep and they are structural.
tso: swiphiqo eka ikhonomi ya afrika-dzonga swi entile naswona i swa xivumbeko.

eng: when electricity supply cannot be guaranteed, when railways and ports are inefficient, when innovation is held back by a scarcity of broadband spectrum, when water quality deteriorates, companies are reluctant to invest and the economy cannot function properly.
tso: loko mphakelo wa gezi wu ta ka wu nga tiyisisiwi, loko swiporo na tihlaluko swi nga tirhi kahle, loko vutumbuluxi byi tlheriseriwa endzhaku hi ku kala ka mphakelo wa inthanete wo angarhela, loko risima ra mati ri ehla, tikhamphani ti nga naveli ku vekisa kutani ikhonomi yi nga ka yi nga tirhi hi mfanelo.

eng: with a view to addressing these challenges we are accelerating the implementation of far-reaching structural reforms to modernise and transform these industries, unlock investment, reduce costs and increase competitiveness and growth.
tso: hi xikongomelo xa ololoxa mitlhontlho leyi hi le ku hatlisiseni ku simekiwa ka miantswiso ya xivumbeko leyi nga ta pfuna swinene ku endla swilo swi va ximanguvalawa na ku cinca tiindasitiri leti, ku pfulela vuvekisi, ku yisa mitsengo ehansi na ku tlakusa miphikizano na ku kula.

eng: the electricity crisis is one of the greatest threats to economic and social progress.
tso: xirilo xa gezi hi yin’wana ya mixungeto leyikulu eka ikhonomi na ku humelela ka vaaki.

eng: in the last few days, we have once again been reminded of the fragility of our electricity system.
tso: eka masiku mangarimangani lama hundzeke, hi tlhele nakambe hi tsundzuxiwa hi ku nga tiyanga ka sisiteme ya hina ya gezi.

eng: load shedding continues to have a huge impact on the lives of all south africans, disrupting business activities, and placing additional strains on families and communities.
tso: ku timiwa ka gezi hi ku siyerisana swi ya emahlweni swi va ni nkhumbo lowukulu eka vutomi bya vanhu hinkwavo va afrika-dzonga, ku kavanyeta migingiriko ya mabindzu, na ku tlhandlekela ntshikelelo wun’wana eka mindyangu na miganga.

eng: due to our aging power stations, poor maintenance, policy missteps and the ruinous effects of state capture, our country has a shortfall of around 4000 mw of electricity.
tso: hikokwalaho ka vukhale bya switichi swa hina swa gezi, nhlayiso wo tsana, swihoxo swa tipholisi na switandzhaku swo onhiwa hi ku tekiwa ka vulawuri bya mfumo hi va le handle, tiko ra ka hina ri ni nkayivelo wa kwalomu ka 4000 mw ta gezi.

eng: during the past year, we have taken firm steps to bring additional generation capacity online as quickly as possible to close the shortfall.
tso: eka lembe leri hundzeke, hi tekile magoza mo tiya ku tisa vuswikoti bya ku endla gezi ro engetela byi tirha kahle ku pfala nkayivelo.

eng: as a result, several new energy generation projects will be coming online over the next few years.
tso: hikokwalaho, tiphurojeke to endla gezi tintshwa hlayanyana ti ta va ti tirha eka malembe mangarimangani lama taka.

eng: this includes:in addition to closing the energy supply shortfall, we are implementing fundamental changes to the structure of the electricity sector.
tso: tona ti katsa:ku engetela eka ku pfala ku lahlekeriwa hi mphakelo wa eneji, hi le ku simekeni ka ku cinca ka nkoka eka xivumbeko xa sekitara ya gezi.

eng: eskom has established a separate transmission subsidiary, and is on track to complete its unbundling by december 2022. the utility has continued with its intensive maintenance programme, to reverse many years of neglected maintenance and underperformance of existing plants.
tso: eskom yi tumbuluxile rhavi ra xifambiso xa gezi ro hambana, naswona yi le ndleleni ya kahle ku fikisa emakumu ku hambanisa ka yona hi n’wendzamhala hi 2022. khamphani leyi yi yile emahlweni ni nongoloko wa wona wo hlayisa hi vurhonwana, ku tlherisa endzhaku malembe mo tala ma ku honisiwa ka nhlayiso na matirhelo ya le hansi ya tipulanti leti nga kona.

eng: to regulate all of these reforms, cabinet yesterday approved amendments to the electricity regulation act, 2006 (act of 2006) for public comment.
tso: ku lawula ka miantswiso leyi hinkwayo, tolo khabinete yi pasise ku mihundzuluxo ya nawu wo lawula gezi, 2006 (nawu wa 2006) leswaku vaaki va nyika mavonelo.

eng: these far-reaching amendments will enable a competitive market for electricity generation and the establishment of an independent state-owned transmission company.
tso: mihundzuluxo leyo pfuna swinene yi ta kotisa mphikizano wa makete lowu phikizanaka eka ku endliwa ka gezi na ku tumbuluxiwa ka khamphani ya xifambiso xa gezi ya mfumo leyi tiyimelaka.

eng: our economy cannot grow without efficient ports and railways.
tso: ikhonomi ya hina yi nga ka yi nga kuli handle ka swiporo na tihlaluko leswi tirhaka kahle.

eng: over several years, the functioning of our ports has declined relative to ports in other parts of the world and on the african continent.
tso: eka malembe yo talanyana, ku tirha ka tihlaluko ta ka hina ku ehlile loko ku fananisiwa na tihlaluko ta le ka swiphemu swin’wana swa misava na le ka tikokulu ra afrika.

eng: this constrains economic activity.
tso: leswi swi tshikelela migingiriko ya ikhonomi.

eng: the agricultural sector, for example, relies heavily on efficient, well-run ports to export their produce to overseas markets.
tso: sekitara ya vurimi, tanihi xikombiso, yi tshembela swinene eka tihlaluko leti fambisiwaka kahle, leti tirhaka hi ku hatlisa ku rhumela swirin’wa swa yona eka timakete ta le ntsungeni wa malwandle.

eng: fresh produce cannot wait for days and even weeks stuck in a terminal.
tso: swirin’wa swintshwa swi nga ka swi nga yimi masiku mo hlaya na hambi mavhiki swi khwekerile eswitichini.

eng: this hurts businesses and compromises our country’s reputation as an exporter of quality fresh produce.
tso: leswi swi vavisa mabindzu na ku vevukisa vito lerinene ra tiko ra ka hina tanihi murhumeli wa le matikweni mambe wa swirin’wa swa risimatransnet yi le ku ololoxeni ka mitlhontlho leyi naswona sweswi yi kongomisile eka ku antswisa matirhelo yo hatlisa etihlalukweni hi xava switirhisiwa swo engetela na ku simeka tisisiteme tintshwa ku hunguta ntlimbano.

eng: transnet is addressing these challenges and is currently focused on improving operational efficiencies at the ports through procuring additional equipment and implementing new systems to reduce congestion.
